jobs.title: Associate Product Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Associate Product Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Management

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Associate Product Manager

As an Associate Product Manager, you will be given access to unparalleled resources within Google to grow and develop both personally and professionally. Your responsibilities will include helping to define product vision and strategy and working with world-class engineers to execute it. This role focuses on breadth and rotation and is intended for candidates with up to three years of full-time work experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand and analyze user needs.
  • Research markets and competitors.
  • Work with engineers to define products.
  • Build and launch new products and features.
  • Define product vision and future direction.

Requirements:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field (MS a plus).
  • Demonstrated capacity for developing and understanding strategy.
  • Outstanding organizational and analytical skills.
  • Strong technical abilities.
  • Passion for new technologies.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Director of Product Management, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Director of Product Management, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Management

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Director of Product Management, Google Fiber

Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds to the home. Why join the Google Fiber team? Because we’ve got some ambitions. On March 29th and May 17th we announced that we’re starting to build our ultra-high speed network in Kansas City, KS and Kansas City, MO, respectively. We’d love for you to join us in helping to re-shape and revolutionize the way people connect to the web!

As the Director of Product Management, you will be responsible for defining and delivering the Google Fiber product offerings and for the success of these products in the marketplace.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the overall success of Google Fiber's offerings
  • Lead the product strategy, design and architecture efforts by directing internal and external engineering to deliver the products, collaborating with marketing to bring the product to market and coordinating with service delivery for on-going support.
  • Manage and mentor a team of product managers while leading the product organization.
  • Define the architecture and design for the the product offerings including product strategy, the business plan, and overall market positioning.
  • Establish partnerships across the industry, as necessary, to develop an eco-system for the gigabit applications and for the consumer devices required to access these applications.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 10 years of experience in a senior product management, engineering and technology strategy role.
  • 10 years of experience in the consumer facing telecom or internet application space.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or Ph.D. degree
  • Experience working with external companies and partners.
  • Experience building and managing medium sized teams.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.
  • Strong track record as an industry thought leader who possesses the ability to lead industry organizations.
Apply now

jobs.title: Doodler - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Doodler - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Doodler

First impressions matter. Every day, hundreds of millions of online users visit the Google homepage. Yes, to search. But also, to be delighted, informed, and surprised (And maybe even to laugh a little). The Google Doodle makes this possible -- it's the change that is constant on Google.com. As a Product Graphic Designer/Illustrator, more commonly known as a "Doodler," you have the world's best platform to showcase your stylistic skills -- as well as your sense of humor, love of all things historical and imaginative artistry. From Jules Verne to Pac-Man, you have the reins to our brand and iconic logo and can run free with your innovative ideas. Go forth and doodle!

Responsibilities:

  • Draw, design, and/or animate the highly visible Google homepage doodles.
  • Come up with consistently excellent creative ideas within the constraints of the our logo.
  • Manage complex collaborative projects from idea, to executive pitches, to final execution in a fast-paced environment.
  • Design illustrations both digitally and traditionally and in a wide range of artistic styles with great attention to detail.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BFA. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Freehand illustration skills and a wide range of artistic styles.
  • Ability to translate conceptual direction into amazing works of art.
  • Ability to work collaboratively and apply creative feedback in a team environment.
  • Comfort with digital and traditional media.
  • Knowledge of animation fundamentals.
  • Online portfolio/reel.
Apply now

jobs.title: Partner Development Manager, Android - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Partner Development Manager, Android - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Partner Development Manager, Android

As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.

Android Market is growing at a rapid pace, serving millions of Android users, both new and existing, with apps that are innovative, useful and entertaining. You will be part of the Android Content Recruitment team, focused on strategic partner outreach and category management for Android Market.

Responsibilities:

  • As a content expert, set strategy and take ownership in growing specific app categories in Google Play
  • Manage and grow relationship with strategic partners at a VP and C-level
  • Provide latest best practices to strategic partners in building apps for Android and taking advantage of unique Android platform features
  • Define partnership strategies and execute go-to-market plans
  • Provide feedback and market intelligence to internal stakeholders to identify product gaps and requirements

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree (or in lieu of degree, 10 years of relevant work experience)
  • 6 years of relevant work experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA with a technical bachelor's degree
  • Relevant work experience at a start-up or an established company in any of these roles: business development, product management, corporate strategy, or consulting
  • Proven experience working with partners, ideally in the media or internet industries. Demonstrated ability to influence all levels of management, cross-functionally and externally.
  • Strategic thinker; able to solve complex problems and develop creative solutions
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid and collaborative environment
Apply now

jobs.title: Partner Manager, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Partner Manager, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Partnerships

There's always more information out there, and our Partnerships team works to get it. We develop relationships with a range of organizations, from content providers to publishers, and find ways for them to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. We find great content for our products, and we also work with partner sites to syndicate our own Google products. From negotiating agreements to solving technical problems for partners, we're in pursuit of gathering the world's information.

The role: Partner Manager, Google Fiber

Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for striking and negotiating deals with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line, building pipeline, negotiating deals and helping partners build sales and account management functions. You also manage revenue creation and growth with our partners as part of our next generation of product launches. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players help shape great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.

As a Partner Manager, you'll build and maintain strategic relationships with many of our top partners. This means you'll manage existing partnerships, launch new relationships, and negotiate renewals and larger deals. Your responsibilities will include analyzing and tracking key metrics to identify trends, managing revenue flow and growth, driving new business opportunities, and resolving business issues. You bring strong relationship-building skills, proven experience in negotiating and closing strategic partnerships and renewals, the ability to clarify and summarize complex issues, and strong attention to detail. You also possess superior analytical skills regarding contractual, technical, and financial issues with partners and the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain strong direct relationships with key partners.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to structure and execute business initiatives, develop work plans, lead analysis, and develop and communicate final recommendations.
  • Negotiate renewals and contract enhancements with senior-level executives, and work with attorneys to close agreements.
  • Analyze and track key metrics to identify trends and highlight issues.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 6 years of work experience, including 3 years of related partner management experience at a content provider.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong understanding of the media space, and related business models.
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop thoughtful recommendations and action plans.
  • Ability to interpret legal documents, negotiate contracts and work with attorneys to complete agreements.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Apply now

Share on:

  • Share this job via Linkedin

jobs.title: Product Management Leader, Enterprise - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Management Leader, Enterprise - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or New York, NY.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Product Management Leader, Enterprise

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable revenue streams. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you can be part of shaping Google's next game-changer.

Through your leadership, you'll leverage your technical expertise to identify setbacks and roadblocks within a project and generate solutions for resolving them quickly, build and manage a product team to recruit the best-suited engineers, and evaluate feedback from support teams to identify product errors and gaps. You'll also work closely with senior Googlers in support of your product.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify market opportunities and define product vision and strategy.
  • Develop and launch new products and enhance existing products. Lead and mentor a team of Product Managers.
  • Engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule.
  • Establish partnerships as necessary to drive the growth of Google's products.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 10 years product management or product design experience, including experience managing a team and developing internet or media products and technologies.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements and convert them into a winning product vision.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to evangelize Google's products internally and externally.
  • Experience building and managing medium sized teams.
  • Strong track record as an industry thought leader who possesses the ability to lead industry organizations.
  • Strong product management experience with a good record of creating innovative and award winning Internet products.
Apply now

Share on:

  • Share this job via Linkedin

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

jobs.title: Product Management, Mobile Commerce - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Management, Mobile Commerce - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Commerce and Local

There's always more information out there, and often, the information that matters most is what's nearest to you. The Commerce and Local team is made up of our geography and e-commerce experts. When we're not mapping the Amazon rainforest, we're helping you buy a bike, recommending the best slice of pizza within pedaling distance, providing directions on how to get there, and letting you pay for it via your phone. From Google Maps and Google Places to Google Offers and Google Wallet, the Commerce and Local team helps our users navigate the world around them.

The role: Product Management, Mobile Commerce

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable revenue streams. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you can be part of shaping Google's next game-changer.

You are excited about creating disruptive products that revolutionize how people pay on mobile phones, by delivering magical user experience. Google Wallet team is leading the next revolution in payments. Your mission is to set the standard for mobile payments, and become the leading way to pay on mobile phones. You focus on mobile commerce scenarios for physical goods and services. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to work with world-class engineers and partner with various Google properties across Search, Commerce and Social to create amazing products for consumers and merchants.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify market opportunities, competitive landscape and define winning product vision and strategy.
  • Own definition and development of new and enhanced products from concept through launch
  • Interact with world-class engineers and cross-functional teams across Google to deliver innovative mobile payments products

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of relevant work experience.
  • Prior product design experience, including in collaboration with stakeholders across internal and external organizations.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS, MBA or PhD.
  • 3 years of Product Management experience; experience in mobile products.
  • Knowledge and experience of payments/financial sector space.
  • Experience and expertise working on merchant and end-consumer facing products.
  • Strong communication skills with ability to evangelize your vision across senior leaders, peers and external and internal partners.
  • Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements and convert them into a winning product vision.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Product Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is located in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Development

The Product Development team ensures that Google has the best worldwide product offerings by analyzing, positioning, packaging, and promoting our solutions across a variety of countries and markets where Google does business. The team is responsible for the product throughout the execution cycle, and works closely with the engineering group to continuously improve systems, processes, and production.

The role: Product Manager

Do you have a passion for creating great products? Google's product management team is looking for talented, ambitious, self-directed technologists to guide our products from conception to launch. If you’re eager to improve information access for millions of people and have a proven track record of excellence, we have projects waiting for you! As a Google product manager, your responsibilities will include gathering requirements, helping to define a product vision and strategy, and working with world-class engineers to execute it.

Opportunities exist in all areas of the company, including:

  • Search and consumer web products
  • Ads and monetization
  • Mobile products
  • Software and hardware infrastructure
  • Internal applications
  • Geo products
  • Developer programs
  • Trust, safety and security
  • Billing and payments

  • Experience developing Internet products and technologies

jobs.title: Product Manager, Access Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Access Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Product Manager, Access Strategy

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable revenue streams. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you can be part of shaping Google's next game-changer.

With your technical expertise, you'll identify setbacks and roadblocks within a project and generate solutions for resolving them quickly, build a product team in collaboration with a technical lead in order to recruit the best-suited engineers, and evaluate feedback from support teams to identify product errors and gaps.

As a Product Manager within the Access Strategy team, you will lead complex, multi-disciplinary software engineering projects that integrate seamlessly within Google’s data infrastructure and interface with the world’s communications systems and devices. You will plan requirements with internal teams and external partners and execute projects to meet those goals. You will usher the projects through the entire project lifecycle. This position is based in Mountain View.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage engineering and operational project/program teams in the design, test and deployment of Google Access projects.
  • Manage products through release cycle within Google interfacing with legal, operations, security and marketing.
  • Engage with Google partners including device and chip vendors, venues, service providers, database administrators and regulators
  • Set and achieve challenging goals and build trust and influence across teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related field of study. In lieu of degree, 7 years relevant work experience.
  • 5 years experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary software development and/or wireless technology projects.
  • Knowledge of wireless communications systems, software and operations.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 10 years relevant work experience, 8 years industry experience.
  • Entrepreneurial experience.
  • Experience working within access ecosystem, such as wireless communications equipment or silicon vendor, service provider, or regulator.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with and manage multiple external partners and customers.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.
Apply now

jobs.title: Product Manager, Chrome OS (Hardware) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Chrome OS (Hardware) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Chrome OS

Google Chrome OS is an open source, lightweight operating system designed for speed, simplicity and security. The Chrome OS Partner Solutions team is dedicated to developing and managing the largest and most strategic technical partnerships for Chrome OS. We manage the hardware/software integration and product delivery for all partners in the growing Chrome OS ecosystem. We build innovative solutions to help our team and partners achieve product excellence at scale, fostering long-term relationships and bringing world-changing technology to market.

The role: Product Manager, Chrome OS (Hardware)

You will be a member of a dynamic product team committed to creating the best possible experience from Chrome OS and the devices it ships upon for a variety of use cases. The role involves working closely with hardware engineers, software engineers and ODMs/OEMs to design, build and launch high quality products which take advantage of both server-side performance and client-side flexibility in hardware. Specifically, you will drive core product development in the lower part of the stack, namely device hardware and the software & firmware which drive that hardware. Please refer to links below for further information on the product:

http://www.chromium.org/chromium-os

http://www.google.com/chromebook/

As a PM, you will partner with engineering to define new products as well as enhance & scale existing products, with the end goal being to delight our users and improve information access for millions of people globally. Responsibilities will range from product conception through launch, and include gathering product requirements, defining product vision, creating preliminary design concepts, and working closely with engineering to implement and iterate. On the business side, your responsibilities will include defining the product strategy, positioning, and all elements related to the business case.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage a product roadmap to support Chrome OS goals and strategies. Interface with multiple hardware ODMs/OEMs and component manufacturers to ensure successful implementation.
  • Create preliminary design concepts, and work with engineering to implement and iterate them.
  • Initiate and prioritize projects within engineering, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods, track product development and develop product launch plans.
  • Develop the product strategy, go-to-market plans, positioning, messaging and all elements related to the business case.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or a related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of relevant work experience.
  • Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or Ph.D.
  • Experience in the consumer electronics industry, including working with component manufacturers and OEMs/ODMs through device production cycles on the product, process or engineering sides.
  • Knowledgeable across many functional areas - product management, engineering, design, sales, customer support, finance, marketing.
  • Fast learner, with the ability to not only absorb but quickly improve an idea, process or design on the fly.
  • Distinctive problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills with the ability to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Product Manager, Chrome Web Media Platform (Hardware) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Chrome Web Media Platform (Hardware) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or Kirkland, WA.

The area: Product

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Product Manager, Chrome Web Media Platform (Hardware)

You will be a member of a dynamic product team committed to making Chrome the best browser in the industry. With browsers now supporting a large subset of HTML5, it's become increasingly popular for developers to write web applications instead of using Win32 or Cocoa, so they get the broadest possible reach. There are numerous recent examples of apps and games using WebGL and Canvas 2D. Still, there is a lot more work to do to increase the performance and capability of the web platform, particularly in the area of hardware acceleration of media components. In this role, you will help plan and manage the development of hardware designs as well as hardware/software integration and product delivery with partners in the growing Chrome web media ecosystem.

As the hardware PM, you will be responsible for the helping to ensure that robust hardware support exists for all aspects of the web media platform, including by: working with Google’s international hardware IP design teams; gathering product requirements; defining product vision through close interaction with internal teams and partners; creating preliminary design concepts; and working closely with engineering to implement and iterate. On the business side, your responsibilities will include defining the product strategy, positioning, interacting with partners, helping craft marketing messaging, and all elements related to the business case. The role requires working closely with engineers, hardware vendors, and OEMs/ODMs to assess and prioritize features and requirements.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage a hardware product roadmap to support Chrome web media platform goals and strategies. Interface with multiple hardware ODMs/OEMs and component manufacturers to ensure successful implementation.
  • Create preliminary design concepts, and work with engineering to implement and iterate them.
  • Work proactively with diverse teams to identify and assist with problems that can benefit from hardware solutions; think creatively about innovative solutions to HW bottlenecks.
  • Initiate and prioritize projects within engineering, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods, track product development and develop product launch plans.
  • Develop the product strategy, go-to-market plans, positioning, messaging and all elements related to the business case. Occasional travel, up to 20-25%

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or a related technical field (In lieu of degree, 10 years relevant work experience).
  • Strong understanding of HW/SW/embedded firmware/manufacturing interdependencies and needs during the planning, development and testing stages.
  • Ability to foresee potential problems and have contingencies/mitigation plans in place prior to occurrence.
  • Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering
  • Experience in the semiconductor or consumer electronics industry, including working with component manufacturers and OEMs/ODMs through device production cycles on the product, process or engineering sides.
  • 8 years relevant work experience; 5+ years of experience designing FPGA's and ASIC's using Verilog/VHDL, including 2+ years as technical lead or management experience.
  • Knowledgeable across many functional areas - product management, engineering, design, sales, customer support, finance, marketing.
  • Fast learner, with the ability to not only absorb but quickly improve an idea, process or design on the fly.
  • Distinctive problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills with the ability to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Apply now

  • Share this job via Linkedin

jobs.title: Product Manager, Corporate Engineering - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Corporate Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Management

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Product Manager, Corporate Engineering

Google is looking for flexible, results-oriented, and self-motivated technologists to help drive Corporate Engineering's solutions from inception through launch and iterations. Your responsibilities will be to ensure that products launch on time with the best feature set possible. Your goal is to identify innovative technical insights, solicit and prioritize diverse stakeholder requests in the context of our strategy, negotiate conflicting interests, communicate broadly to thousands of internal stakeholders and users, and deliver solutions that exceed expectations. You will need to find ways to minimize the use of traditional packaged server applications through a mix of SaaS services, Cloud-sourcing, and custom internal development on cloud platforms such as Google App Engine. As a first customer of external products that Google is developing, you will provide real-world feedback and share insights about fast, iterative enterprise development. In addition, you will help improve how enterprise applications are developed by identifying and building infrastructure components that Google and other enterprises need in order to deliver solutions and by finding opportunities to transition such infrastructure to products that will be offered externally. As Corporate Engineering’s priorities adapt, you must be willing and able to rapidly switch to whatever product requires Product Management support the most.

Opportunities exist on many systems within Corporate Engineering: Enterprise Application Infrastructure, Sourcing and Recruiting, HR, Payroll, Benefits, Mobility, Workforce Management, Learning and Development, Performance and Compensation, Finance, Reporting, Legal etc.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Build and execute product roadmaps including infrastructure necessary to support our goals that stakeholders endorse
  • Identify business improvement opportunities, define product vision and strategy, and all elements related to the business case
  • Initiate and prioritize projects within Engineering, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule
  • Break down barriers across groups to launch products and iterate – Product Management, Eng, UI, HR, Customer Support, Finance
  • Work with Engineering and clients to track and communicate product development, and to develop product launch plans

Requirements:

  • BA/BS or equivalent in Computer Science or a related engineering field; M.S. or Ph.D. is a plus
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience building complex mission critical enterprise solutions
  • Software development experience with a proven track record of product delivery. Accelerate us so we can ship twice as much, twice as fast (requires hands-on leadership)
  • Domain expertise in one or more business functions supported by Corporate Engineering, such as HR, Payroll, Finance, etc. or with ERP systems is desirable, as is experience with a Cloud offering
  • Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements across diverse functional areas and convert them into a compelling product vision
  • Understanding of Cloud/SaaS and web technologies, and willingness to embrace leading edge Google technologies while mitigating schedule risks
  • Entrepreneurial drive and ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast paced environment
Apply now

jobs.title: Product Manager, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Management

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Product Manager, Google Fiber

Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds to the home. Why join the Google Fiber team? Because we’ve got some ambitions. On March 29th and May 17th we announced that we’re starting to build our ultra-high speed network in Kansas City, KS and Kansas City, MO, respectively. We’d love for you to join us in helping to re-shape and revolutionize the way people connect to the web!

As a product manager for the Google Fiber team, you will work with the other product managers and technical leaders in delivering data offerings for Google Fiber. You’ll work with the Google Fiber team’s lead engineers, across other Google teams and external organizations to drive the launch the Google Fiber project.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the success of the Google Fiber data offerings.
  • Collaborate with our product marketing organization and other teams.
  • Responsible for the product and design requirements.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 5 years of experience working in the data and home networking domains.
  • 3 years of experience working as a product manager.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD degree.
  • Experience developing Internet products and technologies.
  • Operational experience in telecommunications.
  • Familiarity with business issues and the ability to learn quickly.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.
Apply now

jobs.title: Product Manager, Infrastructure (Compute, Storage, Networking) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Infrastructure (Compute, Storage, Networking) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product Management

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Product Manager, Infrastructure (Compute, Storage, Networking)

Google is looking for talented, results-oriented, and self-directed technologists to help drive our Infrastructure solutions from inception through launch and iterations. Google Product Managers combine a great instinct for developing compelling products with a strong academic background and the technical aptitude as well as the business sense to gather requirements, help define a product vision and strategy, and work with world-class engineers to execute it. Google's infrastructure turns ideas and code into awe-inspiring products and services for the world. The Infrastructure products span Compute, Storage and Networking. As an Infrastructure Product Manager, you will see far out into the needs of future users whether for massively scalable underlying services, planet-scale data-management or an amazingly fast and efficient internet. The focus will be on users, features, strategy, economics and policy to help reinvent the future with even more powerful infrastructure capabilities.

Responsibilities:

  • Define product vision and strategy, build and execute product roadmaps to support our goals that users endorse
  • Gather and publish functional requirements for specific features (e.g. consistency model, query interfaces, APIs, QPS, storage needs, latency and performance characteristics)
  • Drive engineering to build a cost model, identifying fixed and variable costs of running a service and lead engineering and platforms to reduce costs
  • Work with engineering and clients to implement, iterate, track and communicate product development as well as developing Product launch plans
  • Be the voice of the product to users, executives, partners and as needed the media as well

Requirements:

  • BA/BS preferred in Computer Science or a related engineering field; M.S. or Ph.D is a plus
  • At least 5 years of management experience in building and scaling complex, mission critical solutions
  • Hands-on software development experience with a proven track record of relevant product delivery, such as operating systems, device drivers, storage, networking, embedded or other low level technologies
  • Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements across diverse product areas and convert them into a compelling product vision
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical, people and organizational management skills
Apply now

jobs.content:
Product Manager, Platform, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.

The role: Product Manager, Platform, Google Fiber

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable revenue streams. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you can be part of shaping Google's next game-changer.

As a product manager for the Advanced Technology Group inside the Google Fiber team, you will work with the other product managers and technical leaders in defining the system platform to deliver symmetric true 1Gb/s access bandwidth for next generation Internet applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with lead engineers and architects to define features, requirements and milestones of next generation access network platforms.
  • Collaborate with our network engineering and network management teams.
  • Responsible for the product cycle management.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field with an emphasis in telecommunications or networking. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 3 years of experience working as a product manager.
  • 5 years of experience working as an equipment vendor.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or Ph.D degree.
  • Experience in developing consumer network electronics products.
  • Operational experience in telecommunications.
  • Experience in developing enterprise class equipment.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.

There's always more information out there, and often, the information that matters most is what's nearest to you. The Commerce and Local team is made up of our geography and e-commerce experts. When we're not mapping the Amazon rainforest, we're helping you buy a bike, recommending the best slice of pizza within pedaling distance, providing directions on how to get there, and letting you pay for it via your phone. From Google Maps and Google Places to Google Offers and Google Wallet, the Commerce and Local team helps our users navigate the world around them.

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. jobs.title: Android Interaction Designer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Android Interaction Designer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Mobile

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Our open-source Android operating system has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering hundreds of devices from smartphones to tablets. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.

The role: Android Interaction Designer

The mantra of the the User Interface (UI) team is: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." As a UI Designer, you have a strong technical background and work closely with Engineers and Product Managers to design products that are simple but great for the user, focusing on interaction and visual design. Using your keen design aesthetic you design and conduct experiments with real users so that improvements to the user experience are based on real user behavior. Your job is to make sure that our products are intuitive, accessible and usable to our millions of users.

You design and lead the UI construction for complex projects with a broad scope and evolving objectives. You contribute to the overall product strategy through concept generation, prototyping and collaboration with with UX team to promote feature integration, as well as working with researchers to design user experiments to test your designs.

Please send URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume and cover letter. Submissions without a portfolio will not be considered.

Responsibilities:

  • Help define the user experience for the Android platform and Android applications
  • Create documentation that enables Android developers to build software that fosters a delightful user experience
  • Act as the primary driver and coordinator for the design team
  • Collaborate with researchers, visual designers, prototypers, product managers and software engineers
  • Participate in regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in human-computer interaction or a related field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • 3 years of experience designing software interfaces

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficiency with the basic software tools of the trade; mobile software experience
  • Detailed and practical understanding of best practices in user experience design
  • Outstanding verbal and written communications skills
  • Good project management and implementation skills
  • The ability to juggle multiple projects on tight deadlines without compromising quality
  • A positive, enthusiastic attitude and the ambition to tackle the biggest problems in computing
Apply now

jobs.content:
Android Visual Designer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: User Experience

We follow a simple but vital premise in the User Experience group: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." We're passionately interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The User Experience team is a critical driving force behind gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, copywriters and Web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

The role: Android Visual Designer

As a Visual Designer focusing on Google's Android mobile platform you will work closely with engineers and product managers throughout all stages of the product cycle to create compelling, coherent and user friendly designs. Top candidates will be critical thinkers with the ability to express concepts verbally and visually and refine them through to final production artwork. Successful candidates will be able to have an impact on the mobile experience of millions of Android users.

Please send URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume and cover letter. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered. red.

Responsibilities:

  • Translate user feedback and business requirements into onscreen hand-held device and web user interfaces.
  • Deliver preliminary mockups, pie-in-the sky mockups and final mockups.
  • Ensure the coherent visual presentation of several Android touch-points on devices and on the broader Internet.
  • Contribute to the continuing development of the Android visual style.
  • Develop new approaches to complex design problems and convey ideas in tangible and aesthetically refined forms.

Requirements:

  • A BA, BFA or higher degree in formal visual design is preferred.
  • Solid knowledge of Adobe Fireworks, Photoshop and Illustrator is required; a working knowledge of Adobe Flash, After Effects, CSS and HTML is a plus.
  • A solid understanding of hand-held device/web graphics techniques and production practices.
  • A solid understanding of user-centered design principles.
  • Strong creative and visual skills; the ability to explain your thinking; strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work independently and with a group.
  • Supreme attention to detail and a demonstrated mastery of typography, color, and page layout.
  • A penchant for doing great work and a passion for wanting to delight the Android community.

jobs.title: Quantitative User Experience Researcher - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Quantitative User Experience Researcher - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: User Experience

We follow a simple but vital premise in the User Experience group: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." We're ardently interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The User Experience team is a critical driving force behind gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, copywriters and Web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

The role: Quantitative User Experience Researcher

In this position you will use your analytical skills to find ways to improve the user experience of Google's offerings worldwide. Using your technical and leadership abilities, you will develop new success metrics, identify user experience trouble spots and chart the impact of the changes. You will work closely with product and engineering teams, and your findings will lead directly to making our users happier, the key to Google's success. Researcher have an outstanding record of technical contributions in the analysis of user experience problems; while experience as a manager is a plus, it is not required.

You should have a history of working with large scale quantitative data sets, live experiments or other methods that help insight-driven user research scale to meet the needs of a large company with millions of users. You have significant domain specialization in one or more areas. These areas include programming skills related to data extraction or understanding how digital products are instrumented (e.g. Python, C++, Perl, Java), or to the development of online services (e.g. HTML, CSS, Java Script). Other technical specialties might include the creation of visual dashboards for understanding trends, experience in working with SQL databases, or other experience related to online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, live testing, context-sensitive survey techniques). More important than knowledge of any specific technology, researchers have a strong, well developed interest in using large-scale research techniques to understand users of digital products and services.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with engineering and product teams to help define user experience goals and metrics.
  • Identify quantitative markers of user experience.
  • Help drive change by communicating findings to stakeholders in the company

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Statistics, Psychology or a related field (in lieu of degree, 4 years relevant experience).
  • 2 years in an applied research setting that demonstrates your abilities, including a significant degree of specialization within one or more domains

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years relevant work experience.
  • A track record demonstrating excellent command of the research questions within a given domain, and of the technical tools for the analysis of data related to those questions.
  • Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Apply now

jobs.title: User Experience Design Manager, Payments - Mountain View
jobs.content:
User Experience Design Manager, Payments - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Commerce and Local

There's always more information out there, and often, the information that matters most is what's nearest to you. The Commerce and Local team is made up of our geography and e-commerce experts. When we're not mapping the Amazon rainforest, we're helping you buy a bike, recommending the best slice of pizza within pedaling distance, providing directions on how to get there, and letting you pay for it via your phone. From Google Maps and Google Places to Google Offers and Google Wallet, the Commerce and Local team helps our users navigate the world around them.

The role: User Experience Design Manager, Payments

The mantra of the the User Interface (UI) team is: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." As a UI Designer, you have a strong technical background and work closely with Engineers and Product Managers to design products that are simple but great for the user, focusing on interaction and visual design. Using your keen design aesthetic you design and conduct experiments with real users so that improvements to the user experience are based on real user behavior. Your job is to make sure that our products are intuitive, accessible and usable to our millions of users.

As a recognized expert in your field, you use your leadership skills to manage multiple teams and projects across multiple geographies and lead the overall design of a complex and evolving products. You have a major impact and take active role in defining the user experience across major product lines.

The Google Commerce organization is seeking a Design Manager of Payments (and Billing). As mobile, local, and social trends converge in the next chapter of eCommerce, we are looking for an innovative big-thinker, to help us develop and realize a user experience vision for revolutionizing how people shop and pay online and offline. In the past few thousand years, the way we pay has changed just three times—from coins, to paper money, to plastic cards. Now we’re on the brink of the next big shift. Earlier this year, we launched Google Wallet - an application that allows users to pay for day-to-day transactions by tapping a terminal with their phone, instantly redeeming saved offers and coupons. Eventually your loyalty cards, gift cards, receipts, boarding passes, tickets, even your keys will be seamlessly synced to your Google Wallet. And, this is just the beginning of our vision for Payments and Billing. Accordingly, our ideal candidate will be a systems-level design thinker and visionary - with strong user-instincts and outstanding design and brand intuition - who will provide leadership and direction setting to a team of designers, researchers, and prototypers. Their primary objective will be to ensure an unparalleled user experience that enables users (both merchants and consumers) to effortlessly interface with our growing suite of payment/billing instruments in the most elegant, efficient, and enjoyable way possible. We’re looking for someone with an uncanny sense for simplifying complexity, and creating elegant, mainstream presentations of otherwise expansive content and complex workflows. An unfailing capacity to advocate on behalf of our users is a must; the role will significantly influence the experience (and culture) of our rapidly growing user base, by optimizing their ability to sell/purchase products and services in a variety of locations, across a number of device types. Because the scope of the role is likely to extend across a manifold of customer types, devices, and applications, it is critical that the candidate have a strong sense for product branding, and the capacity for reinforcing that brand by enabling it throughout a myriad of user experience touchpoints.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship for a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, and prototypers; lead creative and holistic thinking across diverse product releases, platforms, and devices.
  • Deliver a UX vision for Payments and Billing, along with a plan for evolutionary, iterative updates, that actualize the larger vision over time , and collaborate with other design leads and managers to architect the integration of Payments into a near and long term UX vision for global Commerce.
  • Foster Google’s culture and principles within the group, while setting new standards in executional and operational excellence, and build strong relationships and operating rhythms with leaders inside and outside of Payments, to efficiently implement user experiences that are cohesive, inclusive, and well-informed.
  • Responsibly and effectively advocate for users in a fast-paced, corporate climate, imparting day-to-day design leadership that fosters a shared understanding of the user-centric intersection between design, content, business, and engineering.
  • Recruit, assess, hire, develop, and retain an organization of outstanding UX personnel.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in Human-Computer Interaction (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience).
  • 8+ Years of experience in Interface Design, Interaction Design, or Information Architecture.
  • 3+ years managing or leading teams.
  • Proven experience designing web and mobile applications, and fluency in best practices for user-centered interface and interaction design.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with payment/transactional systems and mobile devices.
  • A portfolio or work samples showcasing UX prowess, creativity, and depth of thought coupled with a clean design aesthetic; an aptitude and honed intuition for tasteful designs that are visually engaging.
  • A general knowledge of how design impacts engineering and vice versa, along with a knack for constructing, interactive designs that are technically feasible/prudent, and an innate capacity for simplifying complexity, and converting intimidating UIs and workflows into mainstream, widely-palatable experiences.
  • Masterful communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex interaction concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization along with a proven effectiveness in working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work.
  • An innovative spirit and an enduring sense of humor, and the ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, and multi-task in an agile environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: User Experience Researcher - Mountain View
jobs.content:
User Experience Researcher - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: User Experience

We follow a simple but vital premise in the User Experience group: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." We're ardently interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The User Experience team is a critical driving force behind gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, copywriters and Web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

The role: User Experience Researcher

The User Experience Research team is a critical driving force behind design. Researchers are skilled in a wide range of quantitative and qualitative methodologies, such as design and analysis of live experiments, remote usability benchmarking, field studies, and other traditional user experience research methods. You will be responsible for all phases of the research process, from project conception, to implementation, to development of recommendations and evangelism. You will work closely with design, product, and engineering teams, and your findings will lead directly to making our users happier, the key to Google's success.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of how users experience online search.
  • Collect and analyze user behavior through server logs, online experiments (A/B testing), benchmark studies, lab studies, and surveys.
  • Work with designers, product managers, engineers, and research managers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
  • Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
  • Evangelize research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.

Requirements:

  • An advanced degree preferred in computer science, human computer interaction, cognitive science, experimental psychology, anthropology, information science or related field.
  • At least 3 years of work experience in an applied research setting. Internet, search, and advertising experiences are a plus.
  • Experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices
  • Experience with SQL, Python, SPSS and remote usability testing tools, such as Keynote or UserZoom, is a plus.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and collaborate skills.
  • Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
  • Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Apply now

jobs.title: User Experience Researcher, Google TV - Mountain View
jobs.content:
User Experience Researcher, Google TV - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: YouTube and Video

The first video posted on YouTube was a 19-second clip called "Me at the Zoo." Today, more than 48 hours of video are uploaded every minute. The YouTube and Video team helps budding filmmakers and musicians build careers, creates products like Google TV and YouTube Live and runs collaborative projects like Life in a Day and the YouTube Symphony Orchestra. We are leading a change in how we entertain, inform and share with one another, whether through cat videos or footage of a revolution in progress.

The role: User Experience Researcher, Google TV

The User Experience (UX) team follows a simple premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." UX Researchers strive to learn what they need and want from our products and services. As a UX Researcher, You conduct independent research, analyze real user behavior and work with User Interface Designers, Products Manager and Engineers to improve our product features and develop new ones. Your work spans across all of Google's products, and you are encouraged to identify new opportunities for user experience improvements. We strive to the connect users to the magic of our products, and your job is to make that connection intuitive and accessible.

With considerable experience, you evaluate all the features contributing to user experience, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and conduct different types of user research studies, including lab-based usability studies, field studies, surveys, and usability inspections (heuristic evaluations or cognitive walkthroughs).
  • Collaborate with product teams to define and prioritize user experience research questions.
  • Ensure effective communication of research findings, including synthesizing them into workable design principles.
  • Drive product improvements based on research findings in close collaboration with UX designers, engineers, and product managers.
  • Participate in product reviews and strategic research planning.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 8 years relevant work experience, including knowledge of a wide range of UX research methods and techniques, such as lab-based usability studies, field research, usability inspections, creation of user profiles or personas, participatory design, survey research, experiment design and statistical analysis.
  • Experience with web technology and standards, mobile devices, accessibility and universal design, internationalization and localization.
  • Successful track record in one or more of the following areas: social media, enterprise and B2B applications, user generated content, online communities.
  • Excellent analytical skills, especially with regard to observation of user behavior.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; can present findings concisely and effectively.

jobs.title: User Experience Survey Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
User Experience Survey Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: User Experience

We follow a simple but vital premise in the User Experience group: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." We're ardently interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The User Experience team is a critical driving force behind gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, copywriters and Web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

The role: User Experience Survey Analyst

The User Experience team is expanding its efforts to track users’ attitudes and provide actionable insights from user surveys. You will play a critical role by analyzing survey results with appropriate statistical rigor, generating reporting to integrate with existing product dashboards, assessing the degree of nonresponse bias per survey, and modeling sources of satisfaction and dissatisfaction variance for each product. This analyst’s efforts will provide a foundation for valid, reliable satisfaction tracking, and will lead directly to making our users happier, the key to Google’s success.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute survey analyses to track users’ satisfaction over time, develop attitudinal/behavioral models, identify key user segments, and compare results between experimental groups. Communicate findings to a diverse audience.
  • Conduct analyses of survey nonresponse bias, data validity and reliability.
  • Examine relationship between users’ attitudes (survey data) and their behaviors (logfile data).
  • Work with colleagues to design and analyze experiments to inform survey methodology best practices.
  • Develop efficient reporting processes and automate routine data collection within Google's complex data infrastructure.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS with emphasis on quantitative research methods (preferably in statistics, social sciences, human-computer interaction, engineering, applied mathematics or a related field). In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 3 years professional or academic experience in quantitative analysis.
  • A track record demonstrating excellent command with statistics and statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS, Stata, SAS).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PhD with applied quantitative experience.
  • Experience with the following: modeling attitudes and behaviors, experimental design and analysis, longitudinal analysis, and assessing survey nonresponse error.
  • A track record of research within a given domain, and command of technical tools for data collection and analysis.
  • Skill in explaining statistical methods, analyses, and results to a variety of audiences.
Apply now

jobs.title: HR Manager, Engineering - Mountain View
jobs.content:
HR Manager, Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: HR Manager, Engineering

People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.

As a manager, you support team members to exercise independent thinking and make rapid progress towards goals. Working closely with your team to deliver results, you remove roadblocks and ensure that projects and tasks are appropriately resourced.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a team of HR Business Partners.
  • Provide guidance on organizational effectiveness, change management and conflict resolution, as well as provide expertise in the following areas: career planning, performance management, coaching, data analysis, compensation and rewards, employee relations, learning and development, recognition programs, and strategic development.
  • Support our global technical organization including software engineering, site reliability engineering, operations and infrastructure.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of work experience.
  • 10 years or HR experience in a high-growth, fast-paced, and changing environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree.
  • A proven leader who is strategist and practitioner with a good track record of successfully implementing people programs and initiatives.
  • Ability to influence senior leadership is essential. Proven analytical ability.
