jobs.title: Google Children's Center Teacher - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Google Children's Center Teacher - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Human Resources, Employee Child Development

The value Google places on our employees knows no bounds. We revolutionized search, and now we're redefining human resources in the way we work closely with our management teams to attract, hire, develop and reward talented people. Google's HR team which we call People Operations is focused on bringing this discipline to the next level as we continue to encourage our employees' creativity, personal growth and love of learning. We believe it's important to provide benefits to our employees' children as well. To that end, we've developed our Employee Child Development program by building high-quality children's centers located near our corporate headquarters. These family- focused centers integrate play-based philosophies into the curriculum, such as Resources for Infant Educarers (RIE), Program for Infant/Toddler Care (PITC), and the Reggio Emilia Approach. This program includes primary care-giving, small group size and staff continuity, and is designed to meet the physical, cognitive, social and emotional needs of children ages 3 months through 5 years.

The roles: Preschool and Infant/Toddler Teachers

Our high-quality, family-focused centers offer an integrated approach to infant, toddler, and preschool early care and education inspired by research-based practices and play-based philosophies. Classrooms maintain low group sizes with good teacher-to-child ratios. Preschool and Infant/Toddler Teachers provide children with individualized care, a nurturing environment and uninterrupted time for play and exploration. Teachers work collaboratively in teaching teams for each classroom.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide responsive, relationship-based care and create a stimulating environment for children.
  • Develop creative and age appropriate activities based on child's interests.
  • Create a nurturing environment for play and exploration for children.
  • Build and nurture partnerships with parents, including parent communication and involvement.
  • Work in a collaborative relationship with other staff in classroom and with management team.

Teacher III Requirements:

  • BA or BS degree in early childhood education or related field (units must include 3 units of child development for Infant/Toddler teachers).
  • California Master Teacher Child Development Permit or eligibility for permit.
  • At least 5 years of teaching experience with children ages 3 months to 3 years for Infant/Toddler Teachers III, and with children 3 years to 5 years old for Preschool Teachers III.
  • Has solid understanding of the Reggio Emilia philosophy.

Teacher II Requirements:

  • AA or AS degree in early childhood education or related field (units must include 3 units of child development for Infant/Toddler teachers).
  • California Teacher Child Development Permit or eligibility for permit.
  • At least 1 year of teaching experience with children ages 3 months to 3 years for Infant/Toddler Teachers II, and with children ages 3 years to 5 years for Preschool Teachers II.
  • Has moderate understanding of the Reggio Emilia philosophy.

Teacher I Requirements:

  • Minimum of 12 early childhood education units (units must include 3 units of child development for Infant/Toddler teachers).
  • California Associate Teacher Child Development Permit or eligibility for permit.
  • Teaching experience with children ages 3 months to 3 years for Infant/Toddler Teachers I, and with children ages 3 years to 5 years for Preschool Teachers I.
  • Has interest in learning more about the Reggio Emilia philosophy, or has a basic understanding of the Reggio Emilia philosophy.

Requirements for all Teacher positions:

  • Regular work attendance on a consistent basis to ensure coverage as well as to be available to build relationships with children and families, to work on developing and implementing a curriculum, to assess children's growth, etc. Attendance must not only be daily, but on-time each day and covering the full school day.
  • Able to work with children ranging from 4 months through 6 years of age.
  • Perform regular maintenance/cleaning tasks e.g. arranging the classroom and the yard each evening and each morning, moving light weight furniture, picking up toys, picking up boxes, emptying the contents, breaking down boxes.
  • Physical ability to interact with children, including not limited to: picking up children weighing 40 lbs, for example to change diapers or pick up a hurt child, standing for long periods, as well as being able to move freely, easily and regularly around the classroom and the play yard to supervise children, climbing or moving around on the playground equipment to help a child or children squatting, kneeling and sitting (to be at the child's level) for short and long periods to allow communication with the children in an effective manner intervening quickly in a physical way if children are in a dangerous situation or having a difficult interaction with another child.
Apply now

jobs.title: Compensation Associate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Compensation Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: Compensation Associate

Our Googlers are innovative, take big risks and get things done, and our compensation plans are designed to reward them accordingly. On the leading edge of the compensation field, our team runs cyclical cash and equity programs and takes the notion of "Total Rewards" to new heights. We always aim to better recognize outstanding performance, so as a member of this team, you're an unconventional thinker and are willing to make bold bets. You take Googlers' feedback seriously, and collect it often to continually improve and enhance our programs through a two-way dialogue. Combining data and feedback from our Googlers with the latest industry research, you make large-scale, data-driven decisions that impact Googlers in a meaningful way.

Compensation Associates assist in designing Google’s global pay philosophy, strategy, programs and communications. -- This role is suited for compensation professionals with a deep interest in analyzing data and innovative comp design strategy. You must have the ability to juggle multiple tasks, the maturity to handle sensitive information and make sound decisions, and a strong desire to manage details and deliver results. This role will focus on global base pay design.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with other Compensation team members and HR Business Partners to solve compensation-related business problems and provide compensation guidance.
  • Develop decision-based models and conduct statistical analyses for base salary.
  • Recommend compensation process improvements for effective administration.
  • Participate in the research, development and administration of assigned compensation programs and monitor the success of these programs.
  • Manage global salary budget and process.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Experience working in compensation area in a consulting firm or a corporate function where the incumbent has been involved with rigorous analysis or similar area of work.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Deep interest in analyzing data and the ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-making.
  • Exposure to one or more of the following: sales compensation, executive compensation, international compensation, short-term incentive program or reward/recognition programs.
  • Strong Excel skills.

jobs.content:
Compensation Program Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Human Resources, Compensation

Compensation is the department that sets the parameters for each major pay element at Google: salaries, bonuses and stock awards. The team ensures that Google pay, in total, meets our goal of being highly competitive with other companies. In addition to establishing both initial and ongoing rates of pay consistent with the Google philosophy, we also encourage, recognize and reward outstanding – and astounding – levels of performance.

The role: Compensation Program Manager

This role will help lead Google’s major compensation programs, which are aimed at attracting and retaining the world’s top talent. You will be a key member of Google’s compensation programs team, ensuring the success of these programs and striving for continuous improvement. You must have the ability to juggle multiple tasks, handle sensitive information, make sound business decisions, manage details, and deliver results on a company-wide scale.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with HR business partners to drive and ensure the success of Google’s compensation planning programs (e.g., merit increases, annual bonuses).
  • Lead a team of analysts to drive and ensure the success of compensation programs and strive for continuous improvement.
  • Play a governance role in the creation, negotiation, and review of compensation programs business rules.
  • Work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time efficiently.
  • Perform ad hoc analysis and planning to continuously improve our compensation programs and processes

Requirements:

  • BA or BS degree in economics, business administration or another field that uses quantitative analysis or equivalent experience (advanced degree preferred).

  • Solutions and client service-oriented, with an emphasis on creativity and relationships
  • Proven leadership skills and understanding of team dynamics.
  • Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands.

jobs.title: People Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
People Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: People Analyst

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

As a People Analyst you will work closely with a team of staffing analysts to drive critical analyses for the staffing org, including resource planning, measuring staffing effectiveness, channel effectiveness, candidate satisfaction, Googler participation in hiring process, and building tools to improve process efficiency.

Responsibilities:

  • Play a pivotal role in global strategic and operations improvement initiatives, which will include identifying issues, forming hypotheses, and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
  • Conduct data analyses, such as regressions, factor analyses, t-tests and ANOVAs.
  • Participate in evaluation, reporting and analysis to understand effectiveness of new initiatives.
  • Communicate findings and recommendations on critical initiatives and influence leaders to take action on those findings.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 2 years of analytical work, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations.
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, statistical packages and/or SQL.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities and superior analytical skills.
  • Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, and trends.

jobs.title: Sales Staffing Reporting Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Sales Staffing Reporting Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: Sales Staffing Reporting Analyst

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

Google is a data-driven company and Google Staffing is no exception. As a Reporting Analyst on the Sales Staffing team, you will use data and analytical insights to help define metrics and monitor the team's performance against a benchmark. You will build, maintain and improve hiring dashboards to be used by the Leadership Team to manage their staffing operations, through which thousands of candidates are processed each day. You will navigate our internal data systems efficiently; you'll be responsible for making sure data is consistent across multiple sources and diagnosing inconsistencies. You will pioneer new reports and will work directly with the existing Sales Staffing Analytics team to identify areas where we can improve the way we track metrics. This role is central to our success as a staffing team and your input will be used to make smart decisions about our hiring needs.

Responsibilities:

  • Play a pivotal role in designing, executing and measuring the effectiveness of global talent programs, which will include identifying issues, forming hypotheses and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
  • Conduct data analyses, such as regressions, factor analyses, t-tests and ANOVAs.
  • Develop and analyze surveys and metrics.
  • Communicate findings and recommendations on critical initiatives and influence leaders to take action on those findings.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experiences).
  • 2 years of relevant experience in an analytically-intensive role, such as management consulting, business intelligence, or corporate strategy.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MA/MS degree.
  • Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Breadth in analytics "basics": spreadsheet modeling; financial and decision analysis; working with large datasets, and basic probability and statistics (e.g., conditional probability, descriptive statistics, basic hypothesis testing, and linear regression models).

jobs.content:

Apply now

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: Employee Social Responsibility Manager

As an Employee Social Responsibility Manager, you will lead a small team and oversee new and existing programs related to employee giving, volunteering and company gift matching. You will drive Google’s company-wide skills-based volunteering program for all employees. You will partner with our Google Grants, dotorg and Community Affairs teams to collaboratively develop a unified strategy for employee social responsibility that seamlessly ties to Google's overarching philanthropic vision. Your experience building and launching new programs and developing successful marketing and communications plans will help you drive the success of the program.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive the Employee Social Responsibility vision and strategy globally and in partnership with Dotorg, Charitable Giving, Google for NonProfits, Grants, Community Affairs and other CSR teams
  • Manage the new company wide program of 1% time for Googlers (volunteering 2.5 days per year)
  • Align, manage and develop Employee Social Responsibility team resources to ensure programs deliver against the highest-impact areas and meet company-wide objectives
  • Empower team members to create and drive scalable yet impactful solutions
  • Build internal and external relationships within the philanthropic sector to best support our programs and help drive international and company-wide expansion efforts

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of experience managing a skills-based employee volunteer program.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in people management. An ability to build relationships and to influence and collaborate across departments in order to achieve objectives.
  • High level of self-initiative, creativity, perseverance, and flexibility. Exceptional interpersonal skills, strategic thinking, problem-solving skills, and a team player.
  • Ability to influence at all levels within the company
  • Networked and informed about best practices within the charitable giving and social responsibility industry

The role: People Programs Specialist (Internal Mobility), TechHR

Google is looking for an exceptional People Programs Specialist to join its TechHR Transfers team. This specialist will lead efforts to manage the Engineering transfer process, working cross-functionally with People Operations and Engineering teams and management. Working in this team provides an excellent opportunity to make an impact across a range of engineering and business groups on a global basis. The candidate is the type of person who pays excellent attention to details, has strong “customer service” skills, can be trusted to maintain a high degree of confidentiality, has superior organizational and time management skills and is able to juggle multiple tasks while meeting strict deadlines.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate data collection, scheduling, feedback for the life cycle of transfers and other resource transactions
  • Work within a team to design and implement process improvements and improve communications to expand coverage and refine the overall processes
  • Coordinate with engineering managers and directors worldwide to understand needs, collect and process feedback, provide training and guidance
  • Analyze regularly the data to verify accuracy of data entry, determine process metrics and trends
  • Build strong relationships with Engineering managers and HR Business Partners

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proven organizational and analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills, with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy
  • Self-directed, detail-oriented problem solver with a desire to have high impact on the employees’ career development and on the transfer process

At Google, we expect our products to be lightning fast, and the same is true for our internal tools. Our People Technology and Operations team is made up of architects who envision better processes, build them, reliably operate them and then continually improve upon them. As a member of the team, you think holistically about technology, about the tools themselves and the systems and processes that support them. Your projects use technology to streamline and drive processes that are essential to keeping our organization operating. You have a bias for action and impeccable execution. You're a problem solver with drive and creativity who is constantly seeking to make our processes and systems better, faster and more efficient.

  • Support internal application builds and/or vendor system implementation projects, in close collaboration with resources representing Engineering, Product Management, Security Operations and other departments

jobs.title: College Recruiter (Temporary) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
College Recruiter (Temporary) - Mountain View  

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

This is a temporary role offered through Adecco.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: College Recruiter (Temporary)

Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage candidate process and act as a candidate advocate. Evaluate skill level and manage the offer process, including reference checks, salary recommendations, offer letter generation, and offer acceptance/declines. Negotiate offers by partnering with hiring manager, senior management, and other groups as necessary.
  • Mentor and provide guidance and direction to recruiting coordinators.
  • Passion for improving the customer experience with customers broadly defined as candidates, new hires, hiring managers, and recruiters. Continuous follow-up with clients to confirm staffing plans and candidate needs are met.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree. In lieu of degree, 2 years of equivalent work experience
  • 2 years of relevant work experience gained in a corporate, start-up, or consulting organization.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated ability to develop recommendations and implement solutions to promote ongoing improvements to Google's recruitment efforts based on client needs
  • Ability to maintain confidence and professionalism when leading others through ambiguous and complex situation; influence and negotiate diplomatically and fairly with a range of stakeholders
  • Attention to accuracy of highly detailed information in documents or electronic files; solve problems based on due diligence of information
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and client service skills; ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents, and to deliver regular updates and feedback clearly and tactfully
  • Ability to deliver high quality results in a timely manner individually and through others; initiate action and accomplish goals across a wide range of teams and projects in the face of multiple demands, grow professionally by actively staying up to date in areas of expertise
  • Team player who possesses leadership skills, acts with integrity and self awareness, avoids unethical shortcuts, and respects and values intelligence and diversity of Googlers

jobs.title: Recruiter (Temporary) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Recruiter (Temporary) - Mountain View  

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

This is a temporary role offered through Adecco.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: Recruiter (Temporary)

Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.

From generating pipeline to maintaining a successful offer acceptance rate, you manage the entire candidate process. By leveraging your knowledge of our clients' hiring needs and search requirements, you effectively match candidates with the roles in which they will be most successful.

Responsibilities:

  • Support recruiting function by responding to urgent needs for information and analyses, offering ideas to peers to improve work processes, making work scalable and anticipating changes in project deliverables or scope by planning ahead
  • Consistently deliver high quality work in a high-paced, dynamic work environment by managing time and effort across activities, planning the resources, timelines and deliverables for projects, taking initiative to complete unanticipated or ad hoc tasks, and verifying the completeness of one's own work and the work of others
  • Solve problems and produce solutions by collecting and analyzing data with quantitative or qualitative approaches, identifying alternatives when circumstances change, and seeking out responsibilities beyond the job
  • Keep others apprised of and involved in work by communicating information and status to project leads and team members, coordinating work cross-functionally, and influencing peers, project leaders and/or managers

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 8 years proven sales or technical recruiting experience in a corporate environment implementing a wide range of staffing programs.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years proven recruiting experience in a corporate environment implementing a wide range of staffing programs. Staffing experience in IT industry and/or searching firm
  • Ability to handle customer relationship management, provide strong customer consultative skills and work in a large team environment
  • Ability to work in a team environment with a high sense of urgency.
  • Possess a wide range of experience on current external recruiting policies, practices, and trends.
  • Superior communication skills, with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy.

For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to temporaryjobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Recruiter (Temporary) - Mountain View.

jobs.title: Sourcer (Temporary) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Sourcer (Temporary) - Mountain View  

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

This is a temporary role offered through Adecco.

The area: People Operations

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources'). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

The role: Sourcer (Temporary)

Being a Sourcer at Google means finding people in hard-to-reach places. Like finding needles in a haystack, our team of sourcers are responsible for discovering the most talented people in the world. As a sourcer on one of our functional staffing teams, you play the role of detective -- tapping into all kinds of tools and resources to uncover the best untapped talent out there. Once spotted, you engage with these passive candidates, learn about their aspirations and interests and help them connect with roles, projects and opportunities at Google. You are both scrappy and resourceful, are able to listen to what candidates have to say and then and connect them with the Google magic.

Responsibilities:

  • Use Boolean search, Google applications, and social networking sites to identify potential candidates.
  • Identify, contact and interview potential candidates for roles across North American locations.
  • Develop innovative sourcing strategies and manage recruiting campaigns.
  • Use the highest level of professionalism when interacting with candidates, peers and hiring managers.
  • Maintain multiple databases to track a high volume of candidates while maintaining exceptional accuracy and provide analytics support by using advanced formulas to create and update spreadsheets and reports.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of recruiting experience in an agency, a search firm or with equivalent sales experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous experience at top recruiting agency.
  • Strong candidate sourcing and networking skills.
  • A track record of performing incredibly well against quotas in recruiting, sourcing, high-volume sales or a similar field.
  • Driven to produce results in a fast paced and fluctuating environment.
  • Strong technical knowledge or aptitude.

For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to temporaryjobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Sourcer (Temporary) - Mountain View.

jobs.title: Account Executive, Business and Industrial Markets Vertical - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Account Executive, Business and Industrial Markets Vertical - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Large Customer Sales

The regional Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams partner closely with our major advertising clients and agencies to develop digital solutions that build our clients' businesses and brands. We are in a unique and exciting position to shape how marketing and business is conducted in the digital age. We generate revenue from across Google's broad range of solutions, from Google AdWords, to YouTube, to Mobile, that help our customers connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences and get the most out of the web.

The role: Account Executive, Business and Industrial Markets Vertical

Reach for new revenue-generating heights as a Sales Googler. Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with a team to drive revenue growth with new and existing customers.
  • Develop high-level relationships to serve as a trusted consultant with major customers to optimize their advertising expenditures.
  • Generate business plans to define your selling strategies and tactics.
  • Understand and adapt to Google's ongoing product and technology developments.
  • Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 8 years relevant experience in digital advertising sales.
  • Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry.
  • Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
  • Experience working with Fortune 500 advertisers, agencies, and/or clients.
  • A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
Apply now

The area: Large Customer Sales

The regional Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams partner closely with our major advertising clients and agencies to develop digital solutions that build our clients' businesses and brands. We are in a unique and exciting position to shape how marketing and business is conducted in the digital age. We generate revenue from across Google's broad range of solutions, from Google AdWords, to YouTube, to Mobile, that help our customers connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences and get the most out of the web.

You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As a Google Account Executive, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. The primary responsibility of the Account Executive is to drive and grow new business revenue with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that your clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a high-adrenaline, client-facing sales role requiring deep industry expertise, proven sales ability with a particular penchant for closing deals, and a broad base of industry contacts. You understand and anticipate how decisions are made, and you will persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients.

jobs.content:
Account Manager, Tech Vertical - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Large Customer Sales

The regional Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams partner closely with our major advertising clients and agencies to develop digital solutions that build our clients' businesses and brands. We are in a unique and exciting position to shape how marketing and business is conducted in the digital age. We generate revenue from across Google's broad range of solutions, from Google AdWords, to YouTube, to Mobile, that help our customers connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences and get the most out of the web.

The role: Account Manager, Tech Vertical

Reach for new revenue-generating heights as a Sales Googler. Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Account Manager, you'll manage relationships with direct clients, which means you need to be a focused, proactive self-starter, able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, and sales-focused to help expand the client relationship. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. Above all, you are responsible for hitting your revenue targets.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the up-selling and management of your direct clients.
  • Report on sales figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
  • Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
  • Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied with their ROI.
  • Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years account management, sales, or marketing experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience in media account management.
  • Excellent organizational, analytical and influencing skills.
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ability to deliver results under pressure.
Apply now

jobs.title: Account Planner, Retail - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Account Planner, Retail - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in New York, NY; Boston, MA; Chicago, IL or Mountain View, CA.

The area: Large Customer Sales

The regional Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams partner closely with our major advertising clients and agencies to develop digital solutions that build our clients' businesses and brands. We are in a unique and exciting position to shape how marketing and business is conducted in the digital age. We generate revenue from across Google's broad range of solutions, from Google AdWords, to YouTube, to Mobile, that help our customers connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences and get the most out of the web.

The role: Account Planner, Retail

Reach for new revenue-generating heights as a Sales Googler. Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

This is a research-oriented yet creative position that requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you will brainstorm, develop and refine compelling, customized marketing plans and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings. Your primary goals as Account Planner are to capture a given target audience with innovative Google tools and refine how we position our products in an integrated way to achieve our Sales team's objectives.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop smart, integrated, research-based proposals and presentations to enhance Google's reputation with clients as a consultant and partner.
  • Use your comprehensive knowledge of Google's products to align them with the client's marketing objectives.
  • Acquire and share deep knowledge of the industry/vertical, its competitive landscape, client products and key business issues that affect the client and industry.
  • Develop new marketing collateral using industry, marketing and third-party research.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience, preferably in sales support and market research.
  • Superior analytical skills that include the ability to see granular as well as big picture issues.
  • Strong project management, interpersonal and organizational skills

jobs.title: Inside Sales Representative - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Inside Sales Representative - Mountain View  

Apply now

 

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: New Business Development

At Google, we set ourselves goals we know we can’t reach yet. Our New Business Development team works on game-changing ideas, from technological experiments to the expansion of existing businesses into new territories. We’re a team of technologists, entrepreneurs and leaders with an eye for what’s next, working across Google to develop products and ideas that revolutionize the way people connect with information.

The role: Inside Sales Representative

As an Inside Sales Representative, you provide the highest level of client service to our advertisers within a specific industry such as Retail, Technology, Finance, Travel, Local, Auto and Healthcare. You sell Google’s AdWords to prospects of medium-to-large size customers and then execute a well thought-out initial campaign that provides them with measurable return on investment. You bring a proven background in acquiring new clients, and you have particularly adept abilities in cold calling, sales pitches and general business development. You work in the Inside Sales Organization (ISO) which is responsible for driving incremental revenue and acquiring new high-growth advertisers for Google.

Responsibilities:

  • Prospect new clients and react to inbound customer requests.
  • Secure new AdWords clients by presenting customized search marketing solutions.
  • Work closely with our short-term account management team to ensure your newly-sold clients achieve their advertising goals.
  • Effectively manage your sales pipeline and develop a strategy for long-term sustained success.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 1 year experience in an advertising sales, business development, and/or online media environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proven track record of exceeding sales goals.
  • Understanding of the online advertising industry.
  • Demonstrated self-starter who thrives in a team environment.
  • Extremely proactive, organized, responsible, and proven ability to work well with a team.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to pitch comprehensive advertising solutions over the telephone to high-end prospects.
  • Interest in sales as well as an interest in working with and educating new advertisers.

 

Apply now

jobs.content:
Enterprise Online Sales and Operations Manager, Google Apps - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Online Sales and Operations Manager, Google Apps

Help the globe "go Google." Google's Enterprise teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Enterprise. Help Google Enterprise grow and continue improving businesses the world over.

Responsibilities:

  • Define go-to-market sales strategy for Google Apps in the SMB segment across online sales, inside sales, and partner channels.
  • Provide leadership, inspiration, mentorship, guidance and career development to members of your team. Identify and groom future leaders of the organization.
  • Scale your team by capitalizing on opportunities for increased effectiveness and efficiency by driving key automation and productivity initiatives.
  • Establish key relationships cross-functionally and with sales management, product management and product marketing to identify and attack growth opportunities.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Business, Marketing or Communications. In lieu of education, 4 years of relevant experiences.

Preferred Qualifications:

Enterprise Order Management Specialist (Latin America) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Order Management Specialist (Latin America)

Google Enterprise helps companies the globe over be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." But the process doesn't stop with the sale--ensuring clients new to Google products receive timely and clear assistance with ramping quickly is crucial. As an Enterprise Order Management Specialist, your flawless project management skills and admitted love of organization make sure their transitions go smoothly. From educational institutions to government agencies, you fulfill Enterprise orders for business of all sizes. You're a strong partner for these new customers, and you are a collaborative team member, working across the Enterprise team to make sure new clients get the best customer experience Google can provide.

As an Enterprise Order Management Specialist, you will be a key resource in the order management and fulfillment lifecycle and play a central role in keeping the business operations organized. You will be responsible for transactional order management, product fulfillment and driving projects to manage and improve business operations. This is a collaborative role that will work cross-functionally to drive process improvements with the end goal of providing the highest levels of service and efficiency to Google Enterprise customers. You must have exceptional communication, organizational and time management skills and be comfortable juggling multiple tasks while meeting strict deadlines. At the same time, you should have a bias for execution and a high level of drive and creativity to constantly improve your area of responsibility.

Responsibilities:

  • Support the global sales team that is committed to the success of all Google Enterprise products.
  • Provide order management and product fulfillment services to Enterprise customers and partners.
  • Coordinate and keep thorough records of customer interactions including order information, product shipments, licenses and customer returns.
  • Create solutions for process improvement to support business and policy objectives.
  • Act as liaison with other departments including sales, legal, compliance, manufacturing, and technical support to establish and update efficient order management and fulfillment processes.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ability to work in a fast moving environment with tolerance of ambiguity.
  • Hands-on project management skills and experience working with cross-functional teams.
  • Impeccable verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be proficient in written and spoken English, Spanish and Portuguese.

jobs.title: Enterprise Sales Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Enterprise Sales Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Sales Engineer

Help the globe "go Google." The Enterprise team helps companies seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you're helping the globe "go Google" by working with leading companies, schools and government agencies to ease their transition to Google tools--like Apps, Search and Chrome. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Enterprise business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.

A Sales Engineer with excellent technical, communication and organizational skills to join our Enterprise sales team. Your previous experience with enterprise search products, content/document management repository systems, and SQL-based relational databases will be on display as you engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements. You should be a confident presenter with excellent presentation skills and the ability to persuasively present Google's product offering. 

Responsibilities:

  • Engage with sales prospects, prepare and present demonstrations of Google products, and address technical questions that arise throughout the sales process.
  • Feel comfortable working closely with our product, support, engineering, and sales teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field. In lieu of degree, 5 years of relevant experience.
  • 5 years experience serving in the capacity of a sales engineer or equivalent experience in a customer facing role to include working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • In-depth knowledge of web and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, cookies/sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), including a working knowledge of web application development and integration (REST, SOAP, J2EE, CGI/Java/ASP servlets).
  • Understanding of the essential enterprise networking concepts (DNS, TCP, proxies, DMZ), along with an understanding of network identity management systems to include SSO, SAML, LDAP, Kerberos and NTLM.
  • Conversant in Web 2.0 development platforms and solutions to include J2EE, Java servlets, javascript, HTML, ASP, CGI, Ajax, Flash, cookies and XML.
  • Demonstrable ability to create demo scripts in any one of the following scripting/programming languages: Java, C#, Javascript, Python, Perl and/or Shell Scripting.

jobs.title: Head of Enterprise Sales Operations - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Head of Enterprise Sales Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Sales Operations

Sales Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex business runs smoothly. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. They develop revenue programs, launch initiatives and set high-level goals that accelerate growth and improve productivity.

The role: Head of Enterprise Sales Operations

Based in Mountain View, California, the Sales Operations role is a critical part of the Enterprise team. Its mandate is to think strategically and help drive best global practices. Simply put, it helps an already successful business maintain its leadership and helps Google define operational initiatives that contribute to the company's growth. Our team of highly creative visionaries thrives in deconstructing and re-creating businesses to meet changing strategic and operational needs, enable, incubate and scale innovation, establish more efficient practices, align functions and stakeholders to help the company continue to achieve its vast potential. The successful candidate will work in high paced environment reporting to the Director of Central Operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Help identify, structure, and lead key business programs across Enterprise including planning, quota setting, performance improvement programs, reorganization, resource allocation.
  • Work with Enterprise VP, and his Directors and Managers to get support and execute the programs.
  • Build relationships with Directors and key managers, particularly lead relationships with functional areas like Finance, Marketing, HR, etc.
  • Share best practices with other Sales Operations teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • 10 years of relevant work experience, including 8 years industry experience
  • Previous experience managing multiple project teams and people

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's Degree in related field, if applicable.
  • 15 years relevant work experience, including 10 years with emphasis in leading large global programs and consulting projects at a consulting firm and preferably in an Enterprise sales space.
  • Familiarity with traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
  • Ability to excite and lead a small team of high caliber folks and drive results.
  • Strong project management, problem solving, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.

jobs.title: Account Manager, Google TV Ads - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Account Manager, Google TV Ads - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in San Francisco, CA; Mountain View, CA or New York, NY.

The area: New Products, Media and Platforms

The New Products, Media and Platforms (NPMP) group is the link between Product and Sales at Google. NPMP helps take product innovations and turns them into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of their spend with Google. NPMP team members ensure we have the right commercial strategy for our products and bring product expertise to Sales, enabling front-line Sales partners to sell effectively and quickly. We are passionate about all things digital and want to shape the ever-changing world of online advertising and commerce.

The role: Account Manager, Google TV Ads

Reach for new revenue-generating heights as a Sales Googler. Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Sales Googlers work hard to identify our clients' business challenges, to collaboratively shape solutions that drive their strategic initiatives, and to keep them educated and informed in the ways that current and future Google products can enhance their online and/or offline presence. The Google TV Ads group that operates within Sales represents a relatively new initiative for Google, so the department and every job in it will continue to evolve and define itself.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the upselling and management of your direct clients. 
  • Report on sales figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
  • Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new advertising opportunities.
  • Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied. 

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years of experience in media account management.
  • Excellent organizational, analytical and influencing skills.
  • Excellent written and communication skills.
  • Ability to deliver results under pressure.

jobs.title: Digital Media Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Digital Media Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Digital Media Manager

You will manage multi-million dollar digital advertising program inclusive of purchased advertising and on-network “House Ads” as a Digital Media Manager in Google's Global Marketing organization. You will aim to make Google the most innovative, groundbreaking digital advertiser in the marketplace. You will play a key role in oversight and coordination of all advertising done by Google, for Google, leveraging Google’s own advertising products and services including AdWords, Google Display Network, Invite, AdMob and DoubleClick. Additionally, you will play a key role in defining process, ensuring sound management of digital advertising conducted off of Google properties (purchased advertising) as well as agency management.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as a primary client for management of all Google media planning
  • Construct processes to ensure structured management of campaigns
  • Further define and implement a measurement construct for programs and review all performance reporting outputs
  • Prioritization of agency work flow as pertains to digital media
  • Develop POVs and standards for use for digital advertising

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years managing digital advertising campaigns for large, complex clients with proficiency in online measurement, operations, ad networks, DSPs, digital video, and Google platforms
  • Familiarity with marketing optimization programs, website analytics, and Salesforce.com (or similar) to assess campaign effectiveness.
  • Ability to demonstrate measurable impact of campaign strategy and digital media optimization toward business goals
  • Track record of strong judgment in ambiguous or fast-moving situations.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Apply now

Help the globe "go Google." Google's Enterprise teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Enterprise. Help Google Enterprise grow and continue improving businesses the world over.

Responsibilities:

  • Define go-to-market sales strategy for Google Apps in the SMB segment across online sales, inside sales, and partner channels.
  • Provide leadership, inspiration, mentorship, guidance and career development to members of your team. Identify and groom future leaders of the organization.
  • Scale your team by capitalizing on opportunities for increased effectiveness and efficiency by driving key automation and productivity initiatives.
  • Establish key relationships cross-functionally and with sales management, product management and product marketing to identify and attack growth opportunities.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Business, Marketing or Communications. In lieu of education, 4 years of relevant experiences.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • An independent, self-motivated leader who has a track record of managing teams successfully and working at both highly tactical and strategic levels.
  • Strong consultative selling experience and sales management experience.

jobs.content:
Google Wallet and Payments Manager, Commerce Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: Product and Technical Sales Support

The Product & Technical Sales Support (PTSS) team serves as the primary point of contact for our global Sales, Business Development, and Partnerships teams to support our sales organization across all products. We provide tools so that our sales teams can focus on generating revenue and leverage our strong relationships with Google's Tech teams to enable our sales organization to do multi-solution selling, launch and support new products, and help and engage our users..

The role: Google Wallet and Payments Manager, Commerce Operations

The Digital Content & Commerce team is all about focusing on the user. You work on our flagship consumer products to actively support global users through help centers and online communities. You are a Google guru. You have detailed knowledge of our constantly evolving product suite to ensure that user feedback flows to the Product team and fuels innovation. In this highly cross-functional role, you are the voice of our users and problem-solve with the Product, Marketing, Legal and Engineering teams. You process suggestions, bugs, abuse and other product information to ensure we are constantly improving the user experience.

As a Digital Content & Commerce Associate Principal, you are viewed by Eng/Product as critical contributor to decision-making on customer product/market needs and an expert in area of focus. You contribute significantly to or lead communication at the VP level and leverage cross-functional relationships to improve product customer service strategies. You create opportunities to work jointly with other teams on best practice development and proactively contribute to the formulation of Digital Content & Commerce strategy.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate implications of enhancements to existing payments platform including: Identifying operational needs, gaining a strong understanding of the market and the key players in the market, drafting comprehensive, well-designed proposals for management
  • Launch New Google Wallet & Payment Products and Help Improve the existing ones; Coordinate implementation/integration of new features into Google systems/operations
  • Project-manage implementation of new features with all impacted constituencies including Product Management, Engineering, Operations, Security, Legal, Finance, Compliance and Internal Audit.
  • Manage existing internal relationships including: Monitoring performance per service level standards established, reporting on performance to all levels of management, working with relevant stakeholders to understand new features and functions that may be of benefit to Google and coordinating implementation as relevant
  • Manage existing internal relationships including: Monitoring performance per service level standards established, reporting on performance to all levels of management, working with relevant stakeholders to understand new features and functions that may be of benefit to Google and coordinating implementation as relevant. Manage a global team to support both Merchants and Customers of our payments platform. Communicate eloquently with senior executive team

jobs.title: Manager, Online Partnerships Group - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manager, Online Partnerships Group - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Manager, Online Partnerships Group

This team is responsible for growing Google's business with the largest online publishers and providing account management across Google’s online publisher solutions including AdSense, the DoubleClick Ad Exchange, DoubleClick for Publishers (DFP), and Admeld. The team’s primary duties include developing relationships with and driving revenue growth for its largest and most strategic online publishers and media clients. As a manager working for the Online Partnerships Group team, you will stretch your sales, operations, strategy development, and leadership skills by helping us manage our global business. You are a proficient sales and/or operations leader with tremendous people skills with an ability to work effectively within a dynamic environment. You are a a self-starter who thrives on innovation and driving ideas forward. Proficiency working cross-functionally and experience in running large scale programs is a must. You are expected to be a professional, reliable, and team-oriented member of the Online Partnerships Team. You must be results-driven and committed to identifying and tackling new business opportunities, driving new process efficiencies, and building high performing teams

Responsibilities:

  • Partner closely with publishers to maximize revenue for them and for Google.
  • Build a high performing team and achieve great results through them.
  • Develop and implement best practices for publisher interaction, consultative sales, and service.
  • Communicate effectively across Engineering, Product Management, Marketing and other teams to grow the business.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 6 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • Strong people management skills along with consultative selling and sales management experience.
  • 3 years of client facing experience, demonstrated technical aptitude and strong analytical skills.
  • 1 year of experience in Online Advertising, Media Planning or Marketing role.
  • Previous experience working with or for an advertising agency or a web site publisher.
  • Strong interest in the online advertising industry.

jobs.title: Adaptive Space Planner - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Adaptive Space Planner - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Real Estate and Workplace Services

Just as Google products always focus on the user, Google offices focus on the Googler. From state-of-the-art green construction projects to maintaining our resident T. Rex skeleton (named Stan), the Real Estate and Workplace Services team builds environments that keep Googlers feeling inspired and energized. We're a team of inquisitive and energetic real estate, construction and facilities operations professionals that are constantly searching for new ways to improve workplace efficiency and make Google a great place to come to work everyday.

The role: Adaptive Space Planner

As a member of the Real Estate team, you are a jack-of-all-trades on the front lines of Google's physical expansion. Google cannot grow without you. A critical thinker, you are part of a team with a wide range of responsibilities including lease administration, real estate transaction management and the design & construction supervision of our next and ever expanding offices. You help manage the spatial requirements for a workforce that is growing at lightning speed to ensure that the job is not only done to Google's high and industry-setting standards, but also in a way that promises long-term sustainability and care for our world's resources.

The Adaptive Space Planner develops strong relationships with senior management and key business contacts to align business needs with the NorCal real estate portfolio. With a thorough understanding of real estate supply/demand and future capital projects in the queue, you will help direct real estate allocations based on finance and product area guidance.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop strong relationships with senior level management to understand product area focus, direction and goals.
  • Proactively provide options and negotiate solutions to maximize space utilization and group productivity, foresee issues before they develop.
  • Assist in balancing headcount demands for more than 15K employees on a campus with a real estate portfolio over 4M Sq Ft.
  • Forecast and successfully deliver timely and appropriate space solutions for Mountain View customers; analyze and organize options and present solutions to the customer.
  • Help develop and manage the master space plan for all campus move activities; includes directing outsourced tactical planning team.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 8 years of relevant experience.
  • 7 years related space planning, architecture, design or other construction related industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent relationship building, collaboration and negotiation and skills.
  • Strong communication, project management and analytical skills required.
  • Ability to motivate employees and senior management to take desired action and drive projects to completion.
  • Must be self directed, well organized and able to balance multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Global Supply Chain Security Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Global Supply Chain Security Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Real Estate and Workplace Services

Just as Google products always focus on the user, Google offices focus on the Googler. From state-of-the-art green construction projects to maintaining our resident T. Rex skeleton (named Stan), the Real Estate and Workplace Services team builds environments that keep Googlers feeling inspired and energized. We're a team of inquisitive and energetic real estate, construction and facilities operations professionals that are constantly searching for new ways to improve workplace efficiency and make Google a great place to come to work everyday.

The role: Global Supply Chain Security Manager

Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll manage the security staff who keep our Googlers safe and our world-class technologies and facilities secure. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal). The Global Supply Chain Security Manager is responsible for developing strategies to protect Google equipment and products in transit. Ensuring the timely and intact delivery of Google assets is part of our success and brand recognition.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop Manufacturing, Warehousing and Distribution Security Standards.
  • Work with stakeholders to complete risk analysis and select traffic lanes.
  • Evaluate partners and vendors for conformance to Google standards.
  • Work to ensure resiliency and continuity of our services.
  • Investigate claims and losses related to cargo in-transit.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 5 years of relevant experience.
  • 5 years experience in Supply Chain Security.
  • 10 years experience in Physical Security.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with US and International Regulations.
  • CPP: Certified Protection Professional.
  • Certified Cargo Security Professional (CCSP).
  • Active participation in Transported Asset, Protection Association.
  • Familiarity with ISO28000 and CRAMM.
  • Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time.
Apply now
