jobs.title: Big Data Lead, Google Enterprise Ecosystem - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Big Data Lead, Google Enterprise Ecosystem - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

As the leader in cloud computing, Google's Enterprise division delivers cloud services and other IT products to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. Our team of high-achieving engineers, product managers, sales, marketing and support professionals works with a vast array of partners and customers to advance the company's mission to organize the world's information to make it universally accessible and useful. The Enterprise team is among a handful of rapidly emerging new businesses that are becoming front-and-center for Google as it enters its second decade as a company.

The role: Big Data Lead, Google Enterprise Ecosystem

As the Big Data Lead in Google Enterprise focused on the ecosystem, you will shape Google’s strategy, roadmap and business plan in Big Data. You will be responsible for the key areas of focus for Google’s Cloud Services initiatives, and engaged in multiple services being launched. You will work closely with the Sales team to drive the adoption of Google’s products for the Big Data use case with partners and their end customers. Finally, you will coordinate closely with a variety of internal organizations from product management to engineering to operations to help build the ecosystem of software and service partners for Google’s analytics offerings.

Responsibilities:

  • Evangelize Google’s strategy in key industry events and shape industry agenda and standards
  • Build ecosystem of software and service partners (ISVs and SIs) for Google’s analytics offerings (Predictive API, Big Query, Big Store, Maps API, etc.)
  • Define customer-centric use cases for Google to target via these software and service partners (ISVs and SIs)
  • Be responsible for achieving business targets for partner-driven business
  • Shape Google’s strategy, roadmap and business plan in Big Data with stakeholders like Product Management, Engineering, Sales

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering or Business. MBA or MS in Computer Science a plus.
  • At least 10 years of experience in Enterprise Software and significant experience in Analytics / BI market, ideally in product management and business development roles
  • Broad exposure to customer/vertical use cases for analytics and Big Data problems
  • Ability to navigate C-level relationships (CTOs, Head of Product Management, CIOs) at partners and customers
  • Collaborative approach and ability to work well with others
  • Penchant and vision for cloud computing and what it can do in Big Data

jobs.title: Enterprise Geospatial Deployment Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Enterprise Geospatial Deployment Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA; New York, NY; Reston, VA or Austin, TX.

The area: Enterprise

As the leader in cloud computing, Google's Enterprise division delivers cloud services and other IT products to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. Our team of high-achieving engineers, product managers, sales, marketing and support professionals works with a vast array of partners and customers to advance the company's mission to organize the world's information to make it universally accessible and useful. The Enterprise team is among a handful of rapidly emerging new businesses that are becoming front-and-center for Google as it enters its second decade as a company.

The role: Enterprise Geospatial Deployment Manager

Deployment Managers work with Google’s customers and partners to deploy Google’s Geospatial Enterprise (primarily Google Maps API Premier and Google Earth Enterprise) Products, and to help create the tools and processes to support deployment.

You will provide technical deployment assistance and solution design as part of a global Geospatial service line, and will support your deployments with project management tasks to ensure successful deployment of customer solutions. You will also work closely with product engineers, the Geospatial support team, and sales engineers to improve the product's vision and to make Google customers successful in deploying the product.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with customers and partners, both remotely and onsite, to design and implement geospatial solutions using Google products such as Maps API Premier and Google Earth Enterprise software.
  • Provide hands-on technical implementation and guidance for Google Maps API Premier and Google Earth Enterprise products, including working on customer applications, authoring documentation and code samples, and performing system configuration.
  • Identify and document bugs and feature requests in the products and work with engineers and customers to implement effective solutions.
  • Work closely with engineers, product managers and sales engineers to improve the products, up to and including suggested changes to the product code.
  • Design and deliver enablement tools and best practices to help customers and partners deploy Google’s geospatial solutions more effectively.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 2 years of industry experience in a customer-facing role in professional services, software development, systems integration or systems engineering, preferably with project or account management experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science or related technical degree
  • Experience developing web-based (preferably geospatial) applications; strong understanding of web development protocols (HTML5, AJAX, XML, JSON), preferably with good understanding of Geospatial technologies (KML, GeoRSS, etc)
  • Demonstrated experience in managing multiple streams of work, and complex customer requirements
  • Proactive, can-do attitude, follow-through, resourcefulness, attention to detail and verbal and written communication skills
  • Good Linux system administration and scripting (Bash, Python or Perl) skills strongly preferred with hands-on experience developing, implementing and supporting geospatial applications
  • Extensive travel (50% or more), potentially including international travel

jobs.title: Enterprise Software Engineer, Java - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Enterprise Software Engineer, Java - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Software Engineer, Java

Google Enterprise helps companies the globe over be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." Google's Enterprise teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As an Enterprise Software Engineer, you lead the development and implementation of web-based applications to new Google customers. You lead all aspects of web development, requirements gathering, software development, testing, documentation, training, implementation, ongoing support and maintenance for both in-house and customer-facing web applications. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of Googlers, using UI and functional specs/prototypes as input. Be part of helping businesses the world over succeed by getting Googley.

As a Java engineer for the Google Enterprise Operations Organization, you will design and develop server-side code for web-based applications. You are a well-rounded developer with a proven track record of delivering scalable and robust business applications using web technologies. You must be capable of designing and developing significant new functionality as well as consistently producing on-going sustaining maintenance releases.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and maintain web-based applications to enhance the technical support and business processes. Applications include case tracking tool, self-service support site, BI reporting and other systems to support the growing needs of Google Enterprise business.
  • Deliver highly scalable and reliable business applications using web technologies.
  • Maintain a suite of existing web applications by implementing new features and fixing critical bugs.
  • Collaborate with other engineers on code reviews, internal infrastructure, and process enhancements.
  • Integrate Google internal systems with third party ERP, CRM, or other business applications.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 3 years of multi-threaded server-side web application programming experience.
  • Experience with Java and object oriented design, including core libraries, design patterns, JSP and servlets.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with SaaS and CRM/ERP integration. Demonstrable development experience in a Unix/Linux environment.
  • Experience with Python, Javascript and/or SOAP.
  • Experience with Google App Engine (GAE) and Google Web Toolkit (GWT), distributed computing knowledge (such as MapReduce).
  • Knowledge of session management, object relational mapping, XML web services, and agile development methodologies.

jobs.title: Enterprise Technical Solutions Engineer, Geospatial - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Enterprise Technical Solutions Engineer, Geospatial - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or Austin, TX.

The area: Enterprise

As the leader in cloud computing, Google's Enterprise division delivers cloud services and other IT products to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. Our team of high-achieving engineers, product managers, sales, marketing and support professionals works with a vast array of partners and customers to advance the company's mission to organize the world's information to make it universally accessible and useful. The Enterprise team is among a handful of rapidly emerging new businesses that are becoming front-and-center for Google as it enters its second decade as a company.

The role: Enterprise Technical Solutions Engineer, Geospatial

Enterprise Technical Solution Engineers provide technical assistance and developer support as part of a global 24x7 organization. You will interface directly with Enterprise businesses using Google’s geospatial technologies, and work closely with Google software engineers, product managers, and sales engineers to improve the product's vision and to make Google customers successful. This position works with Google Enterprise Geospatial hosted products, such as Google Earth Builder and the Google Maps APIs, as well as on-premise software such as the Google Earth Enterprise Portable, Fusion and Server products.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide admin, developer and technical support for the Google Maps and Google Earth Enterprise products, including debugging customer applications, authoring documentation and code samples, handling business and technical questions and escalations via phone, web, or email, and possible on call pager rotations.
  • Work closely with customers, partners and field teams to define best practices and methodologies for the successful deployment of Google Geospatial solutions.
  • Identify and document bugs and feature requests in the products; work with software engineers and customers to implement effective solutions along business-appropriate timelines; at a senior level, fix bugs and implement feature requests as a sustaining engineer.
  • Work closely with developers, product managers, and sales engineers to improve the products; at a senior level, influence product design, develop product code, and/or participate in contract negotiation and structuring.
  • Identify proactively and own process, tool, and product improvements to help improve the way we serve geospatial developers and admins, and deliver a world-class developer and admin support experience.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical degree. In lieu of degree, 5 years relevant work experience.
  • 1 year industry experience in: developer or API support, professional services, software development, systems integration, or systems engineering.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Great account management, initiative, follow-through,resourcefulness, attention to detail, and verbal and written English communication skills.
  • Can-do attitude, strong sense of ownership, great teaming skills and a drive to excel in all aspects of the developer support experience.
  • Experience developing web-based geospatial applications in JavaScript, Python, or other interpreted languages; strong foundation in HTTP protocol, XML, HTML5, and JSON; experience working with APIs; strong familiarity with CSS.
  • Good understanding of Projections, Vector data formats (Shape Files,GML), Raster data formats (JPEG 2k, GeoTIFF) and relevant geospatial technologies (WMS, WFS, and other OGC specifications). Development experience with open-source (e.g. GDAL/OGR) and commercial (ArcGIS) GIS software helpful.
  • Good understanding of TCP/IP protocol and networking, Linux system administration or kernel design, and scripting languages (bash, Python, Perl).
Apply now

Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Technical Writer, Administration

As an Enterprise Technical Writer, you'll be a key contributor to the success of Google's productivity, collaboration, and security solutions for business -- the fast-growing Google Apps, Chromebooks, and Postini product lines.

You'll research and write top-quality manuals, articles, UI text, and online help for administrators and deployment partners. As a member of the Enterprise Operations group, you'll collaborate with Engineering, Support, Deployment, Product Management, and Marketing. jobs.content:
Head of Enterprise Apps Support - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Head of Enterprise Apps Support

Help the globe "go Google." Google's Enterprise teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Enterprise. Help Google Enterprise grow and continue improving businesses the world over.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the managers and teams responsible for providing technical support for Google Apps for Business IT customers and ensure operational targets are met across the Americas teams.
  • Work directly with our Google Apps for Business IT customers to resolve customer escalations.
  • Work independently with Documentation, Product Management, Engineering and partners to translate customer needs into a better overall product experience and to lower the need for support across all customer segments.
  • Build team structure, recognize leadership potential, and develop enhanced skill sets within the team.
  • Manage the execution of new processes in support, documentation, escalations and reporting and contribute to necessary changes globally to ensure consistent, high quality service.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 7 years relevant work experience)
  • 3 years experience managing managers of a technical support organization and/or proven experience managing a high performing operations team.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 10 years relevant work experience in operations management in an online environment, with a proven track record in driving organizational and operational improvements.

jobs.title: Head of Market Management, Commerce - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Head of Market Management, Commerce - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: New Products, Media and Platforms

The New Products, Media and Platforms (NPMP) group is the link between Product and Sales at Google. NPMP helps take product innovations and turns them into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of their spend with Google. NPMP team members ensure we have the right commercial strategy for our products and bring product expertise to Sales, enabling front-line Sales partners to sell effectively and quickly. We are passionate about all things digital and want to shape the ever-changing world of online advertising and commerce.

The role: Head of Market Management, Commerce

The role of the Head, Market Management is part of our new Commerce business scaling effort. Initially, you will manage a team of Market Managers, who oversee a portfolio of local markets to optimize our product placement with a select group of partners, including placement schedules, pricing, promotion length, and overall planning. You will lead the analytics and operations teams to help with critical analysis and revenue planning. You will work closely with leadership in our sales team on strategically acquiring new partners. You will have ultimate revenue responsibility in the overall portfolios of all local markets. You will provide project leadership, business judgment, analytic guidance and business experience to support strategic and tactical initiatives globally. You have demonstrated top quartile performance in management consulting or similar environment and have graduated with outstanding academic performance. You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry; you tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive national market/category specific strategies to fuel rapid growth of program; be responsible for ultimate revenue optimization and overall growth within all markets.
  • Lead a team of market managers and analysts to cover markets in all aspects of planning delivery and execution.
  • Identify critical pieces of analysis and research to drive new insights, and work with less experienced team members, or other teams within Google, to execute these to a high standard.
  • Oversee market based analysis, planning, and forecasting
  • Clearly communicate findings from initiatives to senior management and to the broader organization.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Hands-on experience managing high-performing teams and a demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives.
  • 15 years of relevant work experience in management consulting, as well as digital media.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Graduate degree from business school.
  • Strong creativity and innovation in discovering actionable results and strategies and ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment.
  • Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills and impeccable business judgment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Partner Solutions, Technical Account Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Partner Solutions, Technical Account Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or New York, NY.

The area: Partner Solutions Organization

Google's Partner Solutions Organization (PSO) is a technology group dedicated to developing and managing the company's largest and most strategic partnerships. Our multi-faceted professionals work together with teams throughout Google to address our partners' most pressing technology challenges - ones that have no simple answers. We create solutions for and build enduring long-term relationships with organizations that represent outstanding revenue opportunities and/or are strategically important for us to take new, world-shaping technologies to market.

The role: Partner Solutions, Technical Account Manager

As a Technical Account Manager, you are the engagement manager taking responsibility for the success of our largest partnerships. You lead deployments, optimize implementations and integrations to increase revenue, drive new business opportunities, and manage the overall technical aspects to build strong, successful, long-term partnerships. If you are a creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, market-driven environment, Google's Partner Solutions Organization wants to talk to you. You should be a self-motivated individual looking to solidify Google's strategic partnerships across a variety of product lines that include search, mobile, video, e-commerce, and many other new initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify, drive, and optimize the revenue flow from new business opportunities by leveraging Google technologies.
  • Perform implementation reviews, evangelize new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
  • Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management and Engineering.
  • Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
  • Analyze and optimize the revenue flow of existing partners.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of hands-on experience in Internet products and technologies.
  • Experience in XML, HTML, JavaScript, and/or Unix/Linux.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • 5 years relevant work experience.
  • Excellent project management skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Excellent written and oral business communication skills.

jobs.title: Partner Technology Manager (PTM), AdSense Partner Solutions - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Partner Technology Manager (PTM), AdSense Partner Solutions - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Partner Solutions Organization

Google's Partner Solutions Organization (PSO) is a technology group dedicated to developing and managing the company's largest and most strategic partnerships. Our multi-faceted professionals work together with teams throughout Google to address our partners' most pressing technology challenges - ones that have no simple answers. We create solutions for and build enduring long-term relationships with organizations that represent outstanding revenue opportunities and/or are strategically important for us to take new, world-shaping technologies to market.

The role: Partner Technology Manager (PTM), AdSense Partner Solutions

Partner Technology Managers (PTMs) drive the strategy and technology that enables Google’s products through partnerships. From early pilots through wide-scale deployment, each PTM oversees the technical execution of Google partnerships for one product vertical world-wide. Partner Technology Managers are responsible for flawless operation of Google partnerships at the program level, which includes developing strategy, teams and systems, prioritizing projects and resources, balancing business needs versus technical constraints, and driving successful partner product deployments.

As a Partner Technology Manager, you'll be the in-house entrepreneur responsible for incubating and growing Google’s latest products and partnerships. You will lead cross-functional teams and work closely with partners to leverage emerging technologies to create unique value. Entrepreneurial and detail-oriented by nature, you're intrigued with the idea of bringing stealth Google products and technologies to market, and you thrive working in small, high-performance teams.

As a Partner Technology Manager for AdSense, you are responsible for guiding a global partner technology team working with products and partnerships that generate billions of dollars for Google and our most strategic partners.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage programs involving cross-functional teams, focusing on launching new products and services.
  • Act as the business and technology expert in your product / business area.
  • Drive the architectural design for partner systems and define the processes for engagement with technical partners.
  • Drive product functionality to make our strategic partners successful.
  • Work across pre-sales and post-sales processes to scale new businesses for a large number of partners.

Requirements:

  • BS/MS (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related technical degree with a strong academic record. Start-up and consulting experience a plus. MBA a plus.
  • Experience managing cross-functional teams and new products.
  • Excellent written and oral business communication skills.
  • Comfortable working with senior managers and executives.
  • Excellent project management and business negotiation skills.
  • Background in statistics, machine learning, financial analysis a plus.
Apply now

The area: Product & Technical Sales Support

The Product & Technical Sales Support (PTSS) team serves as the primary point of contact for our global Sales, Business Development, and Partnerships teams to support our sales organization across all products. We provide tools so that our sales teams can focus on generating revenue and leverage our strong relationships with Google's Tech teams to enable our sales organization to do multi-solution selling, launch and support new products, and help and engage our users.

The role: Partner Solutions, Technical Account Manager (Content and Commerce)

As a Technical Account Manager, you are the engagement manager taking responsibility for the success of our largest Content and Commerce partnerships. You lead deployments, optimize implementations and integrations to increase revenue, drive new business opportunities, and manage the overall technical aspects to build strong, successful, long-term relationships. If you are a creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, market-driven environment, Google's Partner Solutions Organization wants to talk to you. You should be a self-motivated individual looking to solidify Google's strategic partnerships across a variety of product lines including Geo, Print, Commerce, Search, and many other new initiatives.

Inspire companies to "go Google." The Enterprise team at Google brings the power of cloud computing to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between your clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). jobs.content:
gTech Software Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: gTech Engineering

gTech Eng sits at the heart of Google Technical Services (gTech), a group dedicated to providing technical and product services to Google Users, Advertisers, and Partners through all phases of the Sales cycle.

Engineering at Google is unique because so much of what the company works on hasn’t been done before. Innovation is key as gTech Eng develops systems responsible for managing the flow of billions of dollars.

Externally, the team is helping to define the landscape of online Content and Commerce. And gTech Eng works on a broad spectrum of Google products, generally leading new partner syndication efforts for everything from Google WebSearch to Google Plus Pages.

Internally, the team develops tools that channel terabytes of content to some of Google’s top products, like Google Maps, and tools that help Google Sales make faster and better business decisions.

The role: gTech Software Engineer

As gTech Software Engineer, you’ll develop innovative solutions to help drive revenue and make Google most efficient. You will work with product managers, engineering teams, account managers, and sales representatives. You’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging projects including web applications, systems, and data mining, with a strong emphasis on building scalable server-side components.

jobs.title: Ad Traffic Quality Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Ad Traffic Quality Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: Product Quality Operations

The Product Quality Operations (PQO) team defends the integrity of Google, its users, and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products. We are dedicated to protecting Google's brand and reputation and ensuring product quality to the company's expanding base of advertisers, publishers, and users in more than 40 languages on a global basis. We partner with our Product Managers and Engineers to fight fraud and abuse across a broad range of products such as Google Search, AdWords, AdSense, Checkout and Maps. This means that PQO team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative – and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.

The role: Ad Traffic Quality Analyst

As an Ad Traffic Quality Analyst, you will investigate abuse, identify new forms of abuse, and develop and improve our systems to protect Google's products. You will be working on solving big problems with elegant solutions while working with large data sets. If you enjoy solving complex problems in a fast-paced environment, this is a great role for you. We get to work with many different product teams and deploy solutions to protect Google and its users from abuse.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze traffic trends, and identify new filters and flags to spot invalid click activity.
  • Work directly with multiple Google teams while resolving invalid click cases.
  • Push for policy changes by directly interfacing with Product Managers, User Interface/User Experience Engineers and other Product Specialists.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience with one programming or more of the following languages: Java, Perl, Python, PHP, or JavaScript.
  • Knowledge of SQL and database structures.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments.
  • Experience in data analysis and report generation and an understanding of how the Internet works.
  • Strong ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively. Native fluency in multiple languages a plus.
  • Excellent self management skills. Ability to work independently and complete projects on time.

jobs.title: Application Developer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Application Developer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Application Developer

As an Application Developer, you will write code to protect Google’s users and customers from various forms of abuse. You will work with others building web tools and automation solutions to help the team detect bad content and traffic and prevent them from affecting our users’ experience. You will be on the front lines as the internet evolves and as new products are launched, making sure we can seamlessly react to any changes. Your work maintains the reputation of Google’s products and makes the internet a safer place for all people to use.

In developing the tools to help internal users get their jobs done you will be involved with the entire cycle of software development from planning what tools and features are needed, to designing and implementing quick and scalable solutions, and maintaining your jobs across large-scale ‘cloud computing’ clusters. You will work with Google’s world-class engineers and infrastructure to handle big problems over massive data sets. Your efforts will launch quickly and have immediate and obvious impact on those around you.

Our teams in Mountain View include people from all over the world, giving us the opportunity to recognize trends across countries and markets. We work closely with other engineering teams in Europe, Asia, and the US. By supporting teams throughout all Google offices and protecting huge products like Search, Ads, and Maps, we have a direct influence on internet users throughout the world.

The most successful candidates for this role will have experience building web applications, strong analytical skills and comfort dealing with large data sets, flexibility to deal with a diverse team of both engineers and non-engineers, and the desire and ability to get things done in a fast-paced environment. We are particularly interested in engineers who have an interest in computer and web security, and a deep understanding and penchant for the web.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze potential abuse and fraud cases and trends and advocate changes to product and engineering groups
  • Build real time systems to process large datasets in parallel on massive clusters
  • Increase efficiency through automation, improved signals, workflow streamlining and system optimization
  • Design, code and debug applications in various software languages.
  • Front end graphical user interface design

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: Java, C++, Perl, Python, PHP, or JavaScript.
  • Experience with SQL.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 1 year relevant work experience.
  • Experience in numerical analysis, algorithms and/or data-mining.
  • Understanding of core webmaster skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.
  • Native fluency in multiple languages.
Apply now

jobs.title: Associate, Risk Operations and Fraud Prevention - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Associate, Risk Operations and Fraud Prevention - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Online Sales and Operations, Product Quality Operations

The Product Quality Operations (PQO) team defends the integrity of Google, its users, and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products. We are dedicated to protecting Google's brand and reputation and ensuring product quality to the company's expanding base of advertisers, publishers, and users in more than 40 languages on a global basis. We partner with our Product Managers and Engineers to fight fraud and abuse across a broad range of products such as Google Search, AdWords, AdSense, Checkout and Maps. This means that PQO team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative – and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.

The role: Associate, Risk Operations and Fraud Prevention

As a Risk Operations and fraud Prevention Associate, you will be responsible for finding fraud and preventing financial loss on Google AdWords or Google Checkout. You will play an integral part in new Google product launches like the Nexus One. You will be exposed to various forms of payment fraud and account-related abuse and will be responsible for leveraging fraud detection technology in order to have a direct, measurable impact on the growing financial success of Google AdWords and Google Checkout. You are knowledgeable about technology and online commerce and utilize your strong analytical skills to innovate and improve our processes and tools to effectively mitigate Google's exposure to fraudulent and abusive activities. You are detail-oriented, work well in fast-paced environments, and are able to make strong contributions to a growing global team.

Your career development is as unique and varied as the Googlers we hire, and begins the minute you set foot in a Google office. Because we care about the long-term personal and professional growth of our Associates, we created the Online Media Associate Program (OMAP), a two-year, team-based developmental program for new hires. OMAP equips you with the business, marketing, analytical and leadership skills needed to be successful at Google, while helping you develop a strong-knit community of Googlers across the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Find and prevent fraud by reviewing accounts and transactions, identifying trends and patterns, summarizing key findings, and recommending anti-fraud processes and system enhancements.
  • Manage and respond to escalations from internal and external parties within designated service levels.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Finance, and Product Management to enhance tools, system functionality, and fraud detection methods while increasing automation and providing a better experience for our users.
  • Refine processes around customer support and product expansion.
  • Educate internal Googlers and external parties on Google AdWords and Google Checkout fraud.

Requirements:

  • BA/BS degree preferred with a strong academic record. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline a plus
  • Experience in risk management, fraud investigation, or billing/payment analysis preferred, but not required.
  • Scripting and some programming experience preferred.
  • Flexibility and willingness to work on a variety of projects in a cross-functional environment, while prioritizing effectively.
  • Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Database and scripting knowledge a plus.
  • Knowledge of credit card processing, e-commerce, and/or payment fraud prevention techniques a plus.
Apply now

jobs.content:
GTech, Technical Solutions Engineer (Tools Developer) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View or San Francisco, CA.

The area: Product and Technical Sales Support

The gTech team serves as the primary point of contact for our global Sales, Business Development, and Partnerships teams to support our sales organization across all products. We provide tools so that our sales teams can focus on generating revenue and leverage our strong relationships with Google's Tech teams to enable our sales organization to do multi-solution selling, launch and support new products, and help and engage our users.

The role: GTech, Technical Solutions Engineer (Tools Developer)

GTech Engineering, Technical Solutions Engineer (Tools Developer) Technical Solutions Engineers deliver innovative solutions to help drive revenue and make Google's global sales field more efficient. As a Technical Solutions Engineer, your responsibilities include prototyping proofs of concept, developing and supporting tools, and enhancing core products to meet the needs of our sales field. You will be working with product managers, engineering teams, account managers and sales people, and will be a highly visible and important member of the team. The changes you make will improve the processes and procedures used by many of the people within Google worldwide.

Web Solutions Engineers deliver innovative solutions to help drive revenue and make Google's global sales field more efficient. As a Web Solutions Engineer, your responsibilities include prototyping proofs of concept, developing and supporting tools, and enhancing core products to meet the needs of our sales field. You will be working with product managers, engineering teams, account managers and sales people, and will be a highly visible and important member of the team. The changes you make will improve the processes and procedures used by many of the people within Google worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver solutions that enable sales operations to accurately and efficiently report and visualize sales data.
  • Collaborate with product engineers to enhance core platforms.
  • Write and review technical documents, including design, development, and revision documents.
  • Write and review code in compiled or scripted languages.
  • Create applications using standard and Google-specific software development tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in computer science. In lieu of degree, 5 years of relevant experience.
  • 3 years experience in UNIX or GNU/Linux system administration and shell scripting.
  • 3 years experience with HTML, JSON, HTTP, SSL.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • CS Degree.
  • Experience implementing software and system tests.
  • Highly proficient in one or more programming languages, including Java, JavaScript, Python.
  • Able to independently drive small medium-size tasks and projects.

jobs.title: Online Partnership Group, Internal Tools Developer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Online Partnership Group, Internal Tools Developer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Global Advertising and Product Operations

Users first is not just our motto for Google products -- our Sales teams embrace it, too. The Global Advertising and Product Operations team supports millions of small businesses around the world. As small business experts, we help get these local entrepreneurs on the map, and make sure that every dollar they spend on advertising helps grow their business. Our teams of account managers, strategists, coordinators and customer support specialists work together to create the right solution for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Online Partnership Group, Internal Tools Developer

The Online Partnership Group (OPG) grows Google's business with online publishers by helping them utilize tools from products such as AdSense and DoubleClick. Our team is made up of high-achieving specialists who work with partners in online advertising and e-commerce. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. On this team you proactively identify, develop, support and maximize revenue opportunities from existing and new partners. In OPG, we strive to exceed partner expectations through building, supporting and maintaining long-term win-win relationships. 

As an Internal Tools Developer, you will help build internal systems to drive revenue growth, create efficient workflows, provide new customer insight, and solve one-off problems quickly. You will be responsible for an entire project, from gathering requirements to launching and maintaining your work of art. You have maximum flexibility in choosing a project and deciding how to run with it. You should possess a mix of technical strength and business acumen. As an embedded developer you will be given access to resources within Google to grow and develop both personally and professionally. This role focuses on breadth and project rotation, and is an excellent entry-level position for technical people interested in a career in Engineering, Product Management, or Sales.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze work processes to determine inefficiencies and opportunities for automation.
  • Design, implement, test, and launch internal tools.
  • Maintain existing tools and infrastructure.
  • Develop internal database expertise and manage data pulls for the larger team.
  • Evangelize tools to other internal teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related major. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Fluency in one or more of the following: Python, JavaScript, Java, PHP, Perl, or C++.
  • Experience with UNIX, preferably Linux.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • SQL experience, especially MySQL.
  • Experience leading short projects involving outside teams.
  • Tack-sharp analytical abilities.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time.

jobs.title: Product and Technical Sales Support, Customer Solutions Engineer (Sales Engineer) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product and Technical Sales Support, Customer Solutions Engineer (Sales Engineer) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Product and Technical Sales Support

The Product & Technical Sales Support (PTSS) team serves as the primary point of contact for our global Sales, Business Development, and Partnerships teams to support our sales organization across all products. We provide tools so that our sales teams can focus on generating revenue and leverage our strong relationships with Google's Tech teams to enable our sales organization to do multi-solution selling, launch and support new products, and help and engage our users.

The role: Product and Technical Sales Support, Customer Solutions Engineer (Sales Engineer)

As a Customer Solutions Engineer, you will utilize both your technical aptitude and exemplary communication skills to drive business with Google's top-tier customers. You will work with our Sales, Sales Operations, and Engineering teams to improve the online presence of our clients by providing technical consultation on products such as the AdWords API and YouTube custom channels. You will develop value propositions, present business arguments, create proofs- of-concept, and evangelize Google technologies. You will interact frequently and closely with our customers on both technical and non-technical levels. The CSE role allows you to apply both your technical skills and business acumen in the fast-paced world of Google sales.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide consulting services for and support implementations of Google’s APIs to help clients create successful applications.
  • Provide technical consulting and propose feasible solutions according to products' Terms and Conditions.
  • Solve customers' business issues with Google technology, brainstorming with the Sales team on technical propositions to enhance customer websites around three vectors: traffic building, user engagement, and conversion capabilities.
  • Propose, design, create and present prototypes, demos and proofs-of-concept to a wide variety of audiences, which include marketing professionals and engineers.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 5 years of work experience in relevant field).
  • 2 years coding experience in Java, Python, C++, or PHP
  • 2 years technical background in Web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, XML, DNS, and TCP/IP.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree in Computer Science or related major.
  • Technical sales or field sales experience, with strong business knowledge; sales engineering or professional consulting experience
  • Application development experience within the UNIX and/or Windows environments.
  • Working knowledge of relational database administration in MySQL.
  • Excellent communication skills, proven ability to adapt your message to the technical level of the audience, and comfort presenting technical materials to large groups.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer (Embedded Tools Specialist) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Sales Engineer (Embedded Tools Specialist) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Sales Operations

Sales Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex business runs smoothly. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. They develop revenue programs, launch initiatives and set high-level goals that accelerate growth and improve productivity.

The role: Sales Engineer (Embedded Tools Specialist)

Technology is at the core of everything we do, especially in the world of Internet advertising. Sales Engineers are the behind-the-scenes brains for the proposals the Partner Development team pitches to our partners. Your strong software development background, detailed knowledge of web technologies and online advertising are key to working with the engineering and sales teams to create custom solutions for our partners. You are responsible for the entire technical back-end, from interpreting and writing technical specifications to the creation and implementation of the final plan. As the go-to technical expert for the team, you help design the solutions that make our partnerships successful.

You are a recent Computer Science (or related) graduate who can help build internal tools as part of Google's Small and Medium Business Sales team. You feel comfortable working on multiple short and long-term projects, both individually, and as part of small development teams. You will work directly with the individuals that use your tools, from gathering requirements to launching and maintaining your works of art. You will have maximum flexibility in choosing projects and deciding how to run with them. You possess a mix of technical strength and business acumen. As an Internal Tools Specialist, you will be given access to resources within Google to grow and develop both personally and professionally. This role focuses on breadth and project rotation and is intended for entry-level candidates interested in a career in sales, product management, or engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze work processes to determine inefficiencies and opportunities for automation.
  • Design, implement, test, and launch internal tools.
  • Maintain existing tools and infrastructure.
  • Develop internal databases and manage data pulls for the larger team.
  • Evangelize tools to other internal teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience).
  • 1 year relevant work experience, including experience with UNIX/Linux administration, with some scripting/coding ability (e.g., Python).
  • Analytical work experience in high data volume environments.
  • Experience of collaborating with cross functional teams

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of relational database administration (MySQL).
  • Familiarity with web development technologies
  • Ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects simultaneously in an organized fashion.

jobs.content:
Global Sales Operations, Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Sales Operations

Sales Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex business runs smoothly. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. They develop revenue programs, launch initiatives and set high-level goals that accelerate growth and improve productivity.

The role: Global Sales Operations, Analyst

As a member of the Global Sales Operations team you will support our sales team working with top advertisers globally. You will provide project management skills, analytical “horsepower” and business judgment to support strategic and tactical data management activities globally. You will work with the team on all core repeating globally standard operational processes beyond that produced by Planning, Sales Programs and Analytic teams. Such processes include responsibility for portfolio decisions, sales team structure, customer data management and standards, and any other centralized Global process that needs eventual operational alignment.

You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry; you tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.

Responsibilities:

  • Execute analysis to extract and summarize vast amounts of data.
  • Update/create flexible and scalable models which drive sales processes and streamline operational challenges.
  • Evaluate output to ensure a high level of precision, insight and value.
  • Package analysis for reports used by sales leadership to shape strategic and operational decisions as well as develop/design tools to improve processes & workflows.
  • Process dynamic, special projects as they arise with zeal and excitement.

  • 2 years of relevant analytical work experience in management consulting environment or similar role.

jobs.title: Global Sales Operations, Strategy Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Global Sales Operations, Strategy Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Sales Operations

Sales Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex business runs smoothly. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. They develop revenue programs, launch initiatives and set high-level goals that accelerate growth and improve productivity.

The role: Global Sales Operations, Strategy Analyst

As a Strategy Analyst you will provide project management skills, analytical approach and business judgment to support strategic and tactical initiatives globally. You will be responsible for developing approaches to identify high potential revenue opportunities and generate key insights around impact and performance . This involves structuring problems, analyzing data, making recommendations and driving implementation / operations - working closely with Google's sales, product, regional teams and Marketing. You will have exposure and visibility to senior executives and cross-functional leaders as you evangelize the revenue opportunity and highlight insights and impact from these sales interventions.

Responsibilities:

  • Advanced data extraction skills using Excel, SQL or other scripting languages.

jobs.title: Channel Program Manager, Associate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Channel Program Manager, Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Channel Program Manager, Associate

Google's Sales Advertising Operations team is devoted to finding relevant solutions that meet our clients' changing advertising needs. When things don't go according to plan, Media Coordinators are there to save the day. The team provides clients with technical and process support for their ad media purchases. To do that, you assemble and review ads to ensure that they are delivered, displaying and operating properly. However, problem-solving isn't just about being reactive; you think proactively by recognizing trends and ad quality concerns, identifying process changes and developing contingency plans for potential setbacks. As you gain insights and analyze ad delivery metrics, you are trusted to recommend changes that keep campaigns sailing smoothly.

Responsibilities:

  • Research and drive new revenue opportunities with existing Google products
  • Create go-to market product adoption plans for our channel partners. This includes evaluation of products relevant for our channel, the development of internal sales training materials, partner executive pitch decks, sales materials, and product beta implementation requirements. Emphasis will be on Local products (AdWords location extensions, display ads, mobile ads, click to call, enhanced listing ads, local business center place pages, etc)
  • Develop a strategy to educate and empower channel partner sales reps to effectively sell Google advertising solutions
  • Project manage and execute partner revenue and engagement programs
  • Represent the needs of SMBs and our channel partners across Google product and business teams

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience
  • 5 years of Sales & Marketing experience, preferably in product marketing at a technology or media company

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA
  • Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of Google's products and local strategy
  • Strong analytical skills with ability to translate data into meaningful business knowledge
  • Demonstrated performance in prior roles with outstanding execution, problem solving skills, resourcefulness, and creativity
  • Excellent project management skills and ability to manage a cross functional team
  • Must be analytical and data driven

jobs.title: Enterprise Global Partner Program Manager, Geospatial - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Enterprise Global Partner Program Manager, Geospatial - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in London, UK; Singapore or Mountain View, CA.

The area: Enterprise

We've helped over 30 million employees at three million organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

The role: Enterprise Global Partner Program Manager, Geospatial

Help the globe "go Google." Google's Enterprise teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As an Enterprise Partner Business team member, you drive the Google Enterprise business relationship with key partners by analyzing partner business performance, identifying methods of increasing partner and Google returns, selling ideas to and identifying opportunities within partners, and coordinating across Google departments/groups to deliver on opportunities. You love your customer-facing role, jumping at the chance to engage with customers, provide them seamless support and keep them with Google.

The Geo partner channel is in it’s second year and part of the fastest growing product line in Enterprise, and the successful candidate will provide the right assets, tools and guidance to support increased long-term global partner growth. These deliverables will support all aspects of the partner lifecycle: namely partner recruit, demand generation, enablement, selling, deploying, support, and effective channel management throughout. The successful candidate will help ensure consistency by also leveraging best practices developed in the current Google Apps program and improving on them.

Responsibilities:

  • Define the overall partner strategy and positioning for Enterprise Geospatial, driving alignment with the global head of geo as well as regional leads and regional partner leads.
  • Drive accountability across different functions to ensure fulfillment of the agreed strategy, including, but not restricted to the Enablement, Marketing, Sales Ops, Enterprise Operations, Product and Legal Teams
  • Support and programatize the assets that enable this strategy, with particular emphasis on a Geo partner enablement plan, Geo marketing plan and Go tiering process.
  • Measure performance of partners against the strategy; Create governance across all partner field and function business.
  • Nurture the right relationships in the field and Mountain View to maximise Geo partner business visibility within Enterprise and wider Google.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 10 years relevant skills or equivalent experience. 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience of leading large global programs and consulting projects, ideally at a consulting firm and preferably in an Enterprise sales space.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
  • Strong project management, interpersonal and organizational skills. Self-starter with demonstrated ability to deliver value through own initiative
  • Results-driven, ability to analyze metrics and data to regularly inform the strategy for achieving team objectives.
  • Knowledge of Geospatial/Mapping technology and its application in the Enterprise space.

jobs.title: Head of SMB Acquisitions, Global – Mountain View
jobs.content:
Head of SMB Acquisitions, Global – Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Head of SMB Acquisitions

Reach for new revenue-generating heights as a Sales Googler. Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of your key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

The SMB segment is a very significant growth and profitability engine for Google. We are dedicated to growing Google's expanding base of advertisers by providing them with the best advertising solutions available. We supply and support a broad range of products focused on making SMBs successful. The SMB Acquisitions Team, which feeds this engine, is dispersed over 10+ international countries; the team needs to be proactive, motivated, honed and imaginative - and able to work well in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. Reporting to the VP of SMB Sales & Operations, in your capacity as Head of SMB Acquisitions, you will set the strategy for, and manage the execution of, this high-performing function globally. SMB Acquisitions consists of internal & outsourced direct sales resources. Your strategies will focus on identification of opportunities, means of targeting, channel strategy and onboarding excellence, to drive Google’s growth in the global SMB space. You will draw upon extensive sales and management experience to lead a team and be tasked with building and refining an operational framework to acquire at scale across a diverse set of countries and industries.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the acquisition channel, responsible for top line revenue and bottom line results, sustainability and customer satisfaction. Coordinate closely with SMB Marketing, SMB Sales, SMB Services and Product Management, incorporating learnings into global best practices and reporting.
  • Develop globally executable plans that are country & industry targeted and coordinate the efforts of Sales, Marketing, Market Intelligence, and Support to maximize profitable acquisition. Understand the dynamics of customer acquisition by market/product/customer segment for the SMB channel and identify areas of opportunities.
  • Develop and implement best practices for customer onboarding, servicing, retention, reporting and integration with the service organization, while keeping consistent with Google’s corporate culture and brand image.
  • Effectively lead and mentor your team, developing their skills in areas such as relationship-building, account strategy and planning, opportunity identification and solution selling. Contribute meaningfully to the senior management team at Google, and engage with key multidisciplinary stakeholders, both external and internal, including Marketing, Engineering, Product Management and Product Development.
  • Manage high-performing team of sales representatives and managers, and grow team through targeted hiring and smart allocation of new resources.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Knowledge of the SMB segment essential. Knowledge of customer segmentation strategies.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 15 years direct sales and management experience, with experience managing cross-functional and cross-regional teams.
  • Experience in growing the revenue of an online business. 
  • Broad experience as a sales leader in charge of high-calibre sales teams, with a strong focus on coaching and mentoring, and demonstrated success developing team members is essential.
  • Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, high energy, constantly evolving, team environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to leverage quantitative analysis to improve scaled sales and marketing programs.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, outstanding analytical skills and operational skills.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Program Manager, SBS Revenue - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Program Manager, SBS Revenue

In this role, you will focus on driving the strategy and growth of one our key global revenue programs, HTC (Hyper-targeted Campaigns), which uses advertiser intelligence to grow our small and medium business advertisers by sending them highly targeted and personalized advertising solutions over multiple marketing channels. You will be focused on designing campaigns based on advertiser insights to grow specific segment of advertisers, testing and iterating multiple hypothesis with the goal of driving considerable revenue growth. You will work closely with Marketing, SMB sales and Engineering to ensure the smooth execution and implementation of HTC revenue programs. Additionally, you will have exposure and visibility to senior executives and cross-functional leaders as you evangelize the revenue opportunity and highlight revenue impact.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure and manage the successful execution of the HTC revenue programs.
  • Identify opportunities for product, program, and process improvement, with a focus on driving significant revenue growth.
  • Develop and independently run multiple global projects end-to-end.
  • Ensure successful planning, execution, analysis, and communication of your projects.
  • Advocate on behalf of SMB Revenue to cross-functional partners to drive development of requirements and execution of solutions.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 10 years of relevant experience
  • 6 years of experience in a management consulting, business strategy, or marketing role

jobs.title: Project Manager, Governance (Product Policy and Enforcement) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Project Manager, Governance (Product Policy and Enforcement) - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Online Sales and Operations, Product Quality Operations

The Product Quality Operations (PQO) team defends the integrity of Google, its users, and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products. We are dedicated to protecting Google's brand and reputation and ensuring product quality to the company's expanding base of advertisers, publishers, and users in more than 40 languages on a global basis. We partner with our Product Managers and Engineers to fight fraud and abuse across a broad range of products such as Google Search, AdWords, AdSense, Checkout and Maps. This means that PQO team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative – and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.

The role: Project Manager, Governance (Product Policy and Enforcement)

As a Project Manager in Governance, you will be responsible for ensuring a positive end user experience on Google through promoting consistency in policies across products and ensuring consistency between policies and policy enforcement. You will also be responsible for ensuring that Google as a whole has an effective ecosystem ( systems, resources, and coverage) from a policy and enforcement perspective to maximize user experience and product quality while minimizing risk. You will be at the forefront of ensuring trust and reputation not only for Google products, but also for Google as a broader brand and company. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence and communication skills. Demonstrated analytical thinking through data-driven decisions, and the technical know-how, charisma, and ability to work with various team to provide leadership to do what it takes to get things done in order to make a difference.

Responsibilities:

  • Measure and track policy consistency across products, between policy & enforcement, and partner with policy and enforcement teams to report on key operational effectiveness metrics across for all products / markets
  • Identify and communicate key policy and enforcement operational successes, inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvements to crossfunctional stakeholders in Engineering, Product, Sales, and Legal
  • Partner with teams to set targets and make improvements through training, documentation, policy revisions, and system /process changes
  • Serve as a partner to legal by providing support on relevant policy/enforcement work and flagging policy topics requiring legal expertise.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Strong Excel, SQL/DB querying skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working on semi-technical initiatives. High level of comfort to leverage technology to achieve goals. Track record as a change agent and transformative force in organizational and operational improvements.
  • Strategic and analytical thinking; strong ability to source problems, analyze data, and drive business strategies, decisions, and solutions.
  • Project Management; Attention to detail; Gets things done; Strong process improvement, prioritization and multi-tasking capabilities.
  • Work globally and cross-functionality, ability to influence while demonstrating maturity and objectiveness; Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentations).
  • Coding/programming skills.
  • Product, market, and Policy knowledge.
Apply now

jobs.title: Search Quality Evaluation Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Search Quality Evaluation Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Search Quality Evaluation Manager

The Search Quality Evaluation (SQE) team's mission is to make the world's information more useful by defending the integrity of Google Search. On the SQE team you have an opportunity to make a significant and direct impact on the quality of Google's search results. You improve user search experience by reviewing search results for quality and content. You reach out to our webmaster community, provide user support, create market-specific policies and develop tools to aid our spam-fighting endeavors. You are part of a high performing team that is passionate about keeping Google Search at its best.

As a Manager in Search Quality Operations, you lead a team responsible for protecting Google and its users. You fight abuse and fraud for Google Search while ensuring trust and reputation not only for Search, but also for Google as a broader brand and company. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence and communication. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions, as well as the technical know-how, charisma and ability to work with your team to make a big impact.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team focusing on enforcing policies by taking down and preventing spam, fraud and/or abuse for one of Googleﾒs major products (i.e. Search, Maps, AdWords, AdSense, etc.). Hire, train, lead, and mentor a specialist staff into leaders by improving their individual skills.
  • Play a major role in developing the fraud/abuse/spam fighting vision and strategy for your particular workflow(s). Partner with cross-functional stakeholders (Sales, Finance, Engineering, Product) to achieve this vision and strategy by setting up and maintaining systems and processes that ensure a seamless user experience.
  • Increase effectiveness of your specific product abuse/fraud team by identifying and implementing opportunities for improvement through people and tools/technology.
  • Transform the current workflow to make more scalable, implement a model under which efficiency and automation goals greatly exceed existing industry norms, and develop/regularly report on department growth and performance metrics.
  • Act as an educator of our policies and a point of escalation for users and internal stakeholders on spam, fraud, abuse and policy enforcement related problems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 10 years of experience leading, mentoring and motivating large operations teams (people management).
  • 7 years industry experience in one of the following areas: internet technology, online search, eCommerce, online payments or online advertising/publishing, policy enforcement, user trust, risk fraud investigation, product abuse.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience managing semi-technical teams, working in a semi-technical role.
  • High level of comfort to leverage technology to achieve business goals. In depth software development experience.
  • Strong ability to source problems, analyze data, and drive business strategies, decisions, and solutions.
  • Track record as a change agent and transformative force in organizational and operational improvements.
  • Strong process/project management, prioritization and multi-tasking capabilities.
  • Excellent leadership, influencing, organization, communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills.
