jobs.content:
Program Manager, Data Center Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View,

The area: Operations and IT, Data Center

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. We're diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers working on a daily basis to develop data centers that are changing the face of contemporary computing facilities.

The role: Program Manager, Data Center Operations

As a highly motivated senior Program Manager you will have demonstrated experience in the area of complex, multi-disciplinary, and geographically dispersed datacenter design, development and construction projects.

You will provide project management of large-scale datacenters, computer farms, networking, AC power distribution/conversion, and cooling methods at multiple scales. This role manages complex schedules, budgets, and broad inter- dependencies. You will have extensive experience managing large scale technical projects in a rapidly changing industry, be able to tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem solving leadership with limited oversight.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage multiple, simultaneous datacenter projects from inception through completion.
  • Support special R&D experiments, renovations, and upgrades of existing facility.
  • Be responsible for gathering internal requirements and delivering solutions that satisfy customer's needs.
  • Maintain end to end responsibility from construction to deployment including.
  • Demonstrate superior performance in resolving highly critical issues within matrix organization while maintaining rigorous adherence to project timelines and costs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • B.S. degree in technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of relevant work experience managing complex, multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • M.S. or PhD in Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial Engineering, construction management, or related technical field.
  • 6 years relevant work experience with datacenter equipment/environments, including switch gears, generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, controls, security monitoring systems, fire safety systems, and working understanding of start up/commissioning processes.
  • Experience managing vendor relationships and understanding of standard practices in the design and construction industry, including knowledge of fast track design build processes and associated documents, and contracts of preferred.
  • Knowledge of large scale facility electrical and mechanical systems.
  • Demonstrated skills in requirements gathering, resource organization, task prioritization, scheduling, and achieving objectives on schedule within budget.
  • Spanish language proficiency.

jobs.title: Program Manager, Data Center Sustainability - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Program Manager, Data Center Sustainability - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Program Manager, Data Center Sustainability

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

You will be contributing to Google’s sustainability goals by working closely with product engineering, operations, policy, communications and marketing teams. This role is central to maintaining -- and explaining to the world -- our commitment to maintaining carbon neutrality, advancing efficient computing, and ensuring Google’s infrastructure, products and services are sustainable.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the communications team to extend Google’s reputation as the leader in data center sustainability and present Google’s DC sustainability efforts to lay and technical audiences worldwide
  • Help Google “lead by example” by working with industry groups and educating others about what we do and how we do it through various means including content creation: write data center blog posts, white papers and journal articles
  • Own technical content for all external data center sustainability communications, including tracking & reporting PUE performance, renewable energy mix, water use, embodied energy
  • Lead Google’s participation in governmental and industry standard efforts such as the EU’s Data Center CoC and the DOE’s EnergyStar programs as well as manage Google’s participation in (or hosting of) data center events
  • Be a central contributor to Google’s global sustainability approach for operations

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in science, technology, engineering or mathematics field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/PhD
  • Strong program management skills with 2 years of relevant program management and team development experience
  • Extremely strong collaborative communication skills, technical writing, public speaking
  • Ability to make complicated technical concepts accessible to lay people. Ability to set direction and prioritize multiple efforts, capable of defining group goals and helping team members reach those goals
  • An established record of “boundary spanning” -
  • working with multiple disparate groups: engineering, operations, policy, PR, marketing
  • A high level of “numeracy.” You are fluent in power, energy, flow rates, fluxes, etc. Converting among energy units is second-nature
Apply now

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world, and the Global Logistics team procures and manages the resources that power our immense collection. As a part of this team, you apply your knowledge of supply chain principles and your problem solving prowess to key logistics processes (managing vendors, shipping & receiving, inventory management, warehousing & distribution, transportation, etc.). You help the networking material supply chain by understanding the unique needs of the deployment team and defining best practices across multiple cross-functional teams. jobs.title: Decision Support Engineering Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Decision Support Engineering Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Decision Support Engineering Analyst

As a Decision Support Engineering Analyst, you will help evaluate and improve Google's ads. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers and analysts on a wide range of problems. This position will bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of measuring ads quality, looking into problems such as how to optimize both our ads quality and our revenue and how to build models of end-user behavior.

Responsibilities:

  • Research and develop methods for measuring and analyzing ads quality.
  • Research new algorithms and methods for optimizing ads quality and revenue.
  • Research new ways for modeling end-user behavior.
  • Lead investigations into multiple streams of ads quality data.
  • Design experiments to answer targeted questions.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience including statistical software (R, S-Plus, SAS, or similar), databases and scripting languages (such as Python).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree or PhD in Statistics or related field.
  • 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Substantial real-world experience, especially in areas such as data.
  • Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
  • Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.
  • Demonstrated leadership and self-direction.

jobs.title: Network Analyst, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Analyst, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Network Analyst, Operations Decision Support

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Quantitative Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

As a member of the Operations Decision Support team, you will lead cross-functional projects and drive mission-critical initiatives in the optimization of one of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructures. You will work with Engineers, Analysts, Product Managers, and other Network Systems stakeholders to develop data-driven strategies and decision support tools to optimize Google’s network topology and capacity. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a business and as an operation, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background on one of the most advanced computational and network infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable proposing financial strategies to the CFO or discussing with engineers the technical and financial trade-offs involved in hardware design and deployment strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional projects and long-term analytic development initiatives, managing multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to frame, structure and prioritize business problems where analytic projects or tools can have the biggest impact on Google’s network infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with other analysts, subject matter experts and decision makers to develop data-driven policies, models or decision-support tools to improve the cost and latency of Google’s network infrastructure.
  • Draw from a breadth of analytical methods to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate to solving the business problem. Develop more advanced analytical tools and algorithms when appropriate.
  • Communicate findings to senior management and partner with stakeholders to drive adoption of recommendations, policies or tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • M.S. in operations research or related technical field. In lieu of degree, four years of relevant experience.
  • 5 years experience in applying operations research methods to solve business problems in operations or analytic consulting roles.
  • Proficiency in at least one scripting language like Matlab, R, or Python or a higher level programming language like C++.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PhD in operations research or related field.
  • 10 years relevant work experience.
  • Domain expertise in network systems, and experience with network optimization models.
  • Breadth in analytics “basics”: spreadsheet modeling; financial analysis; working with large datasets and writing SQL queries to extract and transform data; basic probability and statistics (e.g., conditional probability, descriptive statistics, basic hypothesis testing, and linear regression models).
  • Breadth in operations research methods relevant to network planning: optimization, simulation, stochastic modeling, and decision analysis.
  • Experience leading cross-functional project teams through strong problem-framing and problem-structuring skills, project management skills, and the ability to communicate insights and “so what’s” to highly technical management teams.
Apply now

jobs.title: Program Manager, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Program Manager, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Program Manager, Operations Decision Support

As a member of the Operations Decision Support team, you will lead cross-functional projects and drive mission-critical initiatives in the optimization of one of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructures. You will work broadly across all Google operations groups to develop data-driven strategies and decision support tools to optimize the procurement, planning, delivery, and allocation of compute, storage and data center capacity around the globe. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a business and as an operation, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background on one of the most advanced computational infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable proposing financial strategies to the CFO or discussing with engineers the technical and financial trade-offs involved in hardware design and deployment strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional projects, managing multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously. Seamlessly collaborate with engineers in problem framing and cost/benefit modeling of alternatives.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to frame, structure and prioritize business problems where analytic projects or tools can have the biggest impact on Google’s computing infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with other analysts, subject matter experts and decision makers to develop data-driven policies, strategies or decision-support tools to improve the efficiency and responsiveness of Google’s compute infrastructure.
  • Apply hypothesis-driven problem-solving approaches to strategic decision projects and to initial “discovery” stages of longer-term tool or policy development projects. Collaborate with quantitative analysts to develop more advanced analytical tools and algorithms when appropriate.
  • Communicate findings to senior management and partner with stakeholders to drive adoption of recommendations, policies or tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • B.S. Computer Science, statistics or related technical field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 2 years of relevant work experience, including 1 year industry experience or equivalent, applying analytics to solve business problems in analytic consulting or strategy consulting roles.
  • Strong spreadsheet modeling, financial analysis and data analysis skills. Proficiency in SQL or capability to learn quickly based on experience with databases.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • M.S. or PhD in operations research, industrial engineering, statistics, computer science or related technical field.
  • 4 years relevant work experience, 2 years industry experience.
  • Domain expertise in one or both of these areas: supply chain planning and modeling, compute infrastructure technologies or operations.
  • Breadth in analytics “basics”: spreadsheet modeling; financial and decision analysis; working with large datasets, and basic probability and statistics (e.g., conditional probability, descriptive statistics, basic hypothesis testing, and linear regression models).
  • Experience leading cross-functional project teams through strong problem-framing and problem-structuring skills, project management skills, and the ability to communicate insights and “so what’s” to highly technical management teams.

jobs.content:
Developer Advocate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Developer Advocate

We're self-proclaimed nerds, and our Developer Relations organization helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do. Developer Advocates are focused on supporting the 3rd party developers who are building applications and businesses on Google's platforms. You are passionate evangelists for Google technologies as well as vocal champions for developer interests within Google. This is a position for engineers who love connecting with developers and speaking publicly about cutting-edge technologies on conference panels, at user groups, on blogs and with the press. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5 as well as our core Google Apps and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

You foster a community of developers working with Google technologies and help drive strategy around our Developer Relations. You also communicate internally with Product Managers as an advocate for developers.

Responsibilities:

  • Create momentum and drive the success of Google’s developer products and the open web through your interactions with third party developers building applications and businesses on them.
  • Advocate the adoption of Google developer products to strategic partners and the broader developer community.
  • Participate in technical and design discussions with technical executives at strategic partners to speed adoption and ensure best practices during implementation.
  • Evangelize our developer products in person and online by presenting at conferences, blogging, writing technical tutorials, and other similar activities.
  • Advocate for developers internally, and influence Google developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Engineering, PR, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of relevant work experience, including experience working directly with large partners.
  • Solid programming abilities in one or more of the following languages: Java, PHP, Python, Ruby, .NET, JavaScript.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science or similar field.
  • 6 years relevant work experience, including experience blogging and writing technical articles, ideally with an existing follower base, as well as experience working directly with press and bloggers.
  • Strong command of web application or mobile application development landscapes.
  • Considerable success as a software developer, architect, technology evangelist, CTO, or consultant working with web or mobile technologies.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Developer Programs Engineer

As a Developer Programs Engineer at Google, you will be a member of the Developer Relations organization. Developer Relations is focused on driving the success of Google's developer products and the open web by creating a thriving ecosystem of 3rd party applications and businesses built on them. You will be an evangelist for our newest technologies in the outside world, as well as a vocal advocate for developers' needs within Google. We expect you to be an engineer who thrives on the cutting edge of technology and loves seeing exciting, new applications and business that other developers are building. As a Developer Programs Engineer you will interact with and support third-party developers. In this position, you will be responsible for growing and supporting the developer community around products such as Chrome, Android, App Engine, Google Wave, Google Maps API, HTML5, and also support our core Google Apps and Ads businesses. You should have strong web or mobile application development skills and love troubleshooting challenging coding issues and participating in developer communities.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist third-party developers in troubleshooting their integrations with Google APIs and use of other Google developer products.
  • Manage and participate in developer discussion forums and support queues to debug and resolve technical/coding problems.
  • Write sample code and client libraries, and contribute to open source projects.
  • Build strong ecosystem for developer products by blogging, writing technical articles, making presentations at developer conferences, and working with local developer communities.
  • Help product engineering teams improve developer products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs, and testing new features.

  • Programming abilities in one or more of the following languages: Java, PHP, Python, Ruby, .NET, JavaScript.

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager/Director, Google.com - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Engineering Manager/Director, Google.com - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Engineering Management

Google.com Engineering makes Google's services fast and reliable for hundreds of millions of users. This mission critical team (also known as Site Reliability Engineering) combines software development, networking, and systems engineering expertise to build and run large scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant software systems and infrastructure. We hire creative engineers and technology enthusiasts who enjoy being challenged by problems of scale and complexity, with a strong desire to make services better for users. We routinely solve software and systems issues ranging from distributed change propagation on live serving systems, to designing and deploying intelligent load balancing systems for the largest user-facing services in the world. Our teams come from diverse backgrounds, and we are actively seeking new team members to bring fresh perspective to solving problems, along with the technical and soft skills needed to keep Google’s services growing and reliable.

The role: Engineering Manager/Director, Google.com

Google.com engineering, put simply, makes sure that Google's premier services always work and are always fast. The team takes classic "ops" problems and solves them with engineering and software - not humans and dashboards - yielding very high uptime (at very large scale!) with surprisingly small groups of software, network and system engineers. In Google.com, you will be part of one of the most demanding, rewarding and high-profile divisions within Google.

An ideal candidate for this role will have prior experience managing multiple user-facing services and the teams which developed and operated them, will be capable of technical deep-dives into code, networking, operating systems and storage yet verbally and cognitively agile enough to hold their own in a strategy discussion with Google's executive team.

Responsibilities:

  • Own end-to-end availability and performance of Google's most visible services and properties.
  • Ensure a great, almost-100% reliable experience for Google users around the globe while simultaneously enabling a rapid pace of innovation and change in the services

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of relevant work experience including hands-on technical management experience.
  • Expertise in several of: C, C++, Java, sh/PERL/Python, UNIX/Linux use & internals, IP networking & network devices.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/PhD in a related field.
  • 12 years of relevant hands-on technical management experience of software developers, systems administrators/architects, as well as a record of individual technical achievement.
  • Prior experience managing multiple user-facing services and the teams which developed and operated them.
  • Capable of technical deep-dives into code, networking, operating systems and storage yet verbally and cognitively agile enough to hold their own in a strategy discussion with Google's executive team.
  • Comfortable recruiting and managing a team of very bright, experienced engineers on projects and at scale unlike any other they've encountered.
  • That rare mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of technically astute teams across the company.

jobs.content:
Engineering Productivity Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering Leadership

Google Test Engineers guarantee that our company's software works every time for every user while scaling to the highest levels. We tackle huge technical challenges that push the limits of computer science. Our team is a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill and a passion for quality.

The role: Engineering Productivity Manager

As an Engineering Productivity Manager at Google you will be building, leading and managing a team of Software Engineers in Test and Test Engineers, while working with our development teams and product management staff to release scalable and innovative products. As a highly skilled technical engineering manager with a strong background in software engineering, you will be responsible for driving the overall planning, execution, tracking and delivery of critical projects

  • Foster collaboration between different teams for successful releases.
  • Mentor junior members of the team in software development, testing methodology and release support.

Requirements:

  • BS degree or equivalent, MBA a plus, preferably in computer science, computer information systems or computer related field with at least 10 years of experience.
  • High technical competence with current hands on coding skills in C++, Java or Python being essential.
  • Strong development management or testing management experience with a proven track record in scaling highly technical teams.
  • Experience in building testing frameworks, tools and automation within a large scale enterprise environment.
  • Strong project management skills including experience managing in an agile / test driven environment.
  • Proven track record for high quality product delivery demonstrating your penchant for technology.

jobs.title: Manager, Technical Program Management, Platforms - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manager, Technical Program Management, Platforms - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Manager, Technical Program Management, Platforms

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing server, storage or networking products you will provide leadership role to our world-class Server and Storage Products development team.
  • Responsible for defining and communicating the product roadmap for Google's proprietary server infrastructure and working with a unique cross organizational team to deliver against that roadmap .
  • Identify opportunities to accelerate product launches while maintaining high quality levels and striking the optimum balance of engineering disciplin, entrepreneurial attitude, tactical decision making and strategic vision as you continually push for aggressive improvements in the price performance of our compute infrastructure. In addition, you will monitor and manage the quality of servers deployed in Data Centers to ensure optimal performance throughout the full life cycle, and ensure that technical communication and documentation is up to date and correct.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in EE or CS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Work with customers, the technical design team and suppliers to establish short and long term product, resource and budget requirements.
  • Provide direction to the HW Engineers who are responsible for design and development of the new server systems, matching project needs to individual development plans, and oversee the HW design, verification and system bringup and validation activities during the development phase for all new products introduced by the Server Development team.
  • Work with partners within Google and external suppliers to define high level development plans.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree.
  • Design of servers or processor subsystems (x86 architecture design experience preferred), system bringup and hardware software integration experience.
  • An understanding of Manufacturing Operations, Product Life Cycle Management, and working with Manufacturing Partners.
  • Ability to independently lead multiple development projects, and qualification teams working with software, hardware, firmware and networking engineers.
  • Experience in supporting a large customer or deployed product base.
  • A history of delivering complex hardware assemblies through to production.

jobs.title: Network Operations Support System (OSS) Engineering Director - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Operations Support System (OSS) Engineering Director - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Network Operations Support System (OSS) Engineering Director

Network OSS Director provides architecture and design leadership to ensure continued enhancement of net-OSS features in the Google production network. Google network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to Internet users throughout the world. The scale of Google's network infrastructure generates an interesting set of operational support systems challenges which need to be solved by an evolving set of sophisticated systems and tools. Such tools require innovation in network management architecture in every segment of the OSI networking layers - from transport to application stacks. You will be faced with development of network tools and systems for operational functions such as surveillance, fault and configuration management, performance analysis management, and operations analytics and reporting at a large scale in support of Google’s services.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a global team of software engineering groups to research, identify, evaluate, and recommend network OSS middleware architecture within the framework of the operating environment of Google’s global network.
  • Cooperate with NetOps leadership team to develop an architectural roadmap for a comprehensive set of network OSS requirements for emerging network technologies in support of Google service offering.
  • Lead development and implementation of network OSS within Google's network infrastructure.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS degree (in lieu of degree, 4 years of equivalent experience with a strong software engineering discipline).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • M.S./Ph.D. degree
  • 15 years of experience in network OSS architecture, design, software engineering, and implementation roles in a large scale network service provider, OSS technology supplier, or in a network management system supplier.
  • In-depth knowledge and operational experience with large scale network OSS in content and network service provider environments.
  • In-depth knowledge of existing industry standards, technologies, and operational norms for network OSS in IEEE and ITU - with a focus on optical and IP routing layer network technologies.
  • Operational experience in leading cross-functional teams through development of large scale software systems and tools
Apply now

jobs.title: Supplier Quality Development Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Supplier Quality Development Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Research and Systems Infrastructure

At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end ninjas: protecting your privacy, ensuring your security and leaving no trace behind.

The role: Supplier Quality Development Manager

Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

You use your technical expertise to create test plans for highly complex platforms (e.g., validating the interaction of multiple pieces of equipment at the networking and subsystem levels), and diagnose highly complex hardware or software issues using your deep knowledge of component design characteristics. You also consult on testing issues for vendors and manufacturers.

The Supplier Quality Development Manager will be responsible to lead Supplier development to meet targeted quality levels developed with an innovate Google design team working on a new product category. This position will be responsible for developing and executing on quality goals and tests on new Google and supplier technologies, development of the suppliers quality systems and help drive failure analysis and corrective actions. The Supplier Quality Development Manager should have the proven ability to analyze, interpret and quantify product supplier quality through statistics, test results, and supplier readiness metrics.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop suppliers’ quality plans to meet Google specifications.
  • Review supplier detailed test plans and test reports
  • Develop new quality test procedures and specifications
  • Perform statistical data analysis to provide risk assessments of a module or technology quality.
  • Provide design input to improve product quality and reliability

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in engineering or related field. (In lieu of degree, 3 years of relevant work experience).
  • 3 years experience with quality and reliability testing including Mechanical Stress Tests, Shock, / Drop / Vibration Testing, Environmental Testing.
  • 3 years experience with materials characterization and analytical techniques (Optical Microscopy, X-Ray, SEM/EDS, FTIR, XPS, etc.)
  • 3 years experience with FMEA, DOE, data and SPC analysis (e.g. Weibull ++, JMP)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Engineering.
  • Knowledge of Industry Test Standards (JEDEC, ASTM, IEEE).
  • Detail-oriented with exceptional problem solving abilities.
  • Strong communication skills, and can do attitude.
Apply now

jobs.title: Tech Lead/Manager, YouTube - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Tech Lead/Manager, YouTube - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in San Bruno, CA. or Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, YouTube (a Google company) hires engineers that make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. YouTube is the leader in online video, and the premier destination to watch and share original videos worldwide through a Web experience. YouTube allows people to easily upload and share video clips on www.youtube.com and across the Internet through websites, mobile devices, blogs and email.

The role: Tech Lead/Manager, YouTube

The YouTube transcoding team makes sure that this massive amount of video (that comes in a wide diversity of formats) is properly decoded, and then re-encoded into all supported output formats while keeping the balance between video quality, video bitrate and processing cost at an optimum. Finding the right balance is challenging, but also very important for our business and our users! We’re looking for someone to focus on these ever mounting challenges and to scale these services cost-effectively. We already know a few pieces of the puzzle: developing better and better metrics for video quality, using the vast amount of YouTube usage data to calibrating them, continually tracking and possibly improving the state of the art in video and audio compression, etc. We will discover more puzzle pieces as we go. As a Tech Lead/Manager (TLM) at YouTube, you will provide technical leadership over a team of highly talented software engineers. You will be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects. This position is not a pure management position; TLMs are expected to contribute technically to their project. Our interview process will emphasize technical skills and management/organizational skills equally.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide leadership to a group of engineers in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
  • Own and drive complex technical projects from the planning stage through execution.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of software engineering management experience.
  • Analytical skills with previous experience working with complex data sets.
  • Programming experience in at least one of the following: Java, C++ or Python.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD degree.
  • Experience with audio and/or video coding.
  • Experience with one or more of the following: codec internals, video quality metrics, open source tools like ffmpeg, mencoder, x264 etc., large system deployments, consumer science.
  • Demonstrated expertise in problem solving and technical innovation.
  • Strong distributed systems and architecture knowledge.
  • Background in Web applications, data mining, information retrieval and multi-tiered systems.
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Chrome/Chrome OS - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Chrome/Chrome OS - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Chrome OS

Google Chrome OS is an open source, lightweight operating system designed for speed, simplicity and security. The Chrome OS Partner Solutions team is dedicated to developing and managing the largest and most strategic technical partnerships for Chrome OS. We manage the hardware/software integration and product delivery for all partners in the growing Chrome OS ecosystem. We build innovative solutions to help our team and partners achieve product excellence at scale, fostering long-term relationships and bringing world-changing technology to market.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Chrome/Chrome OS

As a Technical Program Manager, you'll keep an innovative engineering team firing on all cylinders, keep up a pace of frequent releases, and keep users happy. You have experience in leading teams through successful releases of consumer software, whether as a project manager, release manager, or team lead.

You will work closely with software engineers, product managers, and the open source community to get high-quality products and new features built, tested, and released on time. You'll coordinate lots of fast-changing, moving parts and still get them to come together as a product. You'll need excellent communication skills to be the center of the universe for all questions about release schedules, quality, and progress updates. You will be responsible for identifying and managing risks, making sound judgements about quality, and stopping (or speeding up) production at the right time.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and prioritize implementation tasks for software releases.
  • Monitor quality of releases and interim development, triage and assign issues. Coordinate fixes for release branches and publish releases.
  • Monitor incoming bugs and code changes to identify quality issues and trends.
  • Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.
  • Communicate schedules, priorities, and status to all levels in the company and open source community.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Computer Science degree. (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years relevant work experience, including experience managing and improving software engineering processes (bug tracking, builds, test, and release).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree.
  • Experience shipping consumer desktop products or OS systems in Windows or Unix/Linux.
  • In-depth familiarity with one source code management system (SVN, Perforce).
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Apply now

The area: Engineering

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Compliance

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Google is looking for a self-motivated individual with strong skills in technical program management, negotiation, problem solving, and relationship management to coordinate compliance efforts within engineering and related functions. This role will work closely with engineering, internal audit, legal and other stakeholders to analyze, define, and verify current and future control solutions to ensure compliance as well as drive the execution of remediation plans. Additionally, the Technical Program Manager will work in measuring and improving current processes and designs to facilitate increased efficiency and execution.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and assess IT-related risks and control weaknesses, and manage, track and control project issues to ensure timely delivery of solutions.
  • Develop reports to track planning, scheduling, issues, risks, and overall status, as well as oversee the creation of new processes and tools as necessary to support additional needs and requirements on an ongoing basis.
  • Be a subject matter expert on IT General Control (IGCG) related requirements, and define and drive the use of internal tools to track compliance related metrics, as well as manage automation of manual compliance processes, to improve predictability and efficiency in various compliance programs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years technical program management within an IT related field along with an understanding of controls at the systems, network, and application level.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Masterful interpersonal skills with the ability to work closely with people at all levels of the organization and facilitate the implementation of corrective actions.
  • Proven ability to build and maintain constructive working and communications relationships with a diverse community of technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Hands on, working knowledge of SOX and related financial controls, requirements and processes; PCI, CISA, CISM, COSO, COBIT, ISO 27001, IT audit, or risk management knowledge.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Payments Engineering - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Payments Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Payments Engineering

As a technical program manager for Payments Engineering at Google, you will be central to the operations of the cross-functional team. On a daily basis you will be responsible for working with a wide variety of external vendors, partners, and internal customers including software engineers, product managers, finance, and UX designers to orchestrate and lead the team through many production and software release cycles.

Beyond solid program delivery and technical skills, you should be a professional with proven experience in problem solving, software product development, and delivery of complex large-scale hardware/software projects. You are a top performer with a rare and specific skill set who will thrive in a very fast-paced and demanding environment. Your ability to think critically, lead through intellect, deliver quickly, and to partner across a wide variety of functions at Google to drive change in a complex setting will be essential to the Payments Program. You will have strong internal drive, a tenacious spirit, a collaborative method of working and deep experience in delivering complex systems on time. You will need excellent communication skills to be the center of the universe for all questions about schedules, quality and progress updates.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage technical projects or programs, working closely with external vendors, Google engineers and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
  • Gather requirements and define the scope of the project. Find resources, manage resource allocation for projects. Develop a plan and schedule, with well-defined milestones.
  • Manage communication of progress/status within the core team and external to the team (customers, partners, etc); escalate issues as necessary.
  • Remove roadblocks and keep processes running smoothly.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Computer Science degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree.
  • 8 years relevant work experience, including 6 years industry experience in managing large, complex projects.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills, understands what it takes to write code, and has exposure to large-scale systems.
  • Adept at leading teams of highly talented, independent individuals with a track record of quickly earning credibility based on your knowledge throughout, and amazing accomplishments.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical abilities.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Search - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Search - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Search

Technical Project Managers plan, facilitate, and manage the deployment of new services purchased from third party suppliers and vendors worldwide. You will interact with a wide variety of Google engineers as well as vendor representatives on a regular basis as a member of a small, efficient team which is responsible for monitoring experiments, adjusting priorities as necessary, and writing clear concise vendor management and communication instructions.

You will work closely with the technical negotiation team to understand the terms of new contracts and arrangements including delivery targets and technical requirements. Managers also work closely with internal project management teams to communicate target completion dates and ensure that all internal requirements are being met in a timely manner. You will co-operatively work with external vendors to gather and enforce schedules for installation of services and ensure that all services are met with desired technical and service specifications, and facilitate communications between all relevant stakeholders both internal and external to ensure services are delivered correctly and on schedule.

You will be an integral participant in analyzing vendor data, looking for trends and signals that can be used as new quality metrics. The ideal candidate will also have the ability to write some scripts, preferably in Python.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee, analyze and monitor multiple evaluation projects within Search quality.
  • Analyze data using logic and reason to make sound decisions/recommendations.
  • Ability to work as a member of a team, working closely together and jumping in to help out with some routine tasks.
  • Develop and prepare project documentation, improve processes, maintain web pages and track reports to communicate details of project.
  • Build positive relationships and trust over time through strong on-time delivery of projects, high quality, continuous innovation, and by exceeding expectations.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering (In lieu of degree, 4 years in an IT-related field)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong organizational, project management, analysis and communication skills.
  • Ability to work well as a member of a highly integrated team composed of both technical and non-technical members.
  • Ability to manage/juggle competing priorities without loss of efficiency.
  • Ability to understand technical subjects and emerging technologies and relevance to the marketplace.
  • Strong analysis skills as well as some experience with a scripting language such as Python.
Apply now

jobs.title: Release Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Release Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Release Engineering

The Release Engineering team plays an integral role in software development at Google, as we're responsible for implementing and executing our products' release processes. We support Google's software development teams by reviewing new and changed code, tracking and auditing change histories and debugging build and runtime problems. Additionally, we update release branches in our source control system, build and test release binaries, and push releases to production.

The role: Release Engineer

Google's Release Engineering team ensures that Google's services and programs are released in an orderly manner from development to production. The team establishes procedures and develops tools that are used in Google offices all over the world. As a Release Engineer you'll use your strong technical ability and your skills at understanding complex systems in order to drive product releases. You'll work with other release engineers, developers, QA teams, and product managers to ensure that Google's products are delivered with a repeatable and auditable process. You'll have opportunities to work with server infrastructure on Linux, and also on client software platforms from desktop OS's (Windows, Mac) to mobile (Blackberry, iPhone, Android).

Responsibilities:

  • Support and improve our tools for continuous integration, automated testing and release management.
  • Manage release branches.
  • Build and sanity test release binaries (server-side).
  • Push new releases to production (server-side).
  • Maintain the build process to support ongoing R&D.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in software engineering, release engineering, and/or configuration management.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 6 years relevant work experience.
  • Familiarity with software configuration management systems and/or source code version control systems. Perforce experience.
  • Server side products: knowledge of Unix/Linux. Client side products: knowledge of multiple client OS's, such as Windows/Mac/Linux/iPhone/Blackberry/Android.
  • Skill with one or more scripting languages. Python experience.
  • Experience with code signing and build management tools (make, scons, ant).
  • Experience building C++ and Java applications.
Apply now

jobs.title: Corporate Network Infrastructure Operations Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Corporate Network Infrastructure Operations Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Corporate Network Infrastructure Operations Manager

Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the Googler user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices). You occasionally partner with various teams including security, networking and infrastructure. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.

Responsibilities:

  • Successfully manage a team of TPMs and operations technicians who are responsible for the maintenance of Google corporate offices.
  • Partner with the network engineering and network deploy teams to deliver corporate network technologies.
  • Handle the majority of escalation and problem resolution between different deployment teams
  • Provide metrics on the success and failures of each project with recommendations on ways to improve processes.
  • Build successful relationships with the internal and external teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree (In lieu of degree, 10 years relevant work/management experience).
  • 7 years operations management and/or project/program management experience with large, complex projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience managing senior resources (Technical Program Managers and Engineers).
  • Enterprise Networking, Layer 1 Infrastructure Experience, and previous hands-on ability with on-site technical deployments (fiber, copper, cabling, server room, power, cooling, rack setup, etc).
  • Portfolio Management - multiple concurrent projects which require prioritization, scheduling, risk management, contingency planning.

jobs.title: Global Infrastructure Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Global Infrastructure Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Corporate Network

The Corporate Network Engineering team plays a critical role in Google's overall success. This is because we build, maintain and ensure the excellence of the network that sits behind the internal applications our company employees use every day. Our work consists of gathering and implementing network requirements, evaluating new and upgrading existing network equipment – and participating in a rotating, on-call schedule with other team members. All of us are LAN experts with in-depth knowledge of TCP/IP fundamentals, and we're dedicated to providing the type of fluid service that promotes the best possible work.

The role: Global Infrastructure Manager

In your role as Global Infrastructure Manager you will successfully lead, manage and develop a team that designs, engineers, deploys and maintains the copper/fiber plant as well as the space, power and cooling needs for the Google corporate enterprise. You will be accountable to identify risk, dependency and resource (human and material) needs in the deployment of this project. Along with your team, you will work to craft successful cross-functional working relationships with key customers to document and agree on global standards. Your team will be dependent upon your success to minimize the issues that hamper their productivity and keep everything moving in an environment where change is the norm!

Responsibilities:

  • Build a global team capable of successfully executing your mission.
  • Develop, track and use metrics to justify headcount, operations, deployments, projects and design/engineering plans.
  • Define, implement and demonstrate progress on a maturity model for your team.
  • Ensure development and maintenance of road-map for global copper and fiber plant.
  • Partner with customer to document and agree on global standards, and be involved with capacity monitoring and Interface with real estate globally.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA in a technical discipline. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience in an IT-related field.
  • Past responsibilities to have included several of the following areas; infrastructure deployments, copper, cable plants, construction sites, fiber optics, networking (high level understanding, able to sit with engineers).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Large company/corporate experience.
  • Strong leadership and management background.
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills.

jobs.title: Lead Opto-Mechanical Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Lead Opto-Mechanical Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Hardware Operations

Google's Hardware Operations team consists of diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers who design and operate some of the most sophisticated systems in the world. This fast-growing group develops, builds and supports the physical infrastructure behind Google's products.

The role: Lead Opto-Mechanical Engineer

Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Mechanical Engineer you design and evaluate our data center systems, identifying product requirements and contributing to research and project planning. From the chip to chiller, you are responsible for designing and optimizing an architecture that will scale with Google's continued growth.

With your technical and leadership expertise, you lead a team who analyzes data and who designs and evaluates systems and networks. You also manage project priorities, provide consultation to others and collaborate both internally and externally.

The Camera Systems Team has developed a myriad of cameras for multiple projects such as Google Street View or the Google Art Project and is looking for an experienced engineer in the design, manufacturing and calibration of high precision optical systems. In this critical position, you will be part of exciting fast-paced projects. Your role will include working as a team with mechanical, hardware and software engineers to tackle challenging design issues while improving existing manufacturing processes. The most successful candidate for the role will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills specifically in the field of complex opto-mechanical systems operating in harsh environments. An experience as a system engineer and/or a project manager in a multi-disciplinary project involving optics, mechanical integration, hardware and software and overall qualification would be a clear plus.

Responsibilities:

  • Design opto-mechanical systems; Design, specify and manage manufacturing of lab equipment
  • Specify, evaluate and qualify high precision optical assemblies
  • Manage manufacturing of opto-mechanical systems with 3rd party suppliers
  • Review and influence new and evolving designs, standards and methods
  • Respond to and resolve emergent problems, build tools to improve current processes

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering or Physics or related field (In lieu of degree, 6 years of relevant work experience)
  • Technical troubleshooting experience
  • Experience with CAD package and FEA tools associated

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/Ph.D in Mechanical Engineering, Physics or System Engineering with 5 years of relevant working experience
  • Experience working in multidisciplinary small team
  • Experience with optical systems in harsh environment (milspec, aerospace equipment...)
  • Experience with lens design/ray tracing software package (zemax, code5...)
  • Familiar with programming language C++ or python and build tools for technicians
Apply now

jobs.title: Manufacturing Test Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manufacturing Test Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Manufacturing Test Engineer

Google's custom-designed equipment makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.

You design and analyze products and related data, improve manufacturing and supportive processes and determine and execute customer and product requirements. You lead small teams on complex projects that involve analyzing data, improving manufacturing and support processes and , including managing timelines and resources and providing expertise to internal and external partners, teams and vendors.

Responsibilities:

  • Support new and existing hardware designs.
  • Write test plans and drive test coverage based on product requirements.
  • Develop automated test scripts for functional test, software installation and burn-in.
  • Design, build and deploy test platforms for Google's global manufacturing partners.
  • Analyze, troubleshoot and root cause manufacturing yield issues and field escapes. Drive issues to closure with preventive measures.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree.
  • Development of manufacturing test software.
  • Capable of generating product-specific test plans and executing testing accordingly.
  • Experience with scripting languages, particularly Python.
  • Experience with Labview, Minitab, SPCXL, SolidWorks and ProE
  • Excellent networking skills and a willingness to travel.

jobs.title: Program Manager, Operations Delivery - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Program Manager, Operations Delivery - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Program Manager, Operations Delivery

You will manage cross-functional projects in the delivery and management of one of the world's most impressive computing infrastructures. You will be responsible for developing deployment plans and fulfillment strategies for the delivery of production compute resources, from machines to networking to datacenter infrastructure. You will oversee relationships with key partners and ensure execution of plans and on-time delivery. You will collaborate with all organizational levels to perform fulfillment planning and analysis, manage project forecasts and schedules, define problem solving and risk mitigation strategies and facilitate conflict resolution through the full project cycle.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and oversee deployment plans related to the delivery and management of Google's computing infrastructure.
  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Manage key relationships with partners and customers, performing operational planning and forecasting.
  • Drive process initiatives to optimize delivery of computing resources – create work plans, gather and synthesize relevant data, lead analysis and develop final recommendations.
  • Identify delivery metrics and lead efforts to improve the efficiency, quality and cost of resource management to scale with the growth of Google.

Requirements:

  • BS degree preferred in an Engineering or IT-related field (MS a plus).
  • At least 4 years of datacenter / networking / operations experience, including experience in multi-tiered distributed application environments.
  • Proven project management, interpersonal and communication skills, with high attention to detail.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation and organizational skills. Clear focus under pressure.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.

jobs.title: Quantitative Analyst, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Quantitative Analyst, Operations Decision Support - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Quantitative Analyst, Operations Decision Support

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Quantitative Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional projects and long-term analytic development initiatives, managing multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to frame, structure and prioritize business problems where analytic projects or tools can have the biggest impact on Google’s computing infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with other analysts, subject matter experts and decision makers to develop data-driven policies, models or decision-support tools to improve the efficiency and responsiveness of Google’s compute infrastructure.
  • Draw from a breadth of analytical methods to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate to solving the business problem. Develop more advanced analytical tools and algorithms when appropriate.
  • Communicate findings to senior management and partner with stakeholders to drive adoption of recommendations, policies or tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • M.S. in operations research, industrial engineering, statistics or related field (in lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in applying analytics to solve business problems in operations or analytic consulting roles.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ph.D in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or related field.
  • 6 years supply chain or data center operations analytics experience.
  • Strong problem-framing, problem-solving and project management skills, with the ability to communicate insights and "so what's" to highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated customer service focus and team collaboration skills.
Apply now
