jobs.title: Sales Systems Manager, SBS Advertiser Acquisitions and Sales - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Sales Systems Manager, SBS Advertiser Acquisitions and Sales - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Sales Systems Manager, SBS Advertiser Acquisitions and Sales 

The Acquisitions Program Team drives the acquisition of new high-growth advertisers for Google by partnering with the Inside Sales Organization (ISO), and External Telesales Organization (ETO). The team leads the design, planning and operations of programs that drive a scalable and analytical approach to generating incremental revenue growth. We work in partnership with cross-functional teams across Sales, Marketing, Finance, Product and Engineering. Experts in driving strategy, process improvement and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic approach to high impact delivery. In this role, you will manage the Sales Systems/CRMs that are used by a 2,000 person front-line Sales organization. This is a strategic role that will require you to design and articulate systems solutions to complex, ambiguous and high visibility business challenges. You will work closely with sales and cross-functional leaders to ensure the various tools used by front-line sales teams are integrating and scaling with changes to strategy. You will provide sales systems and business analysis expertise to the ISO and ETO Sales leadership teams. Additionally, you will have exposure and visibility to senior executives and cross-functional leaders as you evangelize the systems opportunities in their support of programs to drive incremental revenue and productivity. Our ideal candidate is a well-rounded top performer who can be a key contributor in a high energy growth environment. Your application should indicate that you are a top academic performer with a wide variety of extracurricular interests and the desire to excel in everything you do. You should be a self starter that can administer sales systems/CRM one minute and critically think through strategic issues the next. You will gain invaluable experience in this high impact role working in a dynamic environment. You will have a deep understanding of Sales, call center operations and processes, business analytics, project management and you will have excellent communication and presentation skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Accountable for the maintenance and administering all systems use for 2,000+ users (multiple languages/countries).
  • Oversight for the management of centralized lead processing, cleansing, and distribution.
  • Creation and maintenance of standard reporting tools for team, regional, and global levels.
  • Develop materials, present training on systems use, as needed and own and Administer Salesforce.com CRM system – design, developing and implement new functionality on a quarterly basis to automate interactions with the CRM, and implement other updates as required.
  • Act as key liaison point for other departments (e.g. Marketing, Sales Operations, Product Specialists). Ensure cross-functional coordination and alignment in systems development.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in economics, mathematics, physics, statistics or accounting.  In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Proficiency with APEX coding, VisualForce and previous experience with CTI integration.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Salesforce.com Certified Administrator and Developer, with relevant practical experience at both.
  • Distinctive research and problem solving skills, combined with strong business judgment.
  • Analytical mind that is capable of structured analysis of data together with ability to synthesize data into useful formats and bring actionable insights.
  • Superior Excel modeling skills (pivot tables, macros etc.) and PowerPoint skills. Strong database experience (e.g. SQL, MS Access etc.)
  • Consistently deliver quality outputs in a high paced and dynamic environment with an ability to work to tight deadlines.
Apply now

Supply Planner, Global Infrastructure Group - Mountain View

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. jobs.title: Technical Lead Manager, Storage Software Development - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Lead Manager, Storage Software Development - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Technical Lead Manager, Storage Software Development

Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our world-class software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

With a broad technical and leadership expertise, you manage teams of engineers across multiple team and locations, a large product budget and oversee the deployment of large-scale projects across multiple sites internationally.

Responsibilities:

  • Define high level architecture, and work conjointly with senior developers across the team on design.
  • Work closely with stakeholders (client team, QA and program management) to provide status, iterative releases, and make design decisions throughout the development process.
  • Drive all aspects of the development lifecycle for features including; requirements definition, design, implementation, unit testing, and integration.
  • Oversee design, code, and test plan reviews to ensure high quality deliverables.
  • Review and approve the detailed designs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree.
  • 5 years of successful software engineering management experience.
  • 5 years embedded software, development experience.
  • Experience with some of the following: HTML, Java, JavaScript, Swing, JSP, HTML, CSS, UML, Object-Oriented methodologies, and user experience design
  • Strong knowledge of iSCSI SAN, SAS/SATA, RAID, Fibre-Channel

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Computing Infrastructure Capacity and Resource Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Computing Infrastructure Capacity and Resource Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Computing Infrastructure Capacity and Resource Planning

The Technical Program Manager role in Google's Global Infrastructure division is at the core of preparing for Google's continued exponential growth. You will ensure that Google's services can be deployed in a time, place and configuration which is ideal for serving Google's users, by arranging for computer resources to be there where and when they are needed. You must demonstrate the ability to provide matrix leadership across functional teams, lead complex projects to successful completion, evaluate capacity utilization data and understand complex technical topics affecting Google services and users.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with Google Engineering groups, create medium to long term demand forecasts for compute resources and coordinate the efforts of finance, application/service, and hardware fulfillment teams to converge on a common capital plan.
  • Develop and execute plans to deliver compute resources as called for in the capital plan under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, optimizing for a complex blend of supplier cost, service opportunity cost, and fulfillment option costs.
  • Manage compute resource allocation amongst many competing demands, while ensuring that resources do not sit underutilized at any point in their lifespan.
  • Provide a thorough cross-check of the compute resource planning effort based on analysis of Google application needs.

Requirements:

  • BS/MS degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields.
  • Experience with launching Internet software/services and large scale distributed systems required.
  • Solid experience with statistical modeling and analysis
  • Experience managing large-scale, aggressive, and dynamic technical projects, with competing resources and priorities.
  • Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
  • Firm sense of accountability and ownership for end-to-end project lifecycle. Solid knowledge of the tools and elements of project management.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Production Infrastructure Integration, Corporate Engineering - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Production Infrastructure Integration, Corporate Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Production Infrastructure Integration, Corporate Engineering

In this role, you will manage the technical integration of mergers and acquisitions (M&A) production infrastructure. You must demonstrate the ability to provide matrix leadership across functional teams, lead complex projects to successful completion, evaluate data, and understand complex technical topics. You will be involved in all phases of the projects, including requirements gathering, planning, design, and deployment, through full integration. Success requires a combination of strong technical competency and the ability to lead and influence across functional groups.

Responsibilities:

  • Work as a liaison between Google’s operations teams and newly acquired teams.
  • Work with the cross-functional engineering team and related stakeholders to gather requirements, plan, architect, manage and complete technical infrastructure projects.
  • Use technical judgment to drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus.
  • Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, service opportunity cost, and ongoing support costs.
  • Collect and analyze relevant data and take actions accordingly. Facilitate broad collaboration with clear communication and documentation.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years relevant work experience, including 2 years industry experience.
  • Project management or technical management experience, which should include managing large-scale, aggressive, and dynamic IT projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's or PhD in related field.
  • 6 years relevant experience, including 3 years industry experience.
  • IT systems architecture and deployment experience. Hands on IP network experience, including BGP.
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills, along with creative problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Data center and cloud computing experience. Systems architecture, deployment and hands-on UNIX administration experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, cross-functional and relationship-building skills.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager/Program Manager, Cloud Computing Resource Management - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager/Program Manager, Cloud Computing Resource Management - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Technical Program Manager/Program Manager, Cloud Computing Resource Management

As a program manager for cloud computing resource management at Google, you will be central to the advancement of Google’s mission. On a daily basis you will be responsible for coordinating across all of Google’s Engineering teams to solve some of the most challenging and novel problems in cloud computing. You will work directly with Google’s supply chain, data center infrastructure, networking, and software engineering teams to design and deliver the future state of computing resource management within Google.

Your charter will include the automation of compute resource allocation to all software engineering initiatives at Google, the balancing of resource distribution against supply chain, data center infrastructure, network, shared service, and budgetary constraints, and the implementation of tools and policies to optimize resource management across the entire engineering stack at Google. You will seek to redefine the definition of an "on-demand" computing environment at scales the world has not yet seen.

Beyond solid program delivery and technical skills, you should be a professional with experience in software product development, quantitative analytics, and/or supply chain management. You should be a top performer with a rare ability to synthesize strategic solutions to interdependent and broad problems. You should be someone who thrives in a very fast-paced and demanding environment. This role requires an ability to think critically, iterate quickly, provide exceptional thought leadership, and to partner across a wide variety of functions at Google to drive change across Google's Engineering division. You will have a strong internal drive, a tenacious spirit, a collaborative method of working, and deep experience in solving hard problems as simply as possible. In addition, the program manager should be focused at all times on delivering premium service to our internal customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Support operations and analytic projects related to the allocation and budgeting of internal computing resources.
  • Support subsequent operations and analytic projects related to billing, service fulfillment, internal chargeback and price modeling, supply chain management, and capacity planning needs for compute resources.
  • Play a key role in the advancement of strategy, policy, and supporting tools for operations; provide hands-on scripting/tool development as necessary.
  • Work with partner teams to launch and deliver projects related to data architecture and process re-design around demand and supply-side compute resource management.
  • Play a “lead user” role in influencing the design and delivery of related products and data architectures to optimize internal compute resource management.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • Experience in managing highly-complex, technically-challenging projects, with solid engineering, scripting, and data analysis skills; self-sufficient data analyst and technologist.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA and CS degrees.
  • 6 years relevant work experience, 3 years industry experience
  • Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.
  • Outstanding organizational, prioritization, and multitasking skills.
  • Exceptional skills influencing, teaming, and delivering solutions in a highly complex, always changing, and nebulous environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Data Modeler, Network Capacity Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Data Modeler, Network Capacity Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Network Engineering, Production

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Data Modeler, Network Capacity Planning

Google operates a massive and complex global network in a rapidly changing environment. As part of an elite planning and forecasting team, you will shape the network to accommodate user traffic as well as internal product requirements. You will have a unique opportunity to create a representative view of network traffic by extracting relevant information from an overwhelming number of data sources. The results of your analysis will directly influence Google's network designs, builds and expansions, and thus the quality of our services world wide.

Responsibilities:

  • Parse and decipher relevant information from multiple large data sets to build the demand side of our network model.
  • Collaborate with other team members and groups to identify, develop and implement novel base-lining and forecasting methods while communicating risks and opportunities for existing and future deployments
  • Find, collect, manipulate and trend inconsistent data and communicate its relevance
  • Develop optimization techniques for what-if analysis of network demand and topology
  • Create and manage complex long term projects to improve data analysis and extraction

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering (In lieu of degree, 8 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience, including experience working with large and diverse data sets.
  • Programming skills with demonstrated ability in some subset of R, Matlab, python, C++, Java or Perl languages.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Demonstrated creativity and ingenuity in approaching ambiguous problems.
  • Solid analytical presentation skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management.
  • Knowledge of network protocols and design principles.
Apply now

jobs.title: Front End Software Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Front End Software Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Front End Software Engineer, Google Fiber

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies which have changed how millions interact, making accessible and useful the world's information. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search To handle information at the the scale of the web requires ideas from every areas of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and always eager to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.

Responsibilities:

  • Aid in designing internal and external APIs for diagnostics and data access
  • Build and deploy service diagnostic tools, for customers and Customer Care
  • Build web based installation tools, to be used by in-home and outside plant installers

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Significant development experience in C, C++ or Java.
  • Experience with AJAX, HTML and CSS, with an interest in user interface design.
  • Web application development experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Significant experience developing user-facing software.
  • Experience working on cross-browser platforms.
  • Development experience designing object-oriented JavaScript.
  • Development experience with Python

jobs.title: IP Architect - Mountain View
jobs.content:
IP Architect - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: IP Architect

As an IP Architect for Google.com your job will be to ensure the future direction and evolution of the Google production network. The Google network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to Internet users throughout the world. The scale and complexity of Google's network generates a constant stream of interesting challenges which are solved by using an evolving set of technologies that require innovation in every aspect of networking. You will be faced with both scaling the network and providing additional features necessary for the variety of Google applications and services our customers demand.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with other team members and groups to develop scalable network designs, solutions and policy recommendations
  • Analyze and Drive key platform decisions and directions, provide guidance to platform and network engineering groups
  • Support Google's internal application groups by identifying and presenting their network-impacting requirements to the network engineering team
  • Support and lead development of Google's growing network infrastructure through published Architecture design docs
  • Take responsibility for the analysis, definition, and continued development of the end-to-end IP Architecture for Google

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 7 years of experience on a service provider network in engineering, architecture or design roles.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Deep and substantial operational experience with carrier-class routers and switches and optical gear (experience with Cisco and/or Juniper required.
  • ADVA/Infinera/Seimens or other optical platforms.
  • Experience with Standards Development Organizations such as IETF, IEEE, and ITU-T.
  • Excellent knowledge of TCP/IP, ISIS, IPsec, BGP, PPP, OSPF, RSVP, and SNMP protocols.
  • Superior technology skills in all of Packet Forwarding Architectures, FIB scaling, MPLS and large scale routing and IPoDWDM.
  • Strong English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to influence others with your engineering solutions.
Apply now

jobs.title: IP Network Architect, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
IP Network Architect, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: IP Network Architect, Google Fiber

As an IP Network Architect on the Google Fiber team, you will be responsible for defining the architecture and leading the engineering effort for the IP network, which is core to delivering a set of innovative services. You will lead other team members in the design and engineering of the backbone, regional and access networks. You will design a routing architecture suitable for a broadband Internet service provider, supporting IPv4 and IPv6 along with various network address translation techniques. You will also be responsible for designing the IP Multicast architecture for the delivery of content to subscribers. You will be responsible for overseeing the LAN and WAN design in Points of Presence (POP) and Data Centers, which contain servers to support critical subscriber functions. You will also work with other groups to ensure the availability and reliability of the network. This will include being on the escalation path and supporting Operations in resolving particularly complex problems. You will be looked upon as an expert and tackle challenging, novel situations as well as work with other engineering and operations teams at Google. You will maintain a high sense of urgency while staying cool under pressure.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the architecture and engineering of various components of the Google Fiber IP Network.
  • Define the IPv4 and IPv6 routing design and NAT architectures.
  • Design the LAN and WAN network in POPs and Data Centers.
  • Handle escalated trouble calls from Operations to assist in resolving service issues.
  • Act as an externally facing point of contact to facilitate handling of problem reports, maintain relations with network peers and vendors and as an internally facing point of contact to escalate technical issues and communicate network status.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in EE/CS (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of experience in supporting and implementing large wide area networks.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience in supporting and implementing large wide area networks.
  • Experience with DWDM systems and wireless technologies.
  • Excellent LAN/WAN and VPN knowledge Strong knowledge in IPv6 and carrier-grade NAT.
  • Strong TCP/IP and Internet QoS (L2 & L3) knowledge.
  • Solid knowledge in routing and transport protocols (BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, MPLS/VPLS, etc.) and network security.
Apply now

jobs.title: IP Network Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
IP Network Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: IP Network Engineer, Google Fiber

As an IP Network Engineer on the Google Fiber team, you will be instrumental in the design and engineering of the IP broadband network, which delivers innovative services. You will work with other team members to design, engineer and deploy the backbone, regional and access networks. You will assist in designing a routing architecture suitable for a broadband Internet service provider, supporting IPv4 and IPv6 along with various network address translation techniques. The architecture also must support IP Multicast for the delivery of content to subscribers. You will design the network in Points of Presence (POP) and Data Centers which contain servers to support critical subscriber functions. You will also work with other groups to ensure the availability and reliability of the network. This will include being on the escalation path and supporting Operations in resolving particularly complex problems. You will learn quickly and adapt to changes while maintaining a high sense of urgency and staying cool under pressure.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the engineering of various components of the Google Fiber IP Network, including backbone, regional and access networks.
  • Design the LAN and WAN network in POPs and Data Centers and assist with IPv4 and IPv6 routing design and NAT architectures.
  • Review and document network designs and equipment configurations.
  • Work in a lab environment to validate network designs and test network equipment to insure it meets all relevant specifications.
  • Handle escalated trouble calls from Operations to assist in resolving service issues.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS/CE. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 4 years of experience on an Internet service provider or enterprise-level network in engineering or design roles.
  • Operational experience with enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches.
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP, MPLS, VRRP, HSRP, QoS; Network routing protocols including BGP, OSPF, ISIS; LAN protocols including 802.1ad, 802.3ah, 802.1ag.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of IP Multicast and PIM.
  • Knowledge of various FTTH access technologies and optical technologies Network certifications such as CCNP/CCIE/JNCIS/JNCIE.

jobs.title: Manager, Server Product Development - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manager, Server Product Development - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Manager, Server Product Development

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

Pulling on your technical and leadership expertise, you lead end-to-end research projects in multiple areas of expertise across data center facilities and manage a team of direct reports working on equipment installation, troubleshooting and debugging.

You are an experienced manager with a strong technical background in developing server, storage or networking products who is excited about taking a leadership role with our world-class Server and Storage Products development team. You will be responsible for defining and communicating the product roadmap for Google's proprietary server infrastructure and working with a unique cross organizational team to deliver against that roadmap . You are an individual who can quickly identify opportunities to accelerate product launches while maintaining high quality levels. Striking the optimum balance of Engineering discipline and entrepreneurial attitude, tactical decision making and strategic vision, you will constantly push for aggressive improvements in the price performance of our compute infrastructure. You will have experience in complex systems design and bringup, performance benchmarking, and some experience in leading software development teams would be preferred.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with customers, the technical design team and suppliers to establish short and long term product requirements, and determine resource and budget requirements
  • Provide direction to the HW Engineers who are responsible for design and development of the new server systems, matching project needs to individual development plans, and oversee the HW design, verification and system bringup and validation activities during the development phase for all new products introduced by the Server Development team.
  • Work with partners within Google and external suppliers to define high level development plans.
  • Monitor and manage the quality of servers deployed in Data Centers to ensure optimal performance throughout the full life cycle, and ensure that technical communication and documentation is up to date and correct.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS EE or CS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree with a history of delivering complex hardware assemblies through to production.
  • Experience with: Design of servers or processor subsystems (x86 architecture design experience preferred), system bringup and hardware software integration experience.
  • Experience in supporting a large customer or deployed product base.
  • Strong understanding of Manufacturing Operations, Product Life Cycle Management, and working with Manufacturing Partners
  • Ability to independently lead multiple development projects, and qualification teams working with software, hardware, firmware and networking engineers
Apply now

jobs.title: Materials and Supply Chain Program Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Materials and Supply Chain Program Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Network Engineering, Production

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Materials and Supply Chain Program Manager

As a Materials/Supply Chain Program Manager supporting the Network Deployment team, you will be enabling a responsive and predictable supply chain supporting one of the largest and most complex private data networks in the world. You will be using your experience to drive both process and operational improvements in multiple facets of the supply chain: forecasting, planning, procurement, delivery, reverse logistics. You will help the networking material supply chain by understanding the unique needs of the deployment team, and then defining best practices to meet these requirements. You will also need to effectively work across multiple cross-functional teams to implement these changes.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and project manage multiple supply chain improvement projects simultaneously, some on a global scale and impacting multiple functional stakeholders
  • Own operational management of material planning to ensure supply is available and fulfilled according to committed schedules
  • Create spreadsheet/database tools to manage materials execution processes – work closely with IT/Tools team to drive systemic solutions.
  • Identify and quickly solve supply chain gaps and inefficiencies. Clearly document process solutions and requirements. Define and manage clear business metrics and goals for managing supply chain performance.
  • Manage external parties – third party logistics providers, component suppliers, etc to drive costs and process improvements

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS or MS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 7 years of supply chain experience across multiple disciplines, ideally in related technical/networking fields.
  • Excellent organizational skills and project management capabilities – able to manage project plans, timelines, costs effectively.
  • High spreadsheet/database capabilities – able to create models and maneuver within spreadsheets/databases to manage supply chain processes.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills and proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels.
  • Able to work independently with minimal guidance and flexible to be able to tackle a wide variety of projects.

jobs.title: Network Analyst Lead - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Analyst Lead - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Network Analyst Lead

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Quantitative Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

Through your professional expertise and judgement, you work on multiple projects concurrently, developing analyses, models and methods to support and verify the impact of your recommendations. You share your expertise by consulting on projects, serving on committees and mentoring team members.

You will drive cross-functional projects, optimizing of one of the world's most impressive network infrastructures. You will be responsible for developing fundamental models for network scaling and resource planning strategies. You will collaborate with all organizational levels to optimize planning, forecast, and manage the growth of Google's network capacity around the globe. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a bandwidth and networking business, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background and data while guiding the build on one of the most impressive network infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable proposing financial strategies to the CFO or discussing the technical and financial trade- offs involved in network design and deployment strategies. You will develop an innate understanding of the Google network and underlying economic fundamentals enabling you to quantify and guide the team between reducing operating costs and enabling agility for the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Partner with engineers and other quantitative analysts to develop algorithms, tools, and policies for optimizing network infrastructure.
  • Develop infrastructure management and operational strategies to optimize use of network resources – create work plans, gather, and synthesize.
  • Perform operational forecasting and capacity planning.
  • Identify delivery metrics and drive initiatives to improve the efficiency, quality and cost of inventory management to scale with the growth of Google.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MS in operations research, mathematics, or applied science. In lieu of degree, 10 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ph.D. in operations research, mathematics, or applied science.
  • Prior supply chain or network/data center operations analytics experience is highly valued.
  • Proven capability in effectively managing the product-life-cycle and its financial impacts.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills. Clear focus under pressure.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Engineer, Corporate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Engineer, Corporate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Network Engineering, Corporate

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We build and operate Google's enterprise network, which connects all of our corporate users, offices, data centers and services to each other and to the Internet. Using a wide variety of commercially provided technologies, open source tools and proprietary systems, we keep Google's products running, robust and secure. The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world.

The role: Network Engineer, Corporate

As a Network Engineer, your job will be to ensure the continued enhancement of features in the Google enterprise corporate network. The Google corporate network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to our users throughout the world. The scale and complexity of Google's corporate network generates a constant stream of interesting challenges which are solved by using an evolving set of technologies that require innovation in every aspect of networking. You will be faced with both scaling the network and providing additional features necessary for the variety of Google applications and services our customers demand.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with other team members and groups to identify and develop scalable network designs, solutions and policy recommendations.
  • Ensure operational integrity of the global corporate network infrastructure.
  • Support Google's internal application and services groups by identifying and presenting their network-impacting requirements to the rest of the network engineering team.
  • Engineer, support and lead implementations of Google's growing corporate network infrastructure.
  • Participate in the rotating "on call" schedule with other members of the team providing third-tier support, solving the more complex networking trouble.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS/CE (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of experience on a service provider or enterprise-level network in engineering or design roles, with 1 year as a technical lead.
  • Experience with enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches (experience with Cisco and/or Juniper).
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP, GRE, IPSec, POS, VRRP, HSRP, and SNMP protocols.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Skill in network routing protocol troubleshooting in BGP, OSPF, ISIS, and MPLS.
  • Strong English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to influence others with your stellar network engineering solutions.
  • Network certifications such as CCNP/CCIE/JNCIS/JNCIE (or equivalent training/experience).
  • 10-20% global travel.
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Engineer, Data Center Optical and Physical Infrastructure - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Engineer, Data Center Optical and Physical Infrastructure - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Network Engineer, Data Center Optical and Physical Infrastructure

In this role your responsible for the optical and physical networking infrastructure from design, to specifying implementation. This includes the continuing evolution of the physical networking plant within data center and Co-location facilities. The work requires a strong understanding of all options for physical plant design and an ability to apply your knowledge to creative solutions. Our goal is enabling scalability and efficient deployment, ultimately delivering a scalable and flexible design in the most cost effective way possible. You will be responsible for effectively documenting and communicating these designs via Statements of Work and Standards for construction and deployment. You’ll work closely with Data Center Engineering, Network Architecture, Network Design, and Deployment to carefully consider and incorporate the future scalability and technology needs. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google, absorb and process insane amounts of technical information is a continuously evolving environment. If you thrive in a dynamic environment, question assumptions, and have an ability to drive creative and innovative ways of solving challenging problems while grounded in strong analysis and critical thinking skills... this job is for you.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the designs and specifications for optical and physical networking infrastructure in Google data center/co-location facilities. Critically analyze Google’s unique needs and adapt current infrastructure solutions to meet them.
  • Specify via SOWs and design documents, then review and critically evaluate bids and options for physical network infrastructure and optical cabling including both ISP and OSP. Consider in all cases the operational impacts, deployment, and implementation challenges associated with design implementation.
  • Partner with data center R&D, DC Engineering, and Network Architecture to ensure all designs and implementations balance the current requirements and potential future generations of networking technology.
  • Partner with the Deployment and Operations teams ensuring your solutions accommodate and enable effective deployment and ongoing operations if the infrastructure. Include these considerations in your reference design and solutions work, including financial impact analysis.
  • Lead kickoff and drive cross-functional meetings. Manage exceptions and communicate issues and risks to the rest of the organization. Identify cost and delivery metrics then drive initiatives to improve the efficiency, quality and to scale with the growth of Google.

Requirements:

  • B.S. or M.S. strongly preferred in engineering or technical field.
  • At least 5 years experience in large scale optical networking infrastructure projects.
  • Proven capability to design and facilitate implementation of large scale networking data-center and/or co-location facilities.
  • Strong analytical, negotiation, and organizational skills. Clear focus under pressure. Creative approach to problem solving and ability to think out of the box.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.

jobs.title: Network Operations Center (NOC) Analyst, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Operations Center (NOC) Analyst, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Network Operations Center (NOC) Analyst, Google Fiber

As a Network Operations Center (NOC) Analyst, you will help monitor and maintain the Google Fiber network infrastructure. You will be responsible for the smooth operation of the access and backbone network, ensuring it is always available and performing well. You are team-oriented and a fast learner who combines excellent operational judgment with network, management and troubleshooting skills. You will learn quickly and adapt to changes. You will maintain a high sense of urgency while staying cool under pressure. Position requires the ability to work rotating shifts to support a 24-hour, seven-day NOC operation.

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor network stability and performance to ensure 24x7 operations and resolving service impacts as they occur.
  • Handle trouble calls and work closely with engineering, field technicians, and telecommunications carriers to resolve service issues.
  • Validate problem descriptions and perform detailed problem diagnosis; track and update problems in trouble-ticketing system.
  • Perform scheduled configuration changes to network.
  • Recommend solutions to correct network trouble issues and faults.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in a technical discipline. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 2 years of experience in supporting and/or implementing an Internet service provider or large wide area network and experience with network change management control policies.
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP fundamentals and commonly-used network protocols (MPLS, IPv6, Multicast, OSPF, BGP, IS-IS).
  • LAN and WAN troubleshooting skills and a solid understanding of network security.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of common FTTH access technologies.
  • Network certifications (or equivalent training/experience).
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Operations Support System (OSS) Architect - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Operations Support System (OSS) Architect - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Google.com Engineering

Google.com Engineering makes Google's services fast and reliable for hundreds of millions of users. This mission critical team (also known as Site Reliability Engineering) combines software development, networking, and systems engineering expertise to build and run large scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant software systems and infrastructure. We hire creative engineers and technology enthusiasts who enjoy being challenged by problems of scale and complexity, with a strong desire to make services better for users. We routinely solve software and systems issues ranging from distributed change propagation on live serving systems, to designing and deploying intelligent load balancing systems for the largest user-facing services in the world. Our teams come from diverse backgrounds, and we are actively seeking new team members to bring fresh perspective to solving problems, along with the technical and soft skills needed to keep Google’s services growing and reliable.

The role: Network Operations Support System (OSS) Architect

Network OSS Architects provide architectural and design roadmaps to ensure continued enhancement of OSS features in the Google production network. Google network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to Internet users throughout the world. The scale of Google's network infrastructure generates interesting set of operational support systems challenges which need to be solved by an evolving set of sophisticated systems and tools. Such tools require innovation in network management architecture in every segment of the seven OSI networking layers - from transport to application stacks. You will be faced with development of network systems architecture and design specifications for such functions as surveillance, fault and configuration management, performance analysis management, and operations analytics and reporting at a large scale in support of Google’s services.

Responsibilities:

  • Research, identify, evaluate, and recommend network OSS architecture within the framework of the operating environment of Google’s global network.
  • Work with team members within Network Operations group to develop a comprehensive set of network OSS requirements to support emerging network technologies in support of Google service offering.
  • Identify, research, evaluate and recommend the selection of network OSS and related tools for deployment within Google’s network.
  • Support and lead implementation of network OSS within Google's network infrastructure.

Requirements:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS or equivalent experience with a strong software engineering discipline. M.S./Ph.D. degree a plus.
  • At least 10 years of experience in network OSS architecture, design, software engineering, and implementation roles in a large scale network service provider, OSS technology supplier, or in a network management system supplier.
  • In-depth knowledge and operational experience with large scale network OSS in content and network service provider environments.
  • Substantial operational experience in requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation.
  • Excellent knowledge of existing industry standards, technologies, and operational norms for network OSS in IEEE and ITU - with a focus on optical and IP routing layer network technologies.
  • Excellent knowledge of requirements on the network OSS for the OSI layers applicable to optical transport and routing networks.
  • Strong English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to influence others with your stellar network OSS solutions.
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Research Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Research Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it - and will continue to develop and support it - with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways - giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Network Research Engineer

As a Network Research Engineer you will design, develop, and deploy networking systems which challenge and shape industry practices. You see the value in making network elements as universally programmable as CPUs. You will join a small research-focused team in the creation of a programmable network protocol stack, and in demonstrating its functionality with working code across various hardware platforms. You will demonstrate the capability and potential of fully programmable Software Defined Networking elements.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute significantly to the design and bringup of a series of new research-focused programmable switching platforms.
  • Participate in design iteration and specification of devices and programmable network device abstractions
  • Work with ASIC vendors to understand current and future capabilities of programmable switching silicon
  • Engage in public dialogue and standards efforts in the SDN space

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in computer science, computer engineering, or related field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Experience designing and implementing network protocols
  • C++, C, or Python programming skills
  • Understanding of networking systems, through the entire stack

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD.
  • Experience writing network device HALs
  • Experience with Network Processors (especially modern variants)
  • Familiarity with concepts of OpenFlow, FORCES, and Software Defined Networking
  • Microcode Development and Interfacing with Microcode (any platform)
  • Embedded Systems and Kernel programming (especially network stack)
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Security Engineer, Fiber to the Home - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Security Engineer, Fiber to the Home - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Network Security Engineer, Fiber to the Home

Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

You maintain safe and efficient network operations. You oversee our network performance and our planned maintenance, and you respond to outages and issues in real time.

Responsibilities:

  • Enforce network security strategies and procedures
  • Implement, monitor and troubleshoot Juniper firewall filters, Cisco access lists, TACACS+, and other service provider network security features
  • Develop and implement network DoS mitigation strategies and offer on-call response during security incidents
  • Perform security reviews and audits to help Google’s distributed engineering organization with network security issues
  • Provide analysis and recommendations for the evolution and enhancement of Google’s network security

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years experience in a network security role in large-network organizations.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with scripting languages.
  • Large-scale operational knowledge of JunOS and Cisco IOS security features.
  • Detailed knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.
  • Knowledge of network-related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, IPSEC, routing protocols, 802.1x).
  • Excellent English-language communication skills, teamwork skills and attention to detail.
Apply now

You encourage safe and efficient network operations by leading project teams that maintain and improve network operations. You propose projects that increase network reliability and analyze network technologies that assess implications for Google.

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, the largest enterprise network in the world, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet. As the Network Service Engineering Technical Leader for Google.com you will be responsible for development of requirements for network resource allocation for various products and services which utilize Googles backbone network. You will collaborate with technical teams across various product and operational disciplines to optimize usage of network resources within Google backbone network from initial launch through scaling of the products. You will be expected to engage with Google internal application owners globally to identify and establish network resource requirements and communicate those requirements to other operational entities such as Network Planning and Network Deployment. You will drive such decisions as network capacity, computing, and storage usage - along with network specific parameters such as bandwidth, quality of service, evolution plans, deployment guidelines for service deployment through engagements with application owners. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a network service business and guide the engineering of services and products that are being introduced across Google backbone.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead, manage and develop the networking and operational requirements for introduction of applications on Google backbone
  • Guide product and services teams in identifying optimization opportunities for the use of Google network infrastructure
  • Provide guidance to operational teams on tactical execution plans for limited/early launch of services
  • Deliver in-depth analysis of the network services demand to Networking, and establish processes and work-flows for engagements with application owners on change requests for upgrade of services. Minimum Qualifications: 1.) Preferred Qualifications: 1.)

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CE/CS (In lieu of degree, 4 years equivalent experience).
  • Technical knowledge on large scale IP/MPLS and optical systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS. or Ph.D
  • 10 years of experience on a service provider network in engineering, architecture or design roles with demonstrated leadership success
  • Product planning and operational service experience for carrier-class IP network
  • Cross-functional teamwork, influencing, and organizational skills
  • Possess a data-driven analytical approach towards solving complex challenges
  • English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to influence others with your engineering solutions.

jobs.title: Network Technology Architect, Corporate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Technology Architect, Corporate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Network Technology Architect, Corporate

As a Network Technology Architect for Google, your job will be to develop the future direction and evolution of the Google corporate enterprise network. Google’s corporate network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to users throughout the world. The scale and complexity of Google's network generates a constant stream of interesting challenges. Meeting those challenges requires an evolving set of technologies and constant innovation in every aspect of networking. You will be faced with both scaling the network and providing additional features necessary for the variety of Google applications and services our customers demand.

Responsibilities:

  • Take responsibility for the analysis, definition, and long term evolution of Google's corporate network
  • Within a technology area, analyze and drive key technology decisions and directions, providing guidance to platform and network engineering groups
  • Support and lead development of Google's growing network infrastructure through published Architecture design docs
  • Work with other team members and groups to develop scalable network designs, solutions and policy recommendations

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience
  • 7 years of experience in network engineering, architecture or protocol design
  • Excellent knowledge of full suite of TCP/IP-based protocols, with in-depth knowledge of routing and network management protocols

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Standards Development Organizations such as IETF, IEEE and ONF
  • Skills in one or more of the following areas: packet forwarding architectures, emerging L2 technologies, novel topology development, and threat-model development.
  • Strong English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to influence others with engineering solutions
Apply now

jobs.title: Network Test Development Engineer, Corporate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Test Development Engineer, Corporate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Network Engineering, Corporate

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We build and operate Google's enterprise network, which connects all of our corporate users, offices, data centers and services to each other and to the Internet. Using a wide variety of commercially provided technologies, open source tools and proprietary systems, we keep Google's products running, robust and secure. The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world.

The role: Network Test Development Engineer, Corporate

As a Network Test Development Engineer at Google you will work closely with architecture, engineering and deployment teams to ensure the reliability of our corporate networks. If you have exceptional skills and experience in the area of testing network devices we have plenty of challenging projects for you. Network Test Development Engineers must have a broad range of technical knowledge specifically in networking hardware and software, and detailed knowledge of methodologies and tools for testing protocols, performance and regression.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with network engineers to develop and document test plans on network devices, execute those tests to plan, and document and present test results
  • Design, develop and document test frameworks and lab infrastructure to ensure that testing is thorough, consistent, and repeatable
  • Advocate for excellent engineering practices by working with members of other teams within Corporate Network Operations to ensure systems are designed for reliability and testability
  • Deploy network connectivity and hardware for engineering labs
  • Develop network monitoring and automation tools

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BSCS (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of relevant industry experience.
  • Experience in utilizing specialized testing equipment (such as Ixia) and tools such as iperf, ttcp, dsniff, nmap.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BSEE.
  • Solid software development experience and current knowledge of C and one or more of the following: C++, Perl, Python.
  • Experience with testing methodologies for the TCP/IP suite (e.g. ICMP, IP, TCP, UDP), Internet protocols (e.g. SNMP, Telnet, SSH, HTTP) and routing protocols (e.g. OSPF, ISIS, BGP, MPLS).
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, particularly in documenting test methodologies and results.

jobs.title: Network Test Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Test Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Network Test Engineer, Google Fiber

You are an experienced network system test engineer who will join our world-class development team and work on feature and system level testing of networking equipment and infrastructure. You will help change the way people think about Google and the Internet. You will have hands- on experience with networking equipment, an understanding of networking protocols, experience in testing, a background in IP network design, operations, or management, and a penchant for delivering top quality products. You will experience brand new broadband IP networking and consumer broadband technologies throughout this job and help to shape new broadband Internet content experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and execute test plans for networking features, equipment, and systems.
  • Contribute to the design of new access and home networking systems.
  • Work with developing test automation tools.
  • Certify software releases for general use.
  • Work with development teams to develop software and hardware systems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or related engineering field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience with standard L2/L3 protocols such as IGP, LACP, STP, RSTP, VRRP, UDLD, 802.1x, etc.
  • Experience in access network protocols, 802.1ad, PIM / IGMP, QoS.
  • Understanding of networking systems including TCP/IP, Ethernet, and IPv6.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Computer Science.
  • Experience in supporting, implementing and/or designing networks.
  • Experience in Linux.
  • C/C++ and scripting skills.

jobs.content:
Network Tools and Automation Lead - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Network Engineering, Corporate

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We build and operate Google's enterprise network, which connects all of our corporate users, offices, data centers and services to each other and to the Internet. Using a wide variety of commercially provided technologies, open source tools and proprietary systems, we keep Google's products running, robust and secure. The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world.

The role: Network Tools and Automation Lead

As the Network Tools and Automation Lead, you will be strategically involved in the definition of tools and automation frameworks for Google’s enterprise network engineering and project management teams. You will work with internal stakeholders to develop and implement solutions to ensure that the corporate networking tools and automation strategy is realized to the benefit of the engineering and product management teams. If you like the idea of solving problems within complex teams and networks, and/or being responsible for the delivery of large scale software projects and initiatives, then we want to hear from you! A strong background in software development, technology deployment or computing sciences is essential for your success in this position.

Responsibilities:

  • Document and understand the internal needs of the Google's corporate network operations to develop, enhance, and project manage the overall tools and automation strategy
  • Create a tools and automation framework through a deep understanding of the various back-end systems within Google's corporate network operations
  • Gather, create and define the requirements for Google software engineers to lead internal tools development efforts, or make proposals to source from outside vendors
  • Ensure integration of tools and automation between all internal and external stakeholder teams
  • Mentor engineers around tools and automation methodologies

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related engineering discipline. In lieu of degree, 8 years of experience working in large enterprise or ISP environment
  • Expert knowledge one of more of the following languages: C++, Java or Python
  • Experience researching networking tools platforms to measure cost/benefit analysis of different technology platforms, tools suites and requirements
  • Experience with end-end procurement sourcing process from RFI/RFP to final vendor selection and implementation

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Project management background with experience leading cross-functional teams involved with technical projects
  • Experience developing networking tools and automation framework as a project lead from concept to deployment
  • Strong Linux system administration background
  • Basic knowledge of network engineering technologies such as TCP/IP, routing protocols, and LAN switching

jobs.title: Network Traffic Analysis Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Network Traffic Analysis Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Network Traffic Analysis Engineer, Google Fiber

As part of an elite planning, modeling and analysis team, you will help shape the network by analyzing traffic patterns and modeling network flows. You will have a unique opportunity to create a representative view of network traffic by extracting relevant information from an overwhelming number of data sources. Using representative data, you will analyze user behavior and determine significant traffic sources and destinations. The results of your analysis will directly influence network designs, network interconnect strategy, builds and expansions, and thus the quality of our gigabit Internet service.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze traffic patterns and have a comprehensive understanding of network flows.
  • Develop optimization techniques for what-if analysis of network demand and topology.
  • Collaborate with other team members to identify, develop and implement base-lining and forecasting methods.
  • Find, collect, manipulate and trend inconsistent data and communicate its relevance.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 5 years of experience on a service provider or enterprise-level network in engineering or design roles.
  • Knowledge of network protocols and design principles and experience working with large and diverse data sets.
  • Programming skills with demonstrated ability in some subset of Python, C++, Java or Perl languages.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated creativity and ingenuity in approaching ambiguous problems.
  • Solid analytical presentation skills.
Apply now
