The role: Optical Network Architect

As a Network Architect, you will ensure the continued enhancement of features in the Google production network. The Google network operates at massive scale while providing reliable service to Internet users throughout the world. The scale and complexity of Google's network generates a constant stream of interesting challenges which are solved by using an evolving set of technologies that require innovation in every aspect of networking. You will be faced with both scaling the network and providing additional features necessary for the variety of Google applications and services our customers demand.

  • Identify, research, evaluate and recommend the selection of network related tools and emerging network technologies
  • Support internal Google application groups network requirements by developing a networking road-map exceeding their needs

Substantial operational experience designing and engineering metro and long-haul optical networks with equipment from vendors like Infinera, Nokia-Siemens, Alcatel-Lucent.

jobs.title: Optical Network Transport Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Optical Network Transport Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Optical Network Transport Engineer, Google Fiber

As an Optical Network Transport Engineer on the Google Fiber team, you will be responsible for the overall architecture and engineering of the optical network which forms the regional backbone in each market that Google Fiber serves. You will work closely with network architects and network engineers to ensure the smooth integration of the optical networking platform with the rest of the network elements. You will work with the deployment engineers to review service information from the field and compare these against expected results. You will also work with other groups to ensure the availability and reliability of the Google Fiber network. This will include being on the escalation path and supporting Operations in resolving particularly complex problems. You will learn quickly and adapt to changes while maintaining a high sense of urgency and staying cool under pressure.

Responsibilities:

  • Design DWDM optical transport network system, perform design reviews, and install and maintain operational support systems for optical network elements.
  • Develop automation tools for testing, configuration, auditing and monitoring of fault and performance of optical network elements.
  • Work with HW and SW of various optical platforms from pre-deployment certification to installation acceptance.
  • Review network documentation. Publish and validate method of procedure (MOPs) for installation and continued operation of various optical network elements.
  • Analyze the operation performance of the optical gear and compare to expected results. Publish failure analysis and make sparing recommendations.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS in EE/CS/CE. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 3 years of experience with optical network installation, maintenance and operation for service providers or large enterprise networks.
  • Experience and desire to do scripting/programming with a broad understanding of optical theory and transport technologies and the operation of optical transport DWDM systems.
  • Familiarity with TL1, SNMP and/or Element Management Systems and solid optical troubleshooting skills using OTDR, OSA, BERT and optical power meters.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Field work experience in POPs, carrier hotels, data centers and Central Office environments.
  • Ability to work as second line support for all optical issues which may include on-call duties.
  • Excellent written/verbal communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Program Manager, Provisioning and Communications, Corporate Network Operations - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Program Manager, Provisioning and Communications, Corporate Network Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Program Manager, Provisioning and Communications, Corporate Network Operations

The Provisioning Program Manager is responsible for the ordering, provisioning and implementation of network and voice capacity for corporate offices and data centers worldwide. You will analyze, report, track and implement all carrier connectivity services. You will lead discussions with the carriers and ISPs, work closely with internal groups for the ordering, provisioning and testing of carrier connectivity services. You will track and report progress for worldwide build-outs and you will be responsible for inventory/document control.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage global carrier coordination, escalation, installation and create hand-offs to the various teams in Corporate and Production Operations.
  • Work closely with Legal, Contracts, Billing, Network Engineers and project teams to insure the overall carrier ordering, implementation and provide documentation for the entire circuit life-cycle process. Includes: communicating carrier provisioning/install lead-times.
  • Negotiate with carriers on contract pricing and terms for voice services supporting our Corporate offices. In some cases, data services would be required for negotiations/contract execution.
  • Responsible for updating and maintaining the circuit database in addition to all other tools, resources, and reports which track and maintain site and network and voice information.
  • Additional tasks and assignments may be required to meet the needs of the business.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of experience working as a circuit provisioner/project manager for a telco carrier and/or ISP and experience with various carrier products and services in an operational, engineering or implementation role.
  • Familiarity with data DSL, T1's, DS3, OC3, Ethernet and other similar technology.
  • Familiarity with IP Transit/Peering, Dark Fiber, Wavelengths and peering x-connects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 6 years relevant work experience.
  • Project management experience.
  • Excellent organization and communication.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, the largest private network in the world, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Network Operations Manager

As a Program Manager for Google.com you will be responsible for leading the effort in determining network performance metrics, developing the tools to automatically collect and analyze the data and report on our quality improvement progress. You will initiate and track workflow process improvement opportunities and help organize cross-functional changes to implement them. Work with partners to ensure projects and initiatives are correctly scoped, and help coordinate improvements across the entire organization

jobs.title: Quantitative Analyst, Network Strategic Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Quantitative Analyst, Network Strategic Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Quantitative Analyst, Network Strategic Planning

You will drive cross-functional projects, optimizing of one of the world's most impressive network infrastructures. You will be responsible for developing fundamental models for network scaling and resource planning strategies. You will collaborate with all organizational levels to optimize planning, forecast, and manage the growth of Google's network capacity around the globe. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a bandwidth and networking business, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background and data while guiding the build on one of the most impressive network infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable proposing financial strategies to the CFO or discussing the technical and financial trade- offs involved in network design and deployment strategies. You will develop an innate understanding of the Google network and underlying economic fundamentals enabling you to quantify and guide the team between reducing operating costs and enabling agility for the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Develop infrastructure management and operational strategies to optimize use of network resources – create work plans, gather and synthesize.
  • Perform operational forecasting and capacity planning.
  • Identify delivery metrics and drive initiatives to improve the efficiency, quality and cost of inventory management to scale with the growth of Google.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in operations research, mathematics, or applied science.
  • 4 years prior supply chain or network/data center operations analytics experience is highly valued.
  • Proven capability in effectively managing the product-life-cycle and its financial impacts.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills. Clear focus under pressure.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Apply now

jobs.title: Release Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Release Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Release Engineer, Google Fiber

How do you release updates and changes to the world's most trafficked sites without users ever noticing a glitch in service? Our Release Engineering team tackles this very challenge. As a member of the team, you work with Software Engineers to ensure our services and products seamlessly move from development through rollout and into production. This requires scripting and coding with an eye toward scalability so that big deployments can be broken down and distributed across multiple data centers. You are a excited by massively complex systems and the challenges that come from working with some of the largest computing systems in the world. From changing the look of Google Search to backend tweaks to our algorithms, we are constantly pushing updates and iterating on all of our products.

Responsibilities:

  • Support and improve our tools for continuous integration, automated testing and release management.
  • Manage release branches.
  • Build and sanity test release binaries.
  • Push new releases to production.
  • Maintain the build process to support ongoing R&D.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in software engineering, release engineering and/or configuration management.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 6 years relevant work experience.
  • Experience building C++ and Java applications.
  • Familiarity with software configuration management systems and/or source code version control systems. Perforce experience.
  • Server side products: knowledge of UNIX/Linux. Client side products: knowledge of multiple client OS's, such as Windows/Mac/Linux/iPhone/Blackberry/Android.
  • Experience with code signing and build management tools (make, scons, ant).
  • Experience with scripting languages, particularly Python.
Apply now

jobs.title: Service Delivery, Customer Solutions Specialist, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Service Delivery, Customer Solutions Specialist, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google Fiber

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds to the home. Why join the Google Fiber team? Because we’ve got some ambitions. On March 29th and May 17th we announced that we’re starting to build our ultra-high speed network in Kansas City, KS and Kansas City, MO, respectively. We’d love for you to join us in helping to re-shape and revolutionize the way people connect to the web!

The role: Service Delivery, Customer Solutions Specialist, Google Fiber

As a Customer Service Specialist, you will ensure that Google is focused on the customers of our Google Fiber product. You will be an expert in our product and service with detailed knowledge of our constantly evolving service and product, and you will provide both specific and broader solutions for our customers. You will ensure that feedback flows to cross-functional teams such and Engineering and Product to improve and innovate our service delivery. You will advocate for users and engage in an array of activities that drive service and product improvements.

Responsibilities:

  • Specialize in one or more areas (e.g. Billing, Training, Product, etc.), providing specific solutions to customers and also owning and driving broader projects in that area
  • Represent the Google Fiber team to users and external partners, providing outstanding support and relationship building in all interactions
  • Analyze/monitor key metrics in your focus areas, and partner with Product and Engineering to resolve issues
  • Troubleshoot customer problems; effectively diagnose and resolve problems coordinating as necessary with cross-functional teams
  • Scale our support model by identifying and implementing improved workflows & solutions

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS, in lieu of degree, 3 years' relevant work experience
  • 3 years in customer service field such as phone or in-person support, proven ability to resolve issues in stressful environment
  • 2 years experience in technology-related product management, product marketing, specialized support operations, and/or consulting

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Technical experience (e.g., industry-specific experience, solid understanding of product development flow, experience as a Product Manager, ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical terms)
  • Self-starter with ability to work independently and on multiple initiatives at the same time; excellent project manager.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal). Strong negotiation skills and judgement
  • Ability to work effectively cross-functionally with proven track record of driving results
Apply now

jobs.title: Software Engineer Web Applications, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Software Engineer Web Applications, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Software Engineer Web Applications, Google Fiber

As a Software Engineer, your job will be to ensure the development and enhancement of features and services in Google's Fiber to the Home network. The scale and complexity of Google's Fiber to the Home network generates a constant stream of interesting challenges which are solved by using an evolving set of technologies that require innovation in every aspect of networking. You will be faced with challenges around both scaling the network and providing systems necessary for the variety of services provided to, and demanded by, our customers.

We need engineers that will help define the overall software architecture for the Google Fiber provisioning infrastructure, testing these approaches in a lab and then rolling them out into production. We must innovate our infrastructure, while ensuring the smooth operation of all services. This is a great opportunity for a self-driven engineer to take point on a product, drive the design and implementation, and bring the product to production.

At the end of the day, our goal is to provide a service that you want to use at home instead of any other. If there's a feature you wish your service provider offered, join the Google Fiber team and make that part of our product offering.

Responsibilities:

  • Write server-side code for web-based applications, create robust high-volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly
  • Build our platforms, systems, and networking infrastructure using your background in distributed systems, OS/kernel, and network system design
  • Build internal systems used by thousands of Googlers around the world with your domain expertise

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Extensive programming experience in Java or C/C++ with strong object oriented skills.
  • Large systems software design and development experience, with extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux and networking.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with AppEngine, Billing / Payment systems, Networking (IPv6, TCP/IP and the OSI stack).
  • A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structure, algorithms, and software design.
Apply now

Software Engineer in Test, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Software Engineer in Test, Google Fiber

As a Software Engineer in Test on our Google Fiber test engineering team, you will examine, validate, and test large scale software development and deployment projects as well as help design and build intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios. Your primary responsibility as a Software Engineer in Test will be to work with the development and test engineering teams to automate testing, create new test harnesses, implement new automation tools and create innovative automated test systems. You are a software engineer who is skilled in Quality Assurance processes and testing methodologies. Your abilities include developing suites of automated tests for server and client side applications. You are self starting, creative, driven, and able to work in a fast paced environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in tandem with other engineers to build advanced automated frameworks to deliver and exercise our world-class applications.
  • Develop ​innovative solutions for large scale automated testing strategies, quality assurance, data analysis, and monitoring of our systems.
  • Conduct research on emerging technologies, provide thorough documentation of testing results, design and develop automated test case suites, and execute and maintain the suite of automated test cases.
  • Take responsibility for aspects of project management, release engineering, task delegation, team coordination, and production monitoring.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in a technical discipline. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience.
  • 3 years of development and/or test automation experience.
  • Excellent coding skills in C, C++. Java, or Python with scripting skills in at least one common language (Perl, Python or Shell).

jobs.content:
Software Engineer, Embedded Systems, Advanced Technology Group, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google Fiber

Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds to the home. Why join the Google Fiber team? Because we’ve got some ambitions. On March 29th and May 17th we announced that we’re starting to build our ultra-high speed network in Kansas City, KS and Kansas City, MO, respectively. We’d love for you to join us in helping to re-shape and revolutionize the way people connect to the web!

The role: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems, Advanced Technology Group, Google Fiber

As an embedded software engineer, you will define and implement the underlying platform software for delivering stunning network experiences to the whole world at massive scale. In the Advanced Technology Group, you will work closely with hardware,system and network engineers to deliver next generation leading-edge optical access network platforms.

Google's Software Engineers develop the next-generation technologies for which we've become world-renowned. In addition to revolutionizing search technology, we use our world-class programming skills to innovate in a number of other areas as well. Our projects include working on advanced information-retrieval algorithms, massive scalability and storage solutions, and large-scale applications that enrich the user experience. We also work extensively on networking systems, advertising systems and complex transaction systems in consumer applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Embedded system programming and board bring up.
  • Platform/system integration and diagnosis.
  • Hands-on code contribution and shipping responsibility
  • libraries, api's, documentation.
  • Coordinate with other product teams for integration into their products.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Experience in embedded software, real-time systems and device drivers development.
  • Exceptional C++/C programming skills, Compilers and Software Tools (linkers, debuggers, cross-reference, command-line utilities). Linux or BSD kernel experience.
  • Experience with system management software.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD in Computer Science.
  • Experience with video and media processing pipelines.
  • Experience with home networking protocols like DLNA.
  • Experience in L2/L3 networking protocol.
  • Familiarity with hardware/software interaction facets of embedded systems.
  • Strong problem solving skills, adaptable, proactive, and willing to take ownership.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Network Infrastructure - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Software Engineer, Network Infrastructure - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Software Engineer, Network Infrastructure

As a Networking Infrastructure Software Engineer, you will design, develop and deploy Google's next generation networking systems. You will help change the way people think about Google and the Internet. You will define and implement innovative ways to deploy, operate and monitor networking systems at scale. You possess strong networking systems, infrastructure and tools development expertise coupled with knowledge of layer 2 and layer 3 networking technology. You should have experience designing and developing software for networking devices and systems in C, C++ or Python and a strong interest in delivering top quality products.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop network systems and production solutions.
  • Design and develop software for emulation/simulation of L2 and L3 networking systems and protocols.

Requirements:

  • BS in computer science or equivalent. MS or PhD is a plus.
  • Experience in one or more of the following areas: Designing and developing network/switch management components. L2/L3 switching and standard network protocols. Developing device and network management systems. Embedded systems.
  • Experience in developing and releasing networking products.
  • Linux or other kernel programming experience is a plus.
  • Exceptional C++/C or Python programming skills.
  • A strong understanding of networking systems.

jobs.title: Strategic Negotiator, Network Content Distribution - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Strategic Negotiator, Network Content Distribution - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Strategic Negotiator, Network Content Distribution

As a Strategic Negotiator, you will play a pivotal role in driving Internet peering and Google caching programs in close coordination with technical and product teams. You will analyze network traffic data reports to identify where Internet traffic is destined or sourced, negotiate with ISPs, carriers, network operators and mobile providers for interconnect capacity and other programs like content caching, and will work closely with internal and external provisioning teams to ensure that peering connections are upgraded in a timely and effective manner. You have substantial knowledge of both the technical and commercial aspects of global and regional networks, excellent numerical analysis skills, understands how to manage complex technical projects, and has a flair for goal-focused commercial and contractual negotiation, all while maintaining both a smile and a sense of humor throughout.

You are able to work successfully across diverse geographies, circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms, and technologies. You are a highly technical, business-savvy individual, who is interested in helping to build one of the world's largest networks.

Responsibilities:

  • Build strategic long-term relationships with ISPs, carriers and operators for effective, efficient and scalable delivery of Google content to users.
  • Identify, negotiate and close contracts covering Internet interconnect, peering, colocation, fibre and content distribution services.
  • Develop numerical analysis techniques to understand large amounts of network performance and traffic data.
  • Communicate progress internally, and collaborate with a wide variety of internal teams including product and business development, legal, network architecture and deployment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BSc/BA degree in a technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years telecommunications experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • 4 years relevant work experience, including technical and commercial knowledge of operator network topology and architecture, IP routing, and CDN platforms, as well as experience working in a senior IP network planning or implementation role at an ISP, telecoms operator, carrier, or CDN.
  • Experience encompassing technical, commercial and legal areas of the above business segments.
  • International experience, with fluency in English and additional languages.
  • Strong data-driven analysis and problem solving skills.
  • Willing to travel.
Apply now

jobs.title: Strategic Negotiator, Network, Asia Focus - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Strategic Negotiator, Network, Asia Focus - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Strategic Negotiator, Network, Asia Focus

Google's Strategic Negotiators spearhead the acquisition and allocation of Google's global networking infrastructure. Strategic negotiators must interact closely with outside vendors to design, develop, and deliver highly innovative contracts for fiber, collocation, peering, voice, and data services across the world. This position requires substantial knowledge of global networks, in- depth technical expertise, and strategic analysis skills in addition to rock-solid negotiation, collaboration, and delivery capabilities. You have a track record that matches our philosophy of leading by innovation, have a detailed understanding of both the technological and the commercial sides of networking infrastructure, and have the ability to deliver against aggressive deadlines with a driving passion for cost reduction and highly scalable solutions. Google's strategic negotiators are dynamic personalities who can work successfully across diverse geographies, circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms, and technologies. Smart, highly technical, business savvy individuals with a driving passion to help build one of the world's largest networks are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal business and networking technical teams to identify and define strategic initiatives necessary to meet Google's ongoing needs for both expansion and cost reduction.
  • Build strategic relationships with vendors; identify unique opportunities for partnership or expansion with these teams; determine specific routes and deals that meet commercial, technical, and timing requirements.
  • Identify, negotiate and close contracts with vendors providing wavelength, IP transit, and colocation services (terrestrial and undersea networks).
  • Lead and close contract negotiations in tandem with Google's legal team.
  • Communicate progress internally and collaborate with network deployment teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS or BA degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of experience in networking technologies (across the OSI model), as well as experience with strategic negotiations and/or business development obtaining services from high-technology providers in collocation data centers, internet transit, network transport, telecom, or IT services.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS or BA degree in technology or science.
  • 6 years relevant work experience, including extensive experience with contract development and vendor management across many vendors simultaneously.
  • Solid working understanding of domestic and global carrier networks.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills.
  • Willing to travel up to 30% of the time.
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Asia Network Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Asia Network Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Asia Network Planning

As Technical Program Manager, you will be at the forefront of Google Networking in Asia and across the Pacific. You will define how we develop network infrastructure to meet the needs of Google's internal core backbone as well as Google's edge content distribution platform. You will interact with forecasting teams, network architects and product managers to understand the requirements and translate them into a set of deliverables, whether it means dark fiber, leased circuits, collocation or even submarine cable builds such as our Unity and South-East Asia Japan Cable projects. You will champion the right trade-offs between cost, delivery lead-time and quality. You may work on a discrete specific metro market or on a multinational continental network. You will also put together business cases to justify expansion to new markets or augments to existing markets.

You will be the key cornerstone of network development that brings strategic negotiators, network architects and network field engineers together to enable scalable network upgrades and expansion. You will work successfully across diverse geographies, circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms and technologies. Smart, highly technical, business savvy individuals with a driving interest in helping to build one of the world's largest networks are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal business and networking technical teams to identify and define tactical and strategic initiatives necessary to meet Google's ongoing needs for both expansion and cost reduction across Asia.
  • Present network plans for approval by all internal stakeholders. Plan complexity will range from short term metro augments to long term region-wide strategies for Google Asia network development.
  • Project manage the approved network plan with internal contributors such as network negotiators or vendor delivery managers until until handover to the deployment team is complete.
  • Communicate progress internally and evangelize network plans.
  • Help with execution of pre-negotiated orders and contracts with vendors as necessary, and attend industry conferences such as PTC and ITW

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS or BA degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Fluency in networking technologies (across the OSI model) and a solid working understanding of Asian and global carrier networks.
  • Project management experience in matrixed environments.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS or BA degree in technology or science.
  • Strong communication skills and a data driven analytical approach towards solving complex challenges.
  • Strong organizational, multitasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills. Financial skills are a plus.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Corporate Network Operations - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Corporate Network Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Network Engineering, Corporate

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We build and operate Google's enterprise network, which connects all of our corporate users, offices, data centers and services to each other and to the Internet. Using a wide variety of commercially provided technologies, open source tools and proprietary systems, we keep Google's products running, robust and secure. The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Corporate Network Operations

In this role you will act as a Technical Program Manager for all IT services in offices and campuses within a given region. You will manage regional and global programs to improve office deployments, the corporate network and delivery of IT services. You will provide leadership on design, policy, standards for delivery of services and partner with network engineers and other project managers to deliver large technical networking projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with network engineers and project managers to deliver large technical networking projects.
  • Coordinate global operations teams such as Facilities, Telephony, Video Conferencing, and Systems Operations to deploy network services in new and existing buildings.
  • Plan and implement voice/data infrastructure, such as cabling, power and cooling for server rooms and IDF’s.
  • Develop and maintain regional schedules of building deployments. Assist in resource allocation, conflict resolution, communication and setting expectations.
  • Communicate and represent network design and engineering standards on behalf of network engineers in meetings.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of experience successfully leading large, complex, global projects involving many operational IT teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in a technical field.
  • PMP encouraged.
  • 6 years relevant work experience, including 4 years industry experience
  • Ability to establish priorities, work independently and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision.
  • Knowledge of professional project management practices.
  • Willingness to travel world wide.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Fiber Network Documentation - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Fiber Network Documentation - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Fiber Network Documentation

As a seasoned technical program manager, you will lead Google’s efforts to document its fiber optic network infrastructure. You should be highly motivated and will be part of a team responsible for updating Google's existing documentation and documenting new additions and changes to Google's fiber network. You will also contribute to the development of improved tools, methods and procedures that will enable Google to maintain crystal clear visibility to its fiber network infrastructure as it continues to scale. This will be accomplished by developing some of the documentation first-hand and by guiding work by one or more contractors.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that Google’s global fiber network documentation is always accurate and up to date
  • Extend Google's existing fiber network documentation tools, methods, standards and processes and develop new ones that meet the requirements of key stakeholders including the network engineering, acquisition and operations teams
  • Document Google’s fiber network using the updated tools and standards. This will require modification of existing records and creation of new ones. This person will do some of this work directly and will oversee work performed by others, potentially including one or more contractors
  • Manage the ongoing documentation of any additions and changes to Google’s fiber network. Ensure that accurate documentation is a standard closeout item for every network deployment project
  • Work with other departments to continuously evolve fiber network documentation tools and methods as Google's other network design and documentation systems and processes evolve

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in an engineering or GIS discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • 6 years relevant work experience, including 2 years of experience with fiber network documentation
  • Experience with hands-on network infrastructure documentation, including creation of network diagrams & route maps, data entry in network documentation systems, evaluation and interpretation of fiber test results, field experience with site audits and fiber/equipment labeling, and familiarity with network infrastructure naming conventions
  • Experience with Excel, a drawing package such as Visio or AutoCAD, GIS software such as MapInfo or ArcInfo, OTDR trace analysis software and purpose-built network documentation software

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience extracting such information from network orders and agreements
  • Experience evaluating, selecting, developing and/or extending network documentation systems
  • Experience with relational database design, SQL queries and reporting is a plus
  • A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure
  • Knowledge of DWDM network equipment and/or documentation of DWDM networks is a plus. A self-starter who possess excellent organizational, project tracking and communication skills, and who has a strong sense of focus, meticulous attention to detail and proven ability to guide others to deliver outstanding results
  • Must be willing to travel (up to 20%) for site audits and to ensure that consistent methods are applied worldwide
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Network Acquisition - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Network Acquisition - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it - and will continue to develop and support it - with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways - giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Network Acquisition

You are a seasoned technical program manager who will help plan and execute network acquisition projects. You are a highly motivated individual and will work with internal stakeholders to develop solutions and with external vendors to implement them.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate alternatives and develop cost estimates for project-specific feasibility studies.
  • Place dark fiber, wavelength and colocation orders under existing master agreements. Line up and manage fiber construction projects for new lateral and riser builds.
  • Prepare drawings, maps, scopes of work and other materials as needed to clearly describe projects to external vendors and internal stakeholders.
  • Work with internal stakeholders to ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for overall network deployment.
  • Develop and grow relationships with vendors and partners.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 6 years of relevant work experience, including 4 years industry experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 8 years relevant work experience, including 5 years of experience with fiber network deployments and constructing new outside plant and inside plant fiber infrastructure, and 3 years of experience with space and power build-outs in data centers and/or third party colocation facilities.
  • Experience selecting, hiring and managing contractors and working with permitting agencies.
  • Experience with creating network drawings, route maps and scopes of work.
  • Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work.
  • A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure. Knowledge of DWDM and IP networking.
  • A creative, self-starter who possess excellent business acumen and project management skills, and who has a strong sense of focus, organization, meticulous attention to detail and proven ability to guide others to deliver outstanding results in a timely manner. Must be willing to travel (up to 40%).

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. Google has one of the most advanced and innovative operations environments on the planet. The Operations and IT team manages a broad range of technical areas including hardware, networking, and system administration.

This roles requires the planning, facilitation, and management of the operational support systems Google uses for network planning, acquisition, design, inventory, workflow, and project management. Management of cross-functional projects, and working with all organizational levels and groups including network operations, network engineering staff and internal project management teams, as well as external vendors is key. jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Network Operations Ambassador - Mountain View

The area: Engineering, Network Engineering, Production

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Network Operations Ambassador

You are a technical program manager who will lead, plan and execute network engineering programs relating to improving the application owners’ experience with the Google production network. You will work with internal stakeholders to identify requirements, develop and implement solutions. You will manage cross-functional projects that require working with all organizational levels and groups specific to network integration activities. If you like the idea of obtaining requirements from application owners and software developers, and translating that into objectives for network engineering teams, then we want to hear from you! You will develop and manage project schedules, identify risks and clearly communicate them to project stakeholders, define problem solving and risk mitigation strategies, and measure improvement through the full project cycle.

A strong background in IT infrastructure, technology deployment or computing sciences is essential for your success in this position. You must have a proven track record of project completion that is on time and within budget. You must be able to command the intellectual respect of Google engineers as well as run extremely effective projects on compressed timelines.

Google's Network Planning team is responsible for turning Google Network Architecture Standards into reality by teaming with Strategic Negotiators and Network Designers to acquire the right mix of infrastructure to deliver a robust, scalable and cost-effective network. In this role, you will focus on building and optimizing several metro networks in North America. You should expect to be the hub for many groups and, on a daily basis, play numerous roles including Project Manager, Network Engineer, Product Manager and a bit of Financial Analyst.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Optical Engineering, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Optical Engineering, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Optical Engineering, Google Fiber

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

As a technical program manager for Google Fiber at Google, you will be central to the operations of the cross- functional team. On a daily basis you will be responsible for working with vendors, hardware and software engineers, network engineers, product managers, and a wide variety of internal customers. We want top performers with a rare and specific skill set who will thrive in a very fast-paced and demanding environment. This role requires an ability to think critically, lead through intellect, hands-on delivery, and to partner across a wide variety of functions at Google to drive change in a complex setting. The right individual will be one with strong internal drive, a tenacious spirit, a collaborative method of working, and deep experience in delivering complex systems on time.

Responsibilities:

  • Program Manage each major and minor optical module releases. This includes working with product management and engineering on feature lists and schedules, managing vendor contracts and development status, working with photonic and hardware engineers on test planning and performance verification to ensure production and release dates are achieved.
  • Define the schedule, planning and ordering necessary component materials to ensure development and production schedule.
  • Create and document new internal and external processes, and identify new and available tools that would be useful to help scale the internal operations of the platform.
  • Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, optimizing for a complex blend of product cost, service opportunity cost, and ongoing support costs.
  • Facilitate broad collaboration with clear high communications and documentation

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Physics, Electrical Engineering or related degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 5 years experience in fiber optic communication technologies.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 10 years experience in fiber optic communication technologies.
  • Outstanding organizational, prioritization, and multitasking skills.
  • Self-starter with ability to conceive of and accept responsibility for projects and see them through to completion, must be able to to work as individual contributor and to contribute as part of a larger team.
  • Familiar with laser manufacturing and packaging techniques.
  • Experience in fiber optic components and subsystem.
  • Project management, hardware design and optical network experience.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Quantitative Analysis, Network Strategic Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Quantitative Analysis, Network Strategic Planning

You will drive cross-functional projects, optimizing of one of the world's most impressive network infrastructures. You will be responsible for developing fundamental processes for Decision Support for network scaling and resource planning strategies. You will collaborate with all organizational levels to optimize planning, forecast, and manage the growth of Google's network capacity around the globe. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a bandwidth and networking business, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background and data while guiding the build on one of the most impressive network infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable designing and driving process for decision making or discussing the technical and financial trade-offs involved in network design and deployment strategies. You will develop an innate understanding of the Google network and underlying organizational fundamentals enabling you to quantify and guide the team between reducing operating costs and enabling agility for the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Develop infrastructure management and operational processes to drive strategies to optimize use of network resources – create work plans, gather and synthesize relevant data into a system and process for developing final recommendations.
  • Lead kickoff and regular project status meetings, keeping downstream teams apprised of project and delivery status. Manage exceptions and communicate issues and risks to the rest of the organization.
  • Identify delivery metrics and drive initiatives to improve the efficiency, quality and cost of inventory management to scale with the growth of Google.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in operations research, mathematics or applied science.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior supply chain or network/data center operations analytics experience.
  • Proven capability in effectively managing the product-life-cycle and its financial impacts.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills.
  • Clear focus under pressure.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Space and Power - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Space and Power - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Network Engineering, Production

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Space and Power

Technical Program Managers will plan, facilitate, and manage the deployment of new services purchased from third party vendors and suppliers worldwide. You will work closely with design and technical negotiation teams to assess space and power requirements to support new capacity demands. The technical program manager will be responsible for creating the facility designs and statements of work to guide build outs within new and existing locations. You will work closely with the technical negotiators to understand the terms of new contracts and arrangements including delivery targets and other technical requirements. You will manage all aspects of the site deployment process with vendor to include: site surveys, daily vendor management, walk through and final acceptance to ensure facilities are delivered on schedule and to specifications. Technical Program Managers will be responsible for facilitating communications between all relevant stakeholders both internal and external.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist upstream planning, network design, and acquisition teams in defining space & power requirements, priorities, and delivery date expectations.
  • Create detailed floor plans, rack layouts, power and fiber distribution drawings, material lists and statements of work.
  • Manage the vendor through the entire site deployment process. Facilitate site surveys, serve as primary escalation point during implementation and manage final site acceptance.
  • Lead kickoff and regular project status meetings, keeping downstream teams apprised of project and delivery status. Manage exceptions and communicate issues and risks to the rest of the organization.
  • Maintain rack, space and power inventory and participate in the creation of network standards for new site builds and expansions.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in a technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 6 years of experience in a telecom-related field
  • Understanding of Layer 1 through Layer 3 network services and technologies, including dark fiber, DWDM, SONET/SDH, Ethernet, and IP

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 6 years of work experience in a telecom-related field.
  • Extensive technology-related project and program management experience.
  • Experienced in the delivery of telecommunications infrastructure and space and power from third party suppliers.
  • Strong knowledge of central office design, space/power planning, and inside and outside plant fiber construction best practices (riser construction, diversity, dark fiber testing, etc.). Experience with AutoCAD and Visio.
  • A good understanding of Layer 1 through Layer 3 network services and technologies, DWDM, SONET/SDH, Ethernet, and IP.
  • Willingness to Travel 30%.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager, Vendor Delivery Management - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Program Manager, Vendor Delivery Management - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Network Engineering, Production

The end result of our team's work is the delivery of Google's products and services to users around the world. We build and operate Google's production network, which connects the server farms in data centers to each other and to the Internet.

The role: Technical Program Manager, Vendor Delivery Management

As a Technical Project Manager, you will plan, facilitate, and manage the deployment of new services purchased from third party suppliers and vendors worldwide. You will work closely with the technical negotiation team to understand the terms of new contracts and arrangements including delivery targets and technical requirements. Managers also work closely with internal project management teams to communicate target completion dates and ensure that all internal requirements are being met in a timely manner. You will direct and manage vendors during installation of services and ensure that all services meet contracted technical specifications. Program Managers are responsible for ensuring that services are delivered correctly and on schedule, and are responsible for facilitating communications between all relevant stakeholders both internal and external.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the delivery of large scale network infrastructure projects involving dark fiber, leased circuits, collocation space & power, inside plant fiber, IP Transit and Peering connectivity from inception through delivery. Ensure facilities are delivered on schedule and meet technical specifications.
  • Assist upstream planning, design, and acquisition teams in developing infrastructure requirements, priorities, and delivery date expectations. Manage project scope changes.
  • Serve as primary vendor contact for these activities. Escalate up vendor management chains as necessary if delivery time lines are at risk.
  • Lead kickoff and regular project status meetings. Keep downstream teams at Google apprised of project and delivery status. Manage exceptions and communicate issues and risks to the rest of the organization. Facilitate review and acceptance of vendor handover documentation.
  • Work with vendors and Google staff to coordinate and facilitate service and site acceptance activities. Obtain, distribute and maintain all vendor handover documentation. I.e. LOA/CFA, DLR, Completion notification, test results and technical drawings.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in a technical discipline (in lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • 6 years of experience in a telecom-related field.
  • Understanding of Layer 1 through Layer 3 network services and technologies, including dark fiber, DWDM, SONET/SDH, Ethernet, and IP.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Extensive technology-related project management experience, having worked in Carrier Relations / Vendor Management a plus.
  • Experienced in the Delivery of Telecommunications Infrastructure, and Space and Power from 3rd Party Suppliers.
  • Experience working with both US and international telecom vendors and willingness to travel up to 15% a plus.
  • A deep understanding of interconnectivity requirements within carrier hotels including physical interfaces, cable types, connector types and riser details.
  • Demonstrated organizational, project tracking, and communications skills
Apply now

jobs.title: Test Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Test Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Testing

Google Test Engineers guarantee that our company's software works every time for every user while scaling to the highest levels. We tackle huge technical challenges that push the limits of computer science. Our team is a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill and a penchant for quality.

The role: Test Engineer, Google Fiber

As a Test Engineer for the Google Fiber team, you will spend a large part of your time creating test strategies and writing test plans to interact with various groups to test a particular product or a suite of Google Fiber products. The remainder of your time will be coding in either C++ or Java or scripting in Python. Google Test Engineers are expected to find ways to break the code developed by Software Engineer’s.

Google Fiber offers an amazing range of opportunities for you to make a big impact on the quality of software seen by millions of people around the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop test strategies.
  • Automate tests using test frameworks.
  • Write moderately complex code/scripts to test systems.
  • Take responsibility for monitoring product development and usage at all levels with an eye toward improving product quality.
  • Create test harnesses and infrastructure.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years of experience developing test automation in C++, Java or Python.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science.
  • 6 years relevant work experience, 3 years industry experience.
  • Deep knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases, and debugging.
  • Highly proficient in a Unix/Linux environment.
  • Deep knowledge of internet technologies.
Apply now

jobs.title: Web Developer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Web Developer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Web Developer, Google Fiber

As a Web Developer of Customer Applications for the Google Fiber team, you’ll be responsible for building cutting edge technology that changes the way people connect to the Internet. The Google Fiber project is essentially a start-up. This gives you the opportunity to work for a startup while leveraging all the infrastructure Google has to offer. You’ll be responsible for owning your part in driving projects to launch with all the benefits and resources of a larger organization. You’ll be faced with challenges and asked to solve problems that will ultimately revolutionize home networking. You’ll be a key driver in helping us build next-generation web and mobile applications that support new ways customers can interact with their service providers.

Think about the things you wished your service provider did differently, and come work with us to make it a reality.

Responsibilities:

  • Build next-generation web applications with a focus on the customer.
  • Create innovative UI elements, stunningly elegant JavaScript contraptions, and outstanding web development work in general.
  • Engage and interact with back-end systems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • AJAX/HTML/CSS experience and an interest in user interface design and object-oriented JavaScript skills.
  • Experience working in Linux or UNIX environment with web application development experience.
  • Experience with UI frameworks such as XUL, Flex, and XAML.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Significant development experience in server-side technologies such as C/C++ and/or Java.
  • Experience working on cross-browser platforms.
Apply now

jobs.title: Wireless Test Engineer, Google Access Services - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Wireless Test Engineer, Google Access Services - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Wireless Test Engineer, Google Access Services

As a Wireless Test Engineer, your job will be to test and characterize wireless systems and technologies spanning licensed and unlicensed spectrum bands.

You will play a critical role in the testing, analysis and finally commercial realization of these innovative technologies while working closely with system architects, development and field engineers. This is a great opportunity for an experienced and innovative engineer to play an impactful role in the development of the next generation of wireless technologies and applications

Responsibilities:

  • Author test plans and specifications to evaluate the performance of wireless systems and technologies. Execute and track test cycles.
  • Architect and manage wireless testbeds ranging from lab to field scenarios.
  • Develop test scripts and frameworks to automate test execution and data extraction.
  • Analyze metrics and results to characterize system performance and correlate results to specific system/component aspects.
  • Work interactively with system designers, development engineers and field engineers.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in EE. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience in wireless systems/technologies such as WiFi, Bluetooth, GSM, 3G, LTE with a good understanding of PHY, MAC and higher layer protocols.
  • Hands-on experience with test equipment such as spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and test tools such as QXDM, TEMS, WFA Sigma, Azimuth, iPerf, Ixia Chariot, Veriwave, Ruckus Zap. Direct experience in configuring complementary networking equipment such as switches, routers, AAA servers, etc.
  • Strong familiarity with scripting languages such as Perl, Tcl or Python and signal analysis tools such as Matlab. Programming experience in C/C++ in a Linux environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in EE/CS with a good understanding of PHY layer aspects, MAC and higher layer protocols and system-level interactions.
  • Direct experience with commercial field deployments, troubleshooting live deployed systems.
  • In-depth experience with PHY layer multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) antenna techniques and algorithms and MAC layer air-interface scheduling algorithms employed in wireless systems.
  • Strong familiarity with authentication mechanisms and protocols in WiFi and cellular; hands-on experience with configuring enterprise authentication servers.
  • Ability to architect and set up large testbeds with a mix of wired and wireless devices and set up infrastructure to extract key metrics and performance indicators.
  • Prior experience with WiFi alliance and or 3G GCF certification procedures and/or operator acceptance criteria.
Apply now

jobs.title: Automotive System Test Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Automotive System Test Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Hardware Operations

Google's Hardware Operations team consists of diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers who design and operate some of the most sophisticated systems in the world. This fast-growing group develops, builds and supports the physical infrastructure behind Google's products.

The role: Automotive System Test Engineer

As a System Test Engineer, you will design and execute test plans and procedures for complex, dynamic electromechanical and software-intensive systems. You will also be responsible for performing technical performance analyses of a variety of electronic and mechanical systems under test and writing detailed test and defect reports that summarize the test results. You will work with a multidisciplinary team to identify the appropriate test methods and experiments necessary to understand failure modes and their root causes.

Responsibilities:

  • Test embedded real-time electronic systems.
  • Design, execute, and document system test plans and procedures
  • Develop and maintain a requirements traceability matrix.
  • Assist with the investigation of the root cause and contributing factors of a system’s failure modes.
  • Identify appropriate test methods and experiments to validate a system’s capabilities.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 4 years industry experience testing automotive systems.
  • Prior experience planning, executing, and analyzing the results from three or more of these kinds of tests for on-road motor vehicles.
  • Deep understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle, requirements writing, and the verification and validation of systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience testing in the automotive industry.
  • Testing mechanical systems, especially as it relates to thermal, shock, vibration, EMI, and sealing.
  • Testing electronics, software, or mechanical systems in the automotive industry.
  • Testing control systems.
  • Testing perception (e.g., obstacle detection, computer vision) systems.
  • Excellent writing and communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Electrical Hardware Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Electrical Hardware Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Electrical Hardware Engineer

As an Electrical Hardware Engineer, you will be creating reliable systems operating in the real world. You will design and build embedded systems and will participate in all aspects of design and implementation from the initial conceptual design to the final bring-up and debugging of the system. You will work within a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group consisting of software, electronics, optics, and mechanical engineers.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, debug and characterize embedded systems for a self-driving vehicle.
  • Evaluate and improve current processes and components.
  • Carry new design concepts through exploration, prototyping, development, and into deployment/mass production.
  • Prepare documentation both for internal R&D use and for transfer of products to manufacturing.
  • Collaborate with other team members, including software, optical, electronics, mechanical engineering, and operations staff.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in electrical engineering or related field. (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of hardware architecture, board design, board bring-up, devices and interconnects experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in electrical engineering or related field.
  • Relevant experience with an emphasis on electronics circuit and embedded system design and a love of solving challenging problems.
  • Experience with FMEA and other reliability processes.
  • Knowledge of embedded environments; familiar with FPGA and microcontroller design, VHDL/Verilog experience. Demonstrable understanding and experience with board level design.
  • Familiar with system integration and construction with multiple micro-components.
  • Firmware, software and system level experience.
