jobs.title: Global Process Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Global Process Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or Atlanta, GA.

The area: Engineering, Hardware Operations

Google's Hardware Operations team consists of diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers who design and operate some of the most sophisticated systems in the world. This fast-growing group develops, builds and supports the physical infrastructure behind Google's products.

The role: Global Process Manager

You will facilitate process, design, optimization, and continuous improvement for Global Processes within the Hardware Operations organization. You will participate in one-on-one interviews and brainstorming sessions with various cross-functional groups via: tech talks, meetings, email, blogs, and documentation “Fix-its.” You will travel to global data centers and the Mountain View main campus to meet with subject matter experts and the end-user community to understand their requirements. You will find yourself in a variety of collaborative situations: encouraging innovation, observing and participating, as well as, listening to and coaching team members. You will also work with technical writers and data center operations techs to review processes unique to our hardware operations organization. You may also expect to participate in development of documentation and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Define, manage, maintain, and improve processes within Google’s hardware and software infrastructure.
  • Act as the lead communicator on process between various projects and groups, and the functional area(s).
  • Travel throughout Google to educate and be educated about Google infrastructure.
  • Encourage innovation, process improvements and solutions within the functional area(s).
  • Act as an advocate for function and process on software design teams for the group.

Requirements:

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Engineering (CE, ME, IE, etc) preferred or equivalent.
  • At least 3 years of Process Experience in industry-standard process design and methodologies.
  • Demonstrated process improvement experience and accomplishments. Not only should they have designed process but also Experience with influencing and leading organizational change to implement the process.
  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment is also a plus.
  • Technical expertise: Minimum knowledge of personal computers, such as an understanding of internal components (RAM, Disk Drives, CPU, Motherboard, etc) and perhaps is a "tinkerer" with consumer level computer systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels. Must be comfortable speaking before large groups.
  • Travel up to 25%

jobs.title: Hardware Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Hardware Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTx)

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband.

The role: Hardware Engineer, Google Fiber

As a Hardware Engineer, you will design, develop and deploy Google's next generation broadband access networking systems. You have a solid hardware board design background. You also have knowledge of system architecture, high power regulator board designs, and efficiency. You will define board layout constraints and requirements as well as oversee physical engineering design layout. As an engineer on our team you will be directly involved in board design and analysis of board level power distribution and power conversion.

Responsibilities:

  • Create hardware block diagrams and design specification documents.
  • Own board schematic design for complex systems such as multi-layer high speed gigabit buses, interconnects, and optical interfaces.
  • Implement complex FPGA design using Verilog HDL tools such as Xilinx or Altera.
  • Develop hardware engineering and qualification test plans for different design phases, and HALT test and screening.
  • Perform DVT design verification, test, and high speed signal integrity analysis such as ISI characterization.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MS in Electrical Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • 7 years of hardware high speed board design, board bring-up experience, devices and interconnects such as PCI/PCI-X, PCIe, DDR2/3, XAUI, SERDES, SPI, I2C, MDIO.
  • C/C++, and assembly language programming.
  • Fluent with schematic symbol creation for different packages such as dense uBGA, CSP, and custom parts.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with high volume consumer products design experience.
  • Experience with shipping volume products and very familiar with MTBF analysis, and DFM/DFT guidelines.
  • Understanding of manufacturing process flows such as SMT, ICT/JTAG, board functional tests, and system integration.
  • Familiar with consumer networking and multimedia functions such as WiFi, USB, e/SATA, and HDMI.
  • Familiar with embedded Linux designs, and in-system tests such as POST, BIST, and diagnostics.
Apply now

jobs.title: Hardware Testing Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Hardware Testing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Hardware Testing Engineer

Google's custom-designed machines and networking hardware make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. As a Hardware Testing Engineer, you will design tests around characterizing or qualifying different types of equipment from networking to server systems and provide leadership and guidance to junior Hardware Testing Engineers where needed. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist design engineers in testing and evaluating new products, root causing issues found in test data, and actively participating by making sound recommendations to resolve the issues.
  • Perform bench level repair and bring-up on engineering prototypes; Prepare and execute diagnostic test plans while documenting results.
  • Execute DVT test plans such as signal integrity measurements and environmental tests; Generate and apply engineering change orders or other experimental reworks.
  • Assemble test fixtures, load banks, and other components common to product development.
  • Lead efforts in a electrical engineering lab which includes coordinating bring up efforts, delegating tasks, and setting priorities for other team members.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must be able to work from schematics, CAD drawings, rough engineering drawings and/orverbal instructions
  • 5 years of experience working in a hardware R&D lab environment.
  • Possess excellent soldering skills and is able to solder small packages such as 0402 resistors and other SMT devices

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer/Electronic Engineering
  • Working knowledge of modern analog and digital electronics and electronic circuits.
  • Proficient with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, amp-probes, logic analyzers, communication analyzers, etc.
  • Ability to clearly present information both orally and in written format to all levels of engineering individuals.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Hardware Validation Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Hardware Validation Engineer, Google Fiber

Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

As a Hardware Test and Qualification Engineer your objective will be to collaborate closely with Hardware and Software design teams to develop test plans and infrastructures that evaluate and characterize the performance of our cutting edge Fiber To The Home and networking platforms. In addition, you will develop test suites, performance monitoring and automation routines that continually evolve and improve the qualification processes to yield more efficient failure detection and prevention.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with development teams to understand new project architectures and system components. Investigate test outcomes thoroughly and participate in root cause analysis of undefined behaviors.
  • Communicate findings and recommendations.
  • Strive for efficiency and efficacy in test execution, data gathering. data analysis, and reporting.
  • Cultivate good working relationships with customers, component suppliers and manufacturing to further quality goals.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Expertise in characterizing high speed buses such as xGMII, XAUI, XFI, SFI, PCIe, DDR.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • 2 years of hardware/system networking design experience, or 4 years in HDL design and verification.
  • Understanding of hardware evaluation methodologies, including development of test cases/suites, performance monitoring, test automation and data analysis.
  • Familiarity with Linux or other Unix operating systems as well as strong scripting and/or programming skills.
  • Familiar with ISI signal integrity analysis, and bit error rate testing thorough understanding of system power measurements, timing analysis, and environmental testing
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills together with demonstrated technical leadership and mentoring skills.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. jobs.title: Networking, Hardware Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Networking, Hardware Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Networking, Hardware Engineer

Our Hardware Design Engineers develop the next generation networking products for all our services. You will be part of the team responsible for delivering these innovative networking solutions that will break industry price/performance barriers. You will be writing detailed design specifications, developing schematic designs, supervising PCB layout and performing system level bring-up and design validation. You will develop test plans and scripts to validate your designs and assist in the production release, deployment and sustainability of the overall solution within Google infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

  • Specify, Design and Develop Networking Hardware solutions.
  • Test and Validate Hardware Design.
  • Support product NPI and product sustaining.

Requirements:

  • BS, MS or PhD in electrical engineering or equivalent.
  • At least 2 years of Networking hardware architecture, design, and bring-up or equivalent.
  • Experience with component-level and integrated system testing.
  • Experience releasing products to manufacturing desirable.
  • Experience with Ethernet highly desirable.
  • Understanding of high speed digital, optical and interconnect design.
Apply now

jobs.title: Operations Technician Assistant (Temporary to Hire) - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Operations Technician Assistant (Temporary to Hire) - Mountain View  

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

This is a temporary role offered through Adecco.

The area: Data Center

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. We're diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers working on a daily basis to develop data centers that are changing the face of contemporary computing facilities.

The role: Operations Technician Assistant (Temporary to Hire)

As an Operations Technician Assistant (OTA) you will work alongside Operations Technicians in installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining servers, networking equipment, cabling. This can sometimes be a physically demanding job. OTA's will also expand their basic knowledge and experience working computers and related equipment.

Responsibilities:

  • Fix broken servers (replace hard drives, replace bad sticks of RAM, etc.).
  • Crimp and run datacenter cabling.
  • Learn and apply diagnostic methods to troubleshoot datacenter equipment.
  • Physically move and rack equipment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of and hands on experience with computer hardware.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ability to learn new software quickly
  • Work independently or as part of a team, and ensure tasks are completed correctly and quickly.
  • Safely lift and move at least 50lbs.
  • Candidate must be flexible on hours; weekend and/or shift work will be required.

For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to temporaryjobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Operations Technician Assistant (Temporary to Hire) - Mountain View.

jobs.title: Optics Hardware Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Optics Hardware Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Optics Engineer

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As an optical engineer, you will be working in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group, you will rely on your creativity and your diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to new engineering problems. You should also have a good understanding of geometric optics along with excellent documentation, communication and analytical skill are a must.

As a key member of the team, you manage projects in multiple areas with your expertise. You also monitor the performance of vendors working on projects and evaluate new technologies.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform optical metrology, data analysis, build prototypes and assist in R&D investigations.
  • Prepare documentation both for internal R&D use and for transfer of products to manufacturing.
  • Collaborate with other team members, including optical, electronics, mechanical engineering, and operations staff.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Optical Engineering or Optical Physics. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience
  • Hands on laboratory skills in optics as exemplified with 2 years of diverse project work or industrial experience in geometric optics.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Optical Engineering or Optical Physics
  • Working knowledge of one major optical design software.
  • Excellent working knowledge of office software such as spreadsheets and presentation tools.
Apply now

jobs.title: System Test Engineer, Special Projects - Mountain View
jobs.content:
System Test Engineer, Special Projects - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: System Test Engineer, Special Projects

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a datacenter facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.

As a System Test Engineer, you will design and execute test plans and procedures for automotive active safety systems. You will also be responsible for performing technical performance analyses of a variety of electronic and mechanical systems under test and writing detailed test and defect reports that summarize the test results. You will work with a multidisciplinary team to identify the appropriate test methods and experiments necessary to understand failure modes and their root causes.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, execute, and document system test plans and procedures.
  • Develop and maintain a requirements traceability matrix.
  • Assist with the investigation of the root cause and contributing factors of a system’s failure modes.
  • Identify appropriate test methods and experiments to validate a system’s capabilities.
  • Feed test results and technical performance analyses into technical engineering specifications.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 4 years industry experience testing complex electromechanical systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering.
  • 6 years relevant work experience.
  • Experience with two or more of the following, testing embedded real-time electronic systems, testing mechanical systems, especially as it relates to thermal, shock, vibration, EMI, and sealing, testing electronics, software, or mechanical systems in the automotive industry, testing control systems, testing perception (e.g., obstacle detection, computer vision) systems.
  • Deep understanding of how various automotive systems work and interoperate (e.g., engine, power, transmission, powertrain, hybrid-electric systems, braking systems, active and/or passive safety systems).
  • Highly proficient in a Unix/Linux environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Automation Engineer, Advanced Projects - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Automation Engineer, Advanced Projects - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Automation Engineer, Advanced Projects

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies which have changed how millions interact, making accessible and useful the world's information. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search To handle information at the the scale of the web requires ideas from every areas of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and always eager to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

As an Automation Engineer in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group, you will rely on your creativity and your diverse range of engineering experience to develop solutions to new engineering problem, with a special focus on the software and controls for automated equipment.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, test, and qualify robust software and hardware in a manufacturing environment, including automation, control, sensing, data collection, and logging.
  • Work closely with mechanical and hardware engineers to develop, test, and qualify automated equipment.
  • Maintain clear documentation and communication of goals, risks, status, and prioritized feature requests and bugs.
  • Work with process engineers to qualify parts, processes, and equipment with statistical process control.
  • Develop and maintain strong functional relationships across multidisciplinary teams to anticipate future requirements.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering. (In lieu of degree, 6 years relevant experience).
  • Deep understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle, requirements writing, and the verification and validation of systems.
  • 4 years industry experience testing automotive systems.
  • Experience developing active safety systems for the automotive industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering. (In lieu of degree, 8 years relevant experience).
  • 6 years relevant work experience in the automotive industry.
  • Experience testing in the automotive industry.
  • Understanding of how various automotive systems work and interoperate (e.g., engine, power, transmission, powertrain, hybrid-electric systems, braking systems, active and/or passive safety systems).
  • Knowledge of testing embedded real-time systems.
  • Understanding of common motor vehicle testing standards from the SAE, ISO, and NHTSA. For example, the ISO 3888 double lane change maneuver.
Apply now

jobs.title: Contract Manufacturing Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Contract Manufacturing Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: Contract Manufacturing Manager

As a contract manufacturing expert, you will be responsible for the contract manufacturing strategy and execution that supports production of one of the largest compute platforms in the world. You will work closely with contract manufacturers, engineering, NPI, quality and operations partners to ensure supply continuity with optimal cost and quality. You will also drive the evolution of tools, systems, and processes that enable greater operational efficiency, accuracy, and utilization of assets.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain contract manufacturing strategy and partner relationships.
  • Collaborate with internal cross functional teams to determine manufacturing requirements. Drive contract manufacturer capability and capacity to enable on-time and predictable delivery of material to all points of consumption.
  • Manage schedule, capacity, supply chain flexibility, quality issues and new product updates. Communicate status and risks to management.
  • Negotiate services and pricing. Negotiate master service agreements and statements of work.
  • Measure partner performance and drive continuous improvement with regular business reviews. Identify and champion process improvements in support of new contract manufacturing requirements.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors or equivalent degree in Business with emphasis in Operations or Finance. BS/MS in IE, ME a plus. MBA a plus.
  • At least 5 years of work experience in supply chain operations/manufacturing.
  • Ability to successfully work across multiple levels of an organization.
  • Excellent program management skills with keen attention to detail.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Electronics Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Hardware Operations

Google's Hardware Operations team consists of diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers who design and operate some of the most sophisticated systems in the world. This fast-growing group develops, builds and supports the physical infrastructure behind Google's products.

The role: Electronics Manufacturing Engineer

As a manufacturing engineer in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group, you will rely on your creativity and your diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to new engineering problems. You will have the opportunity to define the manufacturing strategy and implementation for high volume products. Good communication skills are necessary to ensure the successful integration of the various components. A deep understanding of mechanical, electrical and opto-mechanical manufacturing processes and knowledge of plastic/polymer engineering are needed. You will need to have the expertise to develop manufacturing internally as well as with partners.

  • Conceptualize and design various levels of automation.
  • Develop and maintain strong functional relationships across multidisciplinary teams to anticipate future manufacturing requirements.

  • Experience manufacturing development for consumer electronic products a must.
  • Hands-on experience with manufacturing deployment and needs to be hands on type of engineer with 12 years of experience with 5 years of those in manufacturing.

jobs.title: Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Manufacturing Engineer

As a Manufacturing Engineer in the Platforms Supply Chain Organization (SCO), you will join the team responsible for setting and managing the manufacturing standards for Google’s server, storage and networking equipment. You are a Manufacturing expert with a proven track record of overcoming huge obstacles to successfully launch new products in Contract Manufacturer (CM) and Original Design Manufacturer (ODM) environments. You are hands on and have extensive understanding of the tools, processes and techniques used to manufacture products. You are a valued partner to the product development team through your industry knowledge, your experience identifying and qualifying advanced manufacturing techniques and your spot on Design For Excellence (DFX) feedback.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage as the Manufacturing Engineer representative to Product Development Team. Own and drive key deliverables to SCO checklist, such as manufacturing plans. Coordinate with the SCO team to identify and qualify supply chain. Own CM and ODM readiness for pre-production and production builds; schedule, equipment, processes, capacity.
  • Drive DFx into Google’s platform products. Formalize through development of DFx guidelines. Justify recommendations by quantifying impact in areas such as cycle time, quality and cost. Review with team and track adoption. Partner with the platform product development team to identify and select technologies and suppliers to meet the requirements of Google’s new products. Drive development and qualification of advanced manufacturing processes, packages and techniques. Deploy in volume at Google’s CM’s, ODM’s and suppliers.
  • Own the manufacturing process through the life of the product. Work with the ODMs, CMs and suppliers to drive prioritization and resolution of manufacturing issues. Drive continuous improvement through the supply chain, resulting in reduced cycle time, increased yields and improved cost.
  • Lead the effort to standardize Google’s Demanufacturing and Remanufacturing processes. Work with Google’s partners to implement best practices, tools and techniques. Leverage partner shop floor control system to enforce routes, manage configurations, validate components and collect data.
  • Create and maintain AVLs, BOMs, and ECNs for all assigned products. Release into Google's document control system and ensure communicated throughout Google’s supply chain and supporting SCO infrastructure. Develop product assembly and disassembly documentation and use as basis for partner training and MPI development.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BSEE or BSIE or BSME degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of experience in a Manufacturing Engineering Role.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree.
  • 10 years relevant work experience including experience in fabrication PCBs and PCBAs and Box Build processes.
  • Successfully launched new products at both contract manufactures and ODMs.
  • Organized and methodical with great verbal and written communication skills.
  • Willingness to travel.
Apply now

jobs.title: Manufacturing Product Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manufacturing Product Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Manufacturing and Supply Chain

Google requires a world class supply chain to deliver the computer and networking equipment for its ever-expanding global data centres. Our team is made up of engineers and supply chain professionals who design, build and manage that supply chain. The focus is not just on cost and delivery but how to best manufacture Google's confidential and proprietary internal computer hardware.

The role: Manufacturing Product Engineer

As a Manufacturing Product Engineer, you will be an integral part of the our Google's Platform Development Team. You will join the team that is responsible for readying our hardware for release to production. You will provide front line support for the Google Platform hardware from production release through end of life. You will be the Manufacturing Product Engineer expert with a proven track record of overcoming huge obstacles to launch new products. You will be also be responsible for NPI Support and Sustaining Engineering for this role.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide on-site support for pre-production builds at CM/ODM, to include driving pre-production factory readiness, supporting product bring-up, providing training and gathering feedback on DFx and yield issues.
  • Drive Engineering DVT (Design Validation Testing) support, and coordinating with Test Engineering to establish test coverage requirements for manufacturing test process.
  • Engage with the Platform Development team to establish parameters for monitoring health of fleet, and drive program in support of early field failure analysis.
  • Own the Front line for Production and Remanufacturing product issues, monitor health of fleet and initiate investigation of problem areas, and root cause product failures and drive corrective action.
  • Coordinate release of NPI BOMs into PDM system, technical review of product changes through supply chain and in field, support second source and EOL replacement part qualification, and release of ECOs, MCOs, FCOs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS Electrical Engineering (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years of experience in Product Development or Product Engineering.
  • Understanding of BOM structures and PDM systems such as Winchill or Agile.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS Electrical Engineering.
  • 6 years relevant work experience at a Server, Memory or Disk Drive company.
  • SQL and scripting experience.
  • Successfully created and executed a Design Validation Test Plan on a complex electronic assembly.
Apply now

jobs.title: Manufacturing Product and Test Engineering Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manufacturing Product and Test Engineering Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Manufacturing and Supply Chain

Google requires a world class supply chain to deliver the computer and networking equipment for its ever-expanding global data centres. Our team is made up of engineers and supply chain professionals who design, build and manage that supply chain. The focus is not just on cost and delivery but how to best manufacture Google's confidential and proprietary internal computer hardware.

The role: Manufacturing Product and Test Engineering Manager

As Manufacturing Product and Test Engineering Manager in the Supply Chain Operations (SCO) group, you will join the team responsible for developing the manufacturing processes and test capability to deliver this infrastructure. You are a Product and Test Engineering expert, with experience building and leading a high performance engineering team. You understand the tools, processes and techniques needed to manufacture server and networking hardware, and have a proven track record of overcoming obstacles to successfully launch new products in Contract Manufacturer (CM) and Original Design Manufacturer (ODM environments). You are a valued partner to the product development team through your industry knowledge, experience, identifying and qualifying advanced manufacturing techniques, and the spot on design for manufacturing (DFx) feedback you and your team provides.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage a team responsible for performing the Manufacturing Product and Test Engineering function for Google's Platform products. Define team strategy and roadmap, and drive adoption cross functionally.
  • Develop quarterly objectives for team, aligning with roadmap and overall departmental vision. Assess and manage team performance through regular staff meetings, one on ones and quarterly assessments.
  • Evaluate team workload and develop staffing plan. Assign projects and balance workloads. Serve as back-up to team, picking up projects as required.
  • Serve as primary interface to staffing team, creating job descriptions, identifying sources for candidates, conducting interviews and shepherding candidates through process.
  • Provide technical expertise and leadership throughout product life cycles, driving DFx, supporting NPI builds and readying Google's supply chain. Identify gaps and drive improvements in processes, products and suppliers. Represent team and drive initiatives cross functionally.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Manufacturing engineering experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS or MS in EE/CS/ME or other applicable discipline.
  • 10 years of experience in Manufacturing Engineering supporting networking, server, storage and/or other data center infrastructure.
  • 5 years of technical management experience with expert knowledge in a minimum of one manufacturing engineering discipline, preferable product or test engineering.
  • Strong NPI experience, with solid understanding of process required to qualify and release new products into CM/ODM environment.
  • Ability to support or lead multiple projects simultaneously.
  • A seasoned mentor with excellent communication skills.

jobs.title: Mechanical Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Mechanical Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Mechanical Manufacturing Engineer

As a Mechanical Manufacturing Engineer in the Supply Chain Organization (SCO), you will join the team responsible for providing manufacturing support and guidance for Google’s Packaging and Electro-mechanical products. You are a Manufacturing expert with a proven track record of overcoming huge obstacles to successfully launch new products in Contract Manufacturer (CM) and Original Design Manufacturer (ODM) environments. You are hands on and have extensive understanding of the tools, processes and techniques used to manufacture Electro-mechanical products. You are a valued partner to the product development team through your industry knowledge, experience identifying and qualifying advanced manufacturing techniques and your spot on Design for Excellence (DFX) feedback.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop Design for Manufacturability/Assembly (DFM/A) analysis, Design for Cost (DFC) analysis for sheet metal (soft tool), plastic injection molded, metal stamped (hard tool) and Electro-mechanical parts and assemblies, effectively communicating required design and material changes to contract manufacturers and engineering peers.
  • Determine and qualify contract manufacturers/vendors for precision sheet metal, high-volume metal stamping, plastic injection molding, tooling and level 3 electro-mechanical assemblies.
  • Provide comprehensive Mechanical Manufacturing Engineering support to Google's global manufacturing partners during development and production builds. Create work instructions and assembly guides as needed.
  • Resolve manufacturing and field challenges by applying knowledge and skills, escalating design, manufacturing and product test issues to others within the organization when appropriate. Identify, initiate and drive process improvements that reduce process cycle times and cost, while maintaining exceptional quality.
  • Utilize a Product Data Management (PDM) system, create and maintain Bills of Materials (BoM), Approved Vendor Lists (AVL) and Engineering Change Notifications/Orders (ECN/O) in support of Google Products.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors of Science degree in mechanical, electrical or industrial technology (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of relevant work experience including experience with Product Data Management systems (Agile, Windchill) and 3D CAD modeling tools, such as SolidWorks or Pro Engineer (Pro Engineer).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Proven experience developing solid, effective technical relationships with contract manufacturers.
  • Understanding of precision sheet metal fabrication processes (NC punching, press brake forming, hardware insertion processes), hard tooling fabrication processes (metal stamping) and plastic injection molding processes.
  • Expertise with Electro-Mechanical assembly.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.

jobs.title: NPI Manufacturing Program Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
NPI Manufacturing Program Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineer and Operations

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: NPI Manufacturing Program Manager

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Manufacturing Program Manager in the Platforms Supply Chain Organization (SCO), you will be the primary Manufacturing interface to the development team with the responsibility for driving new product development builds as well as supporting those products in a sustaining environment. You are well versed in the CM/ODM manufacturing environments and will lead a team of seasoned professionals to ensure products are designed and built Google’s high standards.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and execute development (NPI) builds and ensure these products transition to production within cost, quality and capacity parameters.
  • Lead cross-functional teams within Google and with external partners to prepare for production ramp and/or product transitions.
  • Drive ramp readiness with internal teams as well as external partners (i.e. material availability, capacity readiness, transition plans).
  • Drive cross-functional teams to optimize the supply chain for specific strategic reasons, while accounting for risks, changes in schedule or demand.
  • Provide support for products in a sustaining environment.

  • Ability and experience managing complex projects involving team members from multiple disciplines.

The area: Operations and IT, Manufacturing and Supply Chain

Google requires a world class supply chain to deliver the computer and networking equipment for its ever-expanding global data centres. Our team is made up of engineers and supply chain professionals who design, build and manage that supply chain. The focus is not just on cost and delivery but how to best manufacture Google's confidential and proprietary internal computer hardware.

The role: NPI Materials Manager

The NPI Materials Manager position is an intricate part of Google’s Supply Chain Organization (SCO). This critical role’s primary responsibility is to ensure material availability for all development builds. As an NPI Materials Manager you will own the Bill-of-Material and manage, coordinate and drive multiple partners to ensure material availability for NPI build activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive material readiness for all NPI builds. Ensure smooth product transitions.
  • Be the primary material liaison with ODM/CM/Suppliers. Represent the materials organization in internal program meetings.
  • Maintain budget records and provide high level of Customer Service for internal customers.
  • Source, evaluate and recommend potential suppliers, support cost reduction programs. Execute order processing from Oracle Material Requirements Planning output.
  • Follow up on open purchase orders with vendors to ensure timely delivery and communicate with internal customers to resolve receiving and accounts payable discrepancies.

jobs.title: New Technology Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
New Technology Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: New Technology Manufacturing Engineer

Google's custom-designed equipment makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.

You design and analyze products and related data, improve manufacturing and supportive processes and determine and execute customer and product requirements. You lead small teams on complex projects that involve analyzing data, improving manufacturing and support processes and , including managing timelines and resources and providing expertise to internal and external partners, teams and vendors.

Responsibilities:

  • Primary Manufacturing Engineering liaison to Google new technology teams, understanding project requirements, assessing product technologies and developing a manufacturing plan and resource requirements to support it.
  • Provide technical expertise and leadership throughout the product life cycle, driving DFx, supporting NPI builds, and readying Google's supply chain.
  • Establish, deliver and maintain the manufacturing and quality processes and standards for Google's new technologies, leveraging existing tools and processes as required.
  • Provide support to design, manufacturing and commodity teams in selection, sourcing, qualification and application of components and suppliers used in Google's products.
  • Own product quality through Google's supply chain and into the field. Monitor product quality and initiate investigation of product failures, driving root cause and corrective action.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree in EE, CS, ME or applicable discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS.
  • 7 years of experience in Manufacturing Engineering supporting networking, server, storage and/or other data center infrastructure
  • Strong NPI experience, with solid understanding of process required to qualify and release new products into a CM/ODM environment
  • Management experience.
  • Optical Networking and consumer product experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

jobs.title: Production, Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Production, Manufacturing Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Production, Manufacturing Engineer

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a datacenter facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.

You will build hardware and software for a large scale new project. You really will be “hands on” and you will frequently be working with machines for cutting, shaping, assembling, and testing new hardware prototypes. Once you’ve been able to construct prototypes that pass your field tests, you will convert designs into blueprints and you will work with manufacturers in order to scale up to full scale production.

Responsibilities:

  • Construct functioning prototypes and test them in our labs and in the field.
  • Prepare documentation both for internal R&D use and for transfer of products to manufacturing.
  • Collaborate with other team members, including our advanced R&D team and operations staff.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • Hands on machine shop and construction skills as exemplified by 2 years of diverse project work.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Hands on CAD software experience.
  • Working knowledge of at least one major CAD system.
Apply now

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Pulling on your technical and leadership expertise, you lead end-to-end research projects in multiple areas of expertise across data center facilities and manage a team of direct reports working on equipment installation, troubleshooting and debugging.

You will lead a team building hardware and software for a large scale new project. As the advanced R&D team succeeds in constructing prototypes that pass your field tests, your team will convert their designs into production blueprints and you will work with manufacturers in order to scale up to full scale production.

jobs.title: Quality Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Quality Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Quality Engineer

As a Quality Engineer, you will join the team responsible for setting and managing the quality and reliability standards for Google’s servers, networking and infrastructure equipment. You are a Quality expert with a proven track record of establishing quality programs from the ground up. You are hands on and have extensive involvement in the tools and techniques used to introduce great new products. You have solid partner management skills and love to scrape through data and use it to drive process improvements throughout the supply chain.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish product quality and reliability standards for Google data center equipment and facilities. Own cost of quality and manage through life of product.
  • Build quality models for new products. Use models to predict product reliability performance and drive design improvements. Evaluate and improve product quality and reliability performance using techniques such as DFMEA, HALT, RDT and ORT.
  • Work with the various teams at Google to ensure new products and supporting systems are being designed to provide the data required to manage the quality and reliability of our fleet. Establish dashboards and metrics and use a data-driven approach to problem identification and resolution.
  • Provide consultation to the design, manufacturing and commodity teams in the selection, sourcing, qualification, and application of components and suppliers used in our equipment.
  • Investigate failures and coordinate failure analysis, determining root causes, categorizing failures and driving corrective action through Google’s supply chain and design team.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Technical undergraduate degree (BSEE, BSIE, BSME) (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of experience in the field of Quality/Reliability Engineering.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS
  • 10 years of relevant work experience including experience in multiple areas of cooling system, electro-mechanical system, and power distribution system.
  • Experience with reliability prediction tools.
  • American Society for Quality certification preferred (CQE, CQM, CRE, or CQA)
  • SQL and scripting a plus.
  • Open to travel.
Apply now

The area: Operations and IT, Manufacturing and Supply Chain

Google requires a world class supply chain to deliver the computer and networking equipment for its ever-expanding global data centers. Our team is made up of engineers and supply chain professionals who design, build and manage that supply chain. The focus is not just on cost and delivery but how to best manufacture Google's confidential and proprietary internal computer hardware.

The role: Spares Inventory Planner

As an expert in the areas of material planning and inventory management, you will be responsible for the strategic and tactical elements of creating and executing fulfillment plans that support Google datacenter spare component requirements. You will work closely with internal customers, procurement, engineering and operations partners to develop accurate demand and supply forecasts that directly support Google’s rapidly growing hardware infrastructure. You will also drive the creation of tools, systems, and processes that enable greater operational efficiency, accuracy, and utilization of assets.

Responsibilities:

  • Work across various organizations to develop and aggregate world-wide demand forecasts for datacenter spares consumption.
  • Develop and execute high quality global supply plans that efficiently utilize inventory assets.
  • Act as a leading team member in the development of component fulfillment strategies throughout the entire product life-cycle.
  • Enable on-time and predictable delivery of material to all points of consumption.
  • Champion process improvements and tool development in support of ongoing inventory planning and management requirements.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of supply chain management experience in the high-tech industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Business with emphasis in Operations or Finance, BS/MS in IE, ME or MBA.
  • 5 years work experience in supply chain operations/manufacturing.
  • Experience with Oracle 11i in manufacturing or inventory.

jobs.content:
Supply Chain Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Supply Chain Analyst

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Supply Chain Analyst you will use analytical and quantitative methods to understand, predict and enhance supply chain processes. You should have a track record of change management success across planning, manufacturing, inventory control and procurement processes and tools. Candidates must have the ability and interest to work on a large range of supply chain process and system initiatives for multiple groups.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with Supply Chain users and IT to identify gaps, make improvement recommendations and facilitate change.
  • Design and model enhancements to the Enterprise Systems use and integration.
  • Support development of standards, policy and procedures for Supply Chain Governance.
  • Functional design review including ERP data modeling. Support design, testing and deployment processes.
  • Data Entry and Analysis of System Setup Attributes.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years of work experience in supply chain operations or manufacturing.
  • Experience designing and building Supply Chain processes with strong Supply Chain System skills and implementation experience (ERP, MRP, APS, PLM, etc.).
  • Cross domain business knowledge (Inventory, Procurement, Planning and Finance).

jobs.content:
Business Systems Integration Analyst, Financial and Supply Chain Systems - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it – and will continue to develop and support it – with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways – giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Business Systems Integration Analyst, Financial and Supply Chain Systems

As a Business Systems Integration Analyst, you will help drive projects to improve finance and Supply Chain processes that the company manages through the business applications it builds and uses. You should be an experienced, generalist IT business analyst. You must have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and must have a background that demonstrates this ability. Google offers the opportunity to work for the world’s premier search company, outstanding benefits, and the chance to work on cutting edge technology in a collaborative, exciting and fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with internal business teams in developing delivery roadmaps, defining business processes and associated system requirements.
  • Organize and manage project work to drive predictable delivery.
  • Participate in system implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
  • Plan, prioritize, and deliver systems enhancements.
  • Support and upgrade implemented systems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant experience).
  • 2 years experience in implementing and customizing vendor software.
  • Detailed knowledge of finance accounting or Supply Chain systems, relational databases and SQL.
  • Participation in several full system implementation life-cycles (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/MA degree.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience .
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; strong analytical skills and a demonstrable bias toward action.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and thrive in a rapidly changing business environment.
  • Successful track record in working on cross-functional, cross-team projects.

jobs.title: Business Systems Integration Manager, Supply Chain Applications - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Business Systems Integration Manager, Supply Chain Applications - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Business Systems Integration Manager, Supply Chain Applications

At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently. As a Business Systems Integration Manager, you will lead a team of application developers and business analysts in meeting the business application needs of Google’s internal customers. You must have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and must have a background that demonstrates this ability. You will lead the effort to implement various 3rd party products and build internal web applications. This role will require your skills as a key contributor to help deliver operational support for the applications your team develops/implements. Alongside your team, you will work to craft successful working relationships to manage resources for a diverse range of concurrent, cross-functional projects. This role requires excellent attention to details as you ensure your team is delivering with repeatable quality and predictability.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage an IT team responsible for implementing 3rd party software products, and designing and building internal web applications that support internal business processes related to supply chain and engineering operations.
  • Deliver operational support for the applications your team develops.
  • Partner with internal business teams in developing delivery roadmaps.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BSCS, BS Information Systems. In lieu of degree, 4 years equivalent work experience.
  • 5 years of experience managing IT teams of 10-15 people.
  • Proven success in building, motivating and retaining teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience integrating custom built solutions with vendor product offerings, particularly supply chain, manufacturing and Engineering applications.
  • 7 years of software development/implementation experience.
  • Superior design and architecture knowledge, web application development skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to executives and non-technical leaders.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, Google engineers make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. If you seek to tackle such challenges as building a highly scalable computing infrastructure, novel storage systems, innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

The role: GIS Data Processing Engineer

You should be an experienced GIS data-processing Engineer who can develop software tools to process massive spatial datasets for use in Google products. In this critical position, you will be part of an exciting fast-paced project. Your role will include working as a team with software engineers and GIS specialists to tackle challenging issues and improving existing processes. As a GIS Data Processing Engineer you should have an interest in maps and aptitude for organizing spatial information.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop tools, software and processes to prepare vector and/or raster data
  • Create the framework and tools to shepherd data from acquisition through final deployment
  • Ensure all data has the proper metadata information via proper reporting from data scripts to database tools. Develop software to convert data from one format to another
  • Build validation to ensure all data adheres to strict accuracy and quality specifications
  • Produce reports related to vector data. Evaluate, analyze and compare new data sources

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, GeoSciences, or equivalent (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience.
  • Experience with Open GIS standards, file formats, tools (i.e. KML, GML, ERDAS Imagine, Adobe Photoshop, ESRI) and databases.
  • Experience with large code bases in C++, Python and/or Java.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Experience working with large data sets and fluency with vector and/or raster data.
  • Strong organizational and communication skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Gateware/Firmware Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Gateware/Firmware Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Gateware/Firmware Engineer

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

As a Gateware Engineer, you will be creating reliable systems operating in the real world. You will design and build embedded systems and will participate in all aspects of design and implementation from the initial conceptual design to the final bring-up and debugging of the system. You will work within a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group consisting of software, electronics, and mechanical engineers.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and verify gateware on FPGA’s and ASIC’s for high-availability, high-speed data acquisition systems.
  • Design, implement, and verify drivers and control code for embedded micro-controllers and Linux PC’s
  • Communicate design and implementation requirements, decisions, and trade-offs with team members from other functional groups, and be an integral part of the hardware/gateware/software co-design process.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Optical Engineering or Optical Physics. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience in geometric optics.
  • Hands on laboratory skills in optics as exemplified with 2 years of diverse project work or industrial experience in geometric optics.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Optical Engineering or Optical Physics.
  • Working knowledge of at least one major optical design software.
  • Excellent working knowledge of office software such as spreadsheets and presentation tools.
Apply now

jobs.title: Hyperion Developer, Financial Management, Essbase, Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Hyperion Developer, Financial Management, Essbase, Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it – and will continue to develop and support it – with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways – giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Hyperion Developer, Financial Management, Essbase, Planning

As a Hyperion Developer, you will be responsible for designing and building financial consolidation, reporting, forecasting and analysis systems to meet the needs of Google's worldwide internal customers. You must have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and must have a background that demonstrates this ability. Google offers the opportunity to work for the world’s premier search company, outstanding benefits, and the chance to work on cutting edge technology in a collaborative, exciting and fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with internal business teams to define business requirements, technical specifications and design solutions.
  • Develop and implement technical designs. Drive test and deployment processes.
  • Organize and manage projects. Deliver with predictability all phases of the project lifecycle, from requirements analysis through deployment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • Experience designing and building database applications, familiarity with finance and accounting processes, and openness to new technologies.
  • Exposure to a variety of scripting and programming languages, and familiarity with SQL and relational database concepts.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS/BA in Information Systems or Computer Science.
  • Experience with some of these technologies: Enterprise Performance Management Architect (EPMA), Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), Financial Data Management (FDM), Financial Reporting, Calculation Manager, Smart View, Essbase, Essbase Integration Service, Planning, Reports, Star Analytics, Data Relationship Management (DRM) SQL, Python, Visual Basic.
  • Familiarity with software development processes and project life cycles.
  • Strong analytical skills and a demonstrable bias toward action.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and comfort with high service level expectations.

jobs.title: Industrial Designer, Special Projects - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Industrial Designer, Special Projects - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Industrial Designer, Special Projects

Google's products are known for their clean design, ensuring users can quickly and easily find what they're looking for. As an Engineering Designer, you leverage your strong technical background and understanding of "good" design to look for ways to streamline the user experience. You work closely with the product managers and development engineers throughout the entire production cycle. You design everything from high-level product flow to detailed UI mockups and then use your expert scripting skills to make your designs a reality.

As an Industrial Designer focused on automotive applications, you will be working across a broad range of influence levels and within an interdisciplinary team with hardware, software, and user experience experts. From providing guidance and best practices, detailed collaborative design engagements, and highly advanced product design efforts from cradle to grave, you will be developing iconic, consumer focused experiences. You will be involved in conceptual design, implementation of prototypes, and manufacturing considerations. You will have an extensive, proven track record of working on and/or leading development of successful products.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the multi-disciplinary team to meet the requirement of design goals.
  • Express ideas and concepts through strong visual/verbal communication skills.
  • Participate in producing looks-like and works-like prototypes of the concepts.
  • Participate in transitioning the designs to manufacturing.
  • Lead ideation as well as proper implementation of ideas.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Industrial Design. In lieu of degree, 5 years of relevant experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior experience designing high end consumer electronics or automotive sectors.
  • Prior experience of form development and cutting edge manufacturing process.
  • Prior experience to working with mechanical engineering to develop new mechanical solutions in concert with new manufacturing processes.
  • Strong understanding of branding, style, proportions, global trends, technology and fashion
  • Ability to lead a design effort and collaborate and support other designers as well as other disciplines
