jobs.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer, YouTube - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Machine Learning Software Engineer, YouTube - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Software Engineering

The engineering team at YouTube (a Google company) serves billions of page views a day with a small group of clever, motivated and talented people. YouTube comprises more than 20% of the world’s http traffic and is the second most visited site in the world. We work together in small teams to design, develop, and roll out key features and products in very short time frames. Which means - something you write today could be seen by millions of viewers tomorrow.

The role: Machine Learning Software Engineer, YouTube

Are you infatuated with machine learning? Are you experienced with large scale data mining and efficient scalable learning algorithms? Are you an expert in unsupervised techniques? Are you interested in solving big, important problems related to video search and browsing? For example, would you like to build the next generation video discovery and monetization models for YouTube? Does sheer scale and diversity of the problem space excite you?

Many projects in the Video Content Analysis group are focused on these big problems. We need your help in solving them as well as a range of other fascinating Computer Vision and/or Machine Learning problems.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in cutting edge research in machine learning applications.
  • Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.
  • Come up with novel, user-facing applications in the video discovery and monetization areas.

Requirements:

  • PhD in Computer Science preferred.
  • Extensive experience programming in C and/or C++.
  • Strong background in Machine Learning required.
  • Background in text understanding is a plus.
  • Successful and proven track record on at least a few Machine Learning related projects.
Apply now

jobs.title: Mobile Operations Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Mobile Operations Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area:Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Mobile Operations Engineer

Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the Googler user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices). You occasionally partner with various teams including security, networking and infrastructure. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.

You improve the front-line user experience by providing on-demand user support for Google's corporate users, resources, tools and applications while also contributing to longer-term projects.

You will have practical experience in a large scale environment and/or a Bachelors Degree in Engineering. You will have strong knowledge of mobile technology and an ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. In addition to this you should have a customer-first attitude and possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Apply if you are an outstanding problem solver, creative thinker and a team player.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical support for Google’s corporate mobile devices and infrastructure
  • Gather requirements related to mobile technology from internal groups and work closely with the Android team, cellular carriers and hardware manufacturers to create solutions to meet those requirements
  • Develop automation tools to improve efficiency of the processes involved in managing the fleet of mobile devices.
  • Support the evaluation and selection processes for sourcing cellular services and devices world-wide
  • Develop and publish documentation including known issues, tips for end users, and training materials for partner groups.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • Experience with UNIX/Linux administration.
  • Experience with scripting languages.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Engineering.
  • Excellent organizational, communication, leadership and customer service skills.
  • Communication, interpersonal and customer service skills.
  • Excellent time management skills, organized, hands-on and able to handle multiple projects.

Operations Manager, Corporate Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations & IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it – and will continue to develop and support it – with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways – giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Operations Manager, Corporate Engineering

As an Operations Manager, you will be part of a global leadership team that creates tomorrow’s technology solutions today and puts those solutions in the hands of Google employees around the globe. You will be an inspirational leader who has experience recruiting, developing and leading a highly talented team of engineering and operations professionals. You will bring a strong interest for pushing the edge of technology, and use this to facilitate large scale enterprise adoption of cloud-based computing and mobile technologies. You have a solid technical foundation and the flexibility, talent and aptitude to learn new technologies and lead a variety of projects and teams across the organization.

Responsibilities:

jobs.content:
Partner Engineering, Technical Account Manager, Chrome OS - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Chrome and Apps

There's always more information out there, and our Partnerships team works to get it. We develop relationships with a range of organizations, from content providers to publishers, and find ways for them to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. We find great content for our products, and we also work with partner sites to syndicate our own Google products. From negotiating agreements to solving technical problems for partners, we're in pursuit of gathering the world's information.

The role: Partner Engineering, Technical Account Manager, Chrome OS

As a Technical Account Manager, you are the engagement manager taking responsibility for the success of our partnerships with the largest hardware manufacturers. You work with partners to define hardware specifications and enable software integration. Your business acumen is needed to understand your partners' needs, and propose technical solutions for engineering and product teams to implement. Your responsibility for end-to-end technical integration will require understanding both of technology and of the dynamics between players in the PC manufacturing ecosystem.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage strategic Chrome OS partnership with large PC hardware manufacturers and network operators.
  • Ensure successful end-to-end technical integration with hardware OEMs. Successful Management of ODMs and their factory processes and tool development.
  • Work close with chipset and component vendors to qualify new components and ensure successful integration with Chrome OS.
  • Work close with New Business Development, Product, Engineering, Marketing and Sales teams; 15-20% travel.
  • Act as a main point of technical contact and drive technical issues to resolution.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience, including hands-on development experience with PC/Device hardware.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BA/BS or MS/MBA in Computer Science or a related technical field.
  • A strong sense of focus and excellent attention to detail while working in a very fast-paced environment; Ability to work with ambiguity.
  • Hands-on experience with PC hardware with excellent debugging/troubleshooting skills and experience with embedded systems development.
  • Familiarity with Linus application and kernel package management.
  • Skills in scripting languages, particularly Python and shell.
  • Excellent technical, vendor project management and communication (both oral and written) skills.

jobs.title: Safety Engineer, Special Projects - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Safety Engineer, Special Projects - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Safety Engineer, Special Projects

Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

With your technical expertise, you create test plans for highly complex platforms (e.g., validating the interaction of multiple pieces of equipment at the networking and subsystem levels), and using your deep knowledge of component design characteristics, you diagnose highly complex hardware or software issues.

As a Safety Engineer you will apply the state-of-the-art in system safety to complex electromechanical robotic systems. You will be responsible for performing hazard analyses, risk assessments, and failure analyses. You will work with a multidisciplinary team to apply industry standards in functional safety to a wide array of software and electronics.

Responsibilities:

  • Apply industry standards to the system safety methodology.
  • Maintain a hazard log for systems under development.
  • Formulate and analyze risk associated with each hazard.
  • Assist with the development of a comprehensive safety case.
  • Assist with the investigation of the root cause and contributing factors of a system’s failure modes.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering.  (In lieu of degree, 6 years relevant experience).
  • Deep understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle, requirements writing, and the verification and validation of systems.
  • 4 years industry experience developing and analyzing safety critical systems.
  • Knowledge of the application and interpretation of functional safety standards for electronic devices such as IEC 61508, ISO 26262.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering.
  • 6 years relevant work experience.
Apply now

jobs.title: Technical Advisor, Litigation - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Advisor, Litigation - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

Google Legal is a close-knit team of lawyers and legal professionals who operate on a truly global stage. We take pride in working for a company with a clear mission ("to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful") and a real soul ("don't be evil"). Google's innovative services raise challenging legal questions that demand creative and practical answers. We work at the crossroads of new technologies and existing laws to provide those answers, helping Google build innovative and important products for our users around the world. If this sounds like your kind of place, it probably is.

The role: Technical Advisor, Litigation

As a Technical Advisor for the Litigation group, you will work hand-in-hand with attorneys representing Google in patent and other lawsuits, learning the technical details of products in suit and staying up-to-date on relevant product developments. You will assist with prior art searching, educating in-house and outside counsel and experts, evaluating non-infringement and invalidity positions, and developing and assessing the viability of design-around proposals. You may also have the opportunity of testifying in deposition or at trial. This is a critically important position in which you will help us develop the strongest possible legal and technical defenses for Google's products.

We are creating a team of 3-5 Technical Advisors. This team will be an exciting place to work because it is a truly innovative approach to protecting our own products in litigation, reducing our reliance on outside experts. Team members should be flexible and interested in tackling technology that might be new to them. While we hope that each member of the team will have the knowledge and skills to work with us on a number of Google products, experience with Android, Ads and/or Search are of particular interest to us as we build this team.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with various Legal, Engineering and Product group members having substantive knowledge relevant to particular disputes.
  • Develop and maintain technical expertise concerning products in suit, including by interviewing engineers and reviewing technical documentation and source code.
  • Assist with prior art searches and invalidity and non-infringement analysis of patents in suit.
  • Educate in-house and outside counsel, as well as outside experts, concerning products in suit.
  • Testify at deposition and trial concerning the disputed products and technology.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years relevant work experience.
  • Strong programming skills in Java or C/C++ and knowledge of Unix/Linux and scripting skills (Perl, Shell, Python, XML).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/PhD in computer or electrical engineering or computer science.
  • 5 years relevant work experience as an Engineer, including experience with litigation, patent law and/or USPTO admission.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex technical concepts and systems in simple terms.
  • Strong interpersonal and team skills.

jobs.title: Technical Writer, Internal Software Engineering - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Writer, Internal Software Engineering - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA or San Francisco, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Technical Writer, Internal Software Engineering

As an Internal Software Engineering Technical Writer, you will write and maintain documentation that helps Google engineers understand internal tools and software systems. You will work closely with engineering teams to learn complex technical information and communicate it in a readable, concise, and accurate manner. Your documentation will make engineers more productive and help them develop innovative products. You will also develop and implement tools that make information easier to find and that organize engineering documentation within Google..

Responsibilities:

  • Write technical documentation for Google engineers, such as overviews, tutorials, developer guides, and more
  • Edit documents written by others; coach engineers to improve their writing skills
  • Design and organize documentation sets and templates
  • Read and write code in C++, Java, or Python

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS or in lieu of degree 3 years of relevant experience
  • Experience working directly within a software development team, including extensive interaction with senior engineers
  • Ability to understand and write code examples in C++, Java, or Python

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience using UNIX environments, scripting languages, developer tools, and version control systems
  • Proficiency with HTML and CSS. Familiarity with web development technologies
  • Proven track record of researching and writing excellent documentation for developers
  • Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment

jobs.title: Vendor Solutions Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Vendor Solutions Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT

In little more than a decade, Google created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. We built it - and will continue to develop and support it - with the world's most talented administrators. Chances are that we exceed every example of a "large installation" you've encountered in your career as a network, systems or security professional. Using our unique technologies along with open source tools, we keep Google's customer-facing products running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways - giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.

The role: Vendor Solutions Engineer

As a Vendor Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for deploying and supporting vendor technical services. You are aware of the problems which come with deploying operating systems to thousands of users. You are comfortable in a customer service role where there will be frequent interaction with our internal customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Recommend technical solutions given vendor outsourcing requirements.
  • Identify improvements to make vendor outsourcing a turnkey operation.
  • Set expectations for time to implement a solution based on complexity of vendor requirements.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot technical issues through a given workflow
  • Work with Windows Administration, Network Operations, and Security Operations teams to outsource workflows, identify common problems and get resources allocated to resolve them

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS degree. In lieu of degree, 3 years of experience in technical environment
  • 3 years experience in Citrix and Windows GPOs
  • Experience with the Linux command line
  • Fluency in at least one scripting language

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS degree
  • Experience with Python scripting language
  • Knowledge of webservers, firewalls/security, DNS, web proxies, service monitoring
  • Strong knowledge of TCP/IP networking, network and application-level security
  • Excellent verbal and written skills with outstanding customer service

jobs.title: WebSpam Intelligence Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
WebSpam Intelligence Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: WebSpam Intelligence Analyst

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Quantitative Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

Through your professional expertise and judgement, you work on multiple projects concurrently, developing analyses, models and methods to support and verify the impact of your recommendations. You share your expertise by consulting on projects, serving on committees and mentoring team members.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct complex data analysis and make recommendations that significantly impact the payoff for spam worldwide
  • Develop advanced analytical tools and algorithms to model the current, past, and anticipated behavior of adversarial and cooperative web sites, SEOs, and hackers
  • Model complex relationships between enormous sets of variables to develop new abuse detection signals, measure team impact, and prioritize abuse fighting methods
  • Lead cross-functional projects and long-term analytic development initiatives, managing multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Transform the current workflow to make more scalable, implement a model under which efficiency & automation goals greatly exceed existing industry norms.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MS in Computer Science or Statistics. In lieu of degree, 6 years of relevant experience.
  • Experience in statistical software (R, S-Plus, SAS, or similar).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PhD in Computer Science or Statistics.
  • 1 year relevant work experience
  • Deep expertise and experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods.
  • Experience using technology to work efficiently with datasets such as scripting, Python, statistical software packages (R, S-Plus, SAS or similar).
  • UNIX/Linux experience.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Windows System Administrator - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Research and Systems Infrastructure

At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end ninjas: protecting your privacy, ensuring your security and leaving no trace behind.

The role: Windows System Administrator

Systems Administrators embrace Google's motto to ensure millions of users can access the world's information without a glitch. As a Systems Administrator at Google, you own and support the needs of one of Google's server infrastructure systems. You're highly technical and work directly with other server and service owners to ensure reliability and sustainability of the Google service infrastructure as well as compliance with internal policies. Success in this role means you are able to support servers in a mixed operating system environment and work efficiently with our internal technology providers as well as other operations groups. Googlers rely on your guidance when it comes to design decisions so you'll have a direct impact in keeping the business productive.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, Architect and implement solutions based on Citrix XenApp, XenDesktop and other related products (Ability to build world class application delivery infrastructure.
  • Use tools and systems to deploy Windows worldwide, including AD, WSUS, SCCM/SMS, PXE, imaging tools; manage the infrastructure on which those tools are deployed.
  • Evaluate OS level security risks within the corporate environment; propose and implement solutions to make Google’s corporate environment secure while minimizing the impact to Googler efficiency and workflow.
  • Investigate and develop software to help manage the Windows fleet and gather metrics around usage, security, and software licensing.
  • Work closely with the other Operating Systems teams to build cross functional tools and support systems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's degree.
  • 5 years working in a large Windows environment (500+ clients); at least 2 years of Python coding experience.
  • Experience using and packaging software for delivery via SCCM/SMS.
  • Solid understanding of Active Directory, WSUS.
  • Strong networking fundamentals.

jobs.title: Wireless Systems Validation Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Wireless Systems Validation Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Wireless Systems Validation Engineer

As a Wireless Systems Engineer at Google, you be evaluating and testing novel wireless systems, working closely with the system design team and the business development team to ensure the delivered system is solid and good design tradeoffs have been made. You will study the proposed systems, understand the tradeoffs involved in the design, and contrast against other modern standard. With this understanding, you will design lab and field experiments to evaluate the system performance, provide feedback to the design team, and iterate on the tradeoffs. Finally, you will work with the business development to derive deployment scenarios.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate and compare the performance of wireless systems.
  • Design test scenarios and procedures to validate system performance, instrument and execute large scale wireless systems tests.
  • Develop metrics and ways to visualize system performance.
  • Manage, coordinate and conduct field testing exercises.
  • Analyze system performance, localize effects, and provide feedback to system designers.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS Degree in an engineering field. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience.
  • 2 years of experience deploying, testing, and evaluating wireless communications systems.
  • Mathematical background with a strong understanding of signal processing.
  • Ability to program (C++ or Python) and strong familiarity with Matlab or similar signal data analysis tools.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Masters Degree in EE or Physics
  • Aptitude for hands-on laboratory and field work with RF and digital hardware with experience deploying novel wireless systems.
  • Strong understanding of low level network protocols, 802.3 and 802.11 MACs etc., and some familiarity with WAN protocols such as GSM.
  • Experience with designing experiments to collect and measure data.

jobs.title: YouTube MySQL Database Administrator - Mountain View
jobs.content:
YouTube MySQL Database Administrator - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in San Bruno or Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Simply put, YouTube (a Google company) hires engineers that make computers do amazing things. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Engineering team gets excited by developing new applications that really make a difference and are used by millions of people. YouTube is the leader in online video, and the premier destination to watch and share original videos worldwide through a Web experience. YouTube allows people to easily upload and share video clips on www.youtube.com and across the Internet through websites, mobile devices, blogs and email.

The role: YouTube MySQL Database Administrator

The YouTube website is one of the highest traffic sites on the web, and our MySQL server farms play a big role in serving up all those pages. As a YouTube DBA, your efforts to monitor, automate and tune our systems means the site runs itself.

YouTube is an extremely team-oriented, creative workplace where every single employee has a voice in the choices we make and the features we implement. We work together in small teams to design, develop, and roll out key features and products in very short time frames. Your monitoring and maintenance work today, ensures the site is up and running tomorrow.

Responsibilities:

  • Write automation for hundreds of MySQL machines.
  • Make sure new data structures are clean and can be rolled to live systems.
  • Replicate, set up, fix, monitor and tune systems.
  • Initiate large DML updates on live systems (pushes/releases).
  • Perform benchmarking by understanding merits of the various MySQL forks/distros, choosing through real testing and analysis, then maintaining builds.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Experience with scripting languages.
  • MySQL and Linux experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years experience as DBA on any database technology and 2 years experience as MySQL DBA for a website.
  • Python experience.
  • IO tuning experience.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, able to create strong working relationship with cross-functional teams.
  • Willing to be on-call and carry a pager.
Apply now

jobs.title: Commodity Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Commodity Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Commodity Analyst

Commodity Managers work with Engineering teams to make sure Google has the supplies and equipment to put into production the innovative products coming from our Engineering teams. As a Commodity Manager, you use your wide industry knowledge and strategic supplier relationships to optimize our total cost of ownership for our global -- and growing -- infrastructure. The scale at which Google operates means that savings on just one piece of hardware can have a huge impact on Google's bottom line.

The Commodity team drives the supply chain that supports Google computing architecture including servers, storage, networking and data center infrastructure. Together, these powers all of Google's services. We are looking for high-energy, motivated individuals to join our team as a Commodity Analyst.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with commodity managers to manage the cost cycle, report quarterly metrics, and assist with Supplier Business Reviews (SBRs).
  • Develop financial models and contribute to the development of new metrics, processes and tools for continued improvement of Google's supply chain practices including cost reduction and cost avoidance opportunities.
  • Assist in the research, analysis and process development in support of Google's key supply chain goals and objectives.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA in industrial engineering, supply chain management, business > operations, or finance.  In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS/MBA in industrial engineering, supply chain management, business operations, and/or finance degree
  • 5 years of related work experience and proven positive impact within an operations and/or manufacturing environment
  • Well versed in common supply chain concepts and strategies
  • Business process and/or application configuration knowledge with a supply chain technology.
  • Strong analytical skills including high degree of competence with Excel, Visual Basic Programming.
  • Excellent problem solving abilities and thinking outside the box. Ability to successfully work across multiple levels of an organization. Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Apply now

jobs.title: Commodity Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Commodity Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Commodity Manager

As a Commodity Manager, you will be responsible for all aspects of supplier development and ongoing performance management to Google's cutting edge technology and business needs. You will develop and execute Google's material acquisition strategy and reduce total cost of ownership for Servers, Storage and Networking hardware in support of our infrastructure deployment that powers all of Google's services. As a seasoned professional, you will be expected to lead and participate on large projects as well as understand and resolve complex issues that put company objectives at risk. You will be a key part of an end-to-end supply chain team that drives continuous improvement and ensures operational excellence in support of Google's rapid growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop commodity strategies and execute on them.
  • Lead cross functional teams through robust supplier selection for new platforms.
  • Conduct high level negotiations and secure comprehensive agreements with supplier executives.
  • Maintain high level of industry expertise and supplier/market conditions.
  • Manage supplier performance to world class in Cost, Quality, Delivery and technology alignment. Implement “best in class” supply chain improvements.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years of commodity management or supply chain management experience in the high-tech industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Technical undergraduate with MBA or MS degree.
  • 10 years of commodity management or supply chain management experience in a high-tech industry.
  • Prior leadership or management experience.

jobs.title: EMC Design Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
EMC Design Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: EMC Design Engineer

Google is seeking an EMC Design Engineer in Platforms Engineering who will play a key role in the development of one of the world’s most impressive computing infrastructures! Your objective will be to collaborate closely with our Hardware Design Teams to develop, test and qualify products to be compliant with the relevant worldwide EMC standards and regulatory requirements. This will involve engaging with various disciplines (Electrical, Mechanical, Thermal, Power etc) as early as possible in the R&D cycle to ensure compliance by design rather than retrofit at a later time. In addition you will be required to ensure all formal product certification documentation and labeling is in place for all deployment jurisdictions.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with hardware design teams and suppliers to understand new project architectures and requirements and subsequently provide design input, develop test plans and conduct compliance testing to extract key data to validate that all EMC goals are met in accordance with the relevant regulatory standards and specifications.
  • Resolve complex non-compliant issues by the most efficient and cost effective methods. Ensure findings, risks and recommendations are clearly communicated to the various cross functional teams.
  • Co-ordinate the process of formal certification and subsequently maintain high quality product technical files and reports.
  • Cultivate good working relationships with customers, external suppliers, test labs and manufacturing partners.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in EE, preferred, M.S. or PhD in EMC or related discipline desirable.
  • At least 8 years hands-on EMC Design experience preferably with information Technology Equipment. Strong technical background and analytical knowledge of EMC and high speed design principles coupled with familiarity with a variety of software modeling tools.
  • Good general understanding of hardware design constraints and tradeoffs and an ability to find cost effective work-arounds where feasible. Ability to simultaneously investigate multiple avenues to solve problems.
  • Expert knowledge of international standards and procedures related to obtaining worldwide product certifications (e.g. FCC, CISPR, ICES, VCCI, etc.)
  • Familiarity with test equipment such as spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, LISN’s, network analyzers, current probes, etc.
  • Excellent understanding of product delivery lifecycles in a dynamic fast paced environment.
  • Strong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Apply now

jobs.title: Google TV Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Google TV Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: YouTube and Video

The first video posted on YouTube was a 19-second clip called "Me at the Zoo." Today, more than 48 hours of video are uploaded every minute. The YouTube and Video team helps budding filmmakers and musicians build careers, creates products like Google TV and YouTube Live and runs collaborative projects like Life in a Day and the YouTube Symphony Orchestra. We are leading a change in how we entertain, inform and share with one another, whether through cat videos or footage of a revolution in progress.

The role: Google TV Engineer

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies which have changed how millions interact, making accessible and useful the world's information. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search To handle information at the the scale of the web requires ideas from every areas of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and always eager to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.

The Google TV team is working on revolutionizing how people interact with their TVs, and looking for star engineers to make that a reality. We want to open up the living room to a new realm of possibilities, and transform how people perceive their TV's when Google services are available on that screen. From the moment the user enters the room to the time the TV is turned off, the Google TV software drives the experience and guide the user through the maze of increasingly available content and services.You will have opportunities to innovate in the exciting Internet-connected TV space. We are looking for engineers with a strong interest in user experience, a deep understanding of human/machine interaction, and most importantly a great thirst for redefining the whole TV space. We want engineers with strong coding and analytical skills to take ownership of one or more technical aspects of the project and turn ideas into reality. TVs have remained almost the same for more than 70 years. It's time that we re-invent them, so come and join us while we make TV history.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and implement new user-facing applications and services for the TV.
  • Work on large, distributed backend infrastructure to deliver to applications.
  • Explore and create innovative new ways to interacting with the TV.
  • Design developer-facing APIs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field. In lieu of degree, 10 years of relevant experience.
  • 4 years relevant work experience in software development, including experience in Java and/or C++.
  • Experience writing public APIs.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience developing/designing mobile or TV applications, or complex backend services.
  • Experience with Android (especially graphic intensive apps using OpenGL or RenderScript).
  • Strong interest in the TV space and a desire to redefine the TV experience.
Apply now

The area: Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Hardware Engineer

  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux or embedded environments.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Hardware Systems Architect, Platform, Google Fiber

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

As a hardware system architect for Google Fiber you will take the challenge to innovate novel hardware and system technologies to cost-effectively scale access network bandwidths beyond Gb/s per user, which is symmetric and sustainable. You will work with product management, development engineers and network engineers to define the next generation hardware platform for ultra-high speed fiber access systems. You will interact with internal and external organizations to ensure Google delivers the most scalable and cost effective access platform to satisfy the bandwidth requirements for emerging Internet applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Architectural design of low power and high density optical networking equipment.
  • Identify, research, evaluate emerging network hardware technologies.
  • Interact with product managers, network engineers and OSS/BSS software engineers to determine system interface requirements and implementation strategy.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MS in Electrical Engineering. In lieu of degree, 6 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in mass volume production designs.
  • Experience in telecommunication protocols.
  • Hands-on experience with enterprise class communication and computing equipment designs.
  • Strong experience of interaction with off-the-shelf networking SOC products.
  • Knowledge in DWDM and optical interfaces.
  • Knowledge in high speed and high density system architecture.
Apply now

The role: Hardware Test and Qualification Engineer

Play a key role in the development of one of the world's most impressive computing infrastructures! Our experienced Hardware Test and Qualification Engineers have backgrounds in servers, storage and/or networking technology.

As a Hardware Test and Qualification Engineer your objective will be to collaborate closely with Hardware and Software design teams to develop test plans and infrastructures that evaluate and characterize the performance of our cutting edge server, storage and networking platforms. In addition, you will develop test suites, performance monitoring and automation routines that continually evolve and improve the qualification processes to yield more efficient failure detection and prevention.

  • Strive for efficiency and efficacy in test execution, data gathering. data analysis, and reporting.
  • Cultivate good working relationships with customers, component suppliers and manufacturing to further quality goals.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in developing software tools for data organization, analysis, and visualization. For example, databases and web development tools.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's Degree.
  • Understanding of hardware evaluation methodologies, including development of test cases/suites, performance monitoring, test automation, and data analysis
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills together with demonstrated technical leadership and mentoring skills
  • Familiarity with Linux or other Unix operating systems as well as strong scripting and/or programming skills

jobs.content:
Machinist - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Machinist

Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

Responsibilities:

  • Operate and maintain manual, CNC, and wood working equipment in a lab environment.
  • Create, modify, and assemble unique systems which require turning, milling, sawing, drilling, welding and catalogue parts.
  • Design and create test fixtures, tooling, and other mechanisms needed to support R&D teams.
  • Create unique assemblies out of a wide variety of materials and parts.
  • Build a service that supports Google’s variety of development areas.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in relevant field (In lieu of degree, 4 years work experience).
  • 10 years equivalent experience programming and operating CNC equipment.
  • Experience with a broad set of materials and processes.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Expert with metal and wood shop tools, including lathes, mills, saws, grinders, sanders, drills, and various welding equipment.
  • Proficient with tolerance analysis, drawings, typical inspection equipment, and a CAD package such as ProE, AutoCAD, Solidworks Analytical and organizational skills, coupled with a focused attention to detail.

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Mechanical Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Mechanical Engineer

You must be a top notch mechanical engineer who will provide product design insight independently design future compute and networking products. The opportunities which come with creating our own world-class architecture are endless. You should have a unique challenge to participate as a technology leader in decisions affecting system design all the way up to datacenter deployment. You need to have both the technical knowledge and creativity to productize our next generation equipment with innovative solutions. The successful candidate must be at the level of a senior technologist with strong analysis and design skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and scope projects around innovation opportunities as well as technology risks.
  • Develop and execute designs for complex server systems backed by thorough engineering analysis.
  • Deliver robust solutions for tasks such as blind mating of high density interconnects, inject/eject mechanisms and large server racks.
  • Take responsibility for the productizing of large-scaled networked computer systems - including requirements gathering, concepts generation & detailed design, analysis & verification testing, cross functional reviews and manufacturing release.
  • Be a technical resource in multiple areas of product design such as thermal, structural, manufacturability, serviceability and reliability.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years work experience in design and analysis of electronics packaging.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Mechanical Engineering.
  • 6 years relevant work experience including designing complex electro-mechanical assemblies with an expert understanding of mechanical tolerances and ability to perform detailed tolerance loop analysis.
  • Sheet metal expertise along with excellent facility with 3D CAD systems (Pro/Engineer experience).
  • Well versed in the core mechanical engineering analytical skills, including excellent facility with structural and thermal analysis techniques for small to large electronics packaging systems (Flotherm and Mechanica experience).
  • Strong background in mechanical design of PCBAs and electrical interconnect systems.
  • Great analytical and organizational skills, coupled with a well-focused attention to details; ability and commitment to produce a timely and highly accurate work product.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Mechanical Engineer, System Architect - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Mechanical Engineer, System Architect

You must be at the level of a senior technologies with strong analysis and design skills. You will be a lead technical resource in all areas of product design such as thermal, structural, manufacturability, serviceability and reliability. You must be well versed in the core mechanical engineering analytical skills in order to affect system level decisions and represent the team at cross-functional reviews. Your ability to productize designs is also critical and you should be able to independently design electro-mechanical packaging means for large-scale networked computer systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect and influence the shaping of future products by providing mechanical engineering insight into the technology roadmap.
  • Identify and scope projects around innovation opportunities as well as technology risks.
  • Develop and execute designs for complex systems backed by thorough engineering analysis.
  • Deliver robust solutions for tasks such as blind mating of high density interconnects, inject/eject mechanisms and large server racks.
  • Take responsibility for product design, including requirements gathering, concepts generation and detailed design, analysis and verification testing, cross functional reviews and manufacturing release.

Requirements:

  • MS degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred, PhD is a plus. BS with strong equivalent work experience will be considered.
  • At least 10 years work experience in design and analysis of electronics packaging.
  • Extensive experience in designing complex electro-mechanical assemblies with an expert understanding of mechanical tolerances and ability to perform detailed tolerance loop analysis.
  • Excellent facility with 3D CAD systems (Pro/Engineer experience a plus) and structural and thermal analysis techniques for small to large electronics packaging systems (Flotherm and Ansys experience a plus).
  • Ability to architect solutions backed by business case analysis.
  • Excellent working knowledge of mechanical engineering and design principles with specific expertise in the areas of design for medium-scale production, sheet metal and injection molding, electrical interconnect systems, heat extraction and vibration control.
  • Strong problem solving and leadership skills.

The role: Network Test Development Engineer

As a Network Test Development Engineer at Google you will work closely with architecture, engineering and deployment teams to ensure the reliability of our production networks. If you have exceptional skills and experience in the area of testing network devices we have plenty of challenging projects for you. Network Test Development Engineers must have a broad range of technical knowledge specifically in networking hardware and software, and detailed knowledge of methodologies and tools for testing protocols, performance and regression.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with network and platforms engineers to develop and document test plans on network devices, execute those tests to plan, and document and present test results.
  • Design, develop, and document test frameworks and lab infrastructure to ensure that testing is thorough, consistent, and repeatable.
  • Advocate for excellent engineering practices by working with members of other teams within Production Network Operations to ensure systems are designed for reliability and testability.
  • Deploy network connectivity and hardware for engineering labs.
  • Work with and/or developing network monitoring and automation tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in a technical discipline (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of relevant industrial experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, particularly in documenting test methodologies and results.
  • Experience in utilizing specialized testing equipment (such as Ixia) and tools such as iperf, ttcp, dsniff, nmap.
  • Solid software development experience and current knowledge of ?C? and one or more of the following: C++, Perl, Python.
  • Experience with testing methodologies for the TCP/IP suite (e.g. ICMP, IP, TCP, UDP), Internet protocols (e.g. SNMP, Telnet, SSH, HTTP) and routing protocols (e.g. OSPF, ISIS, BGP, MPLS).

jobs.title: Platforms Build and Release Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Platforms Build and Release Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Technology Infrastructure

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technology Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

The role: Platforms Build and Release Engineer

As a Build & Release Engineer you'll use your strong technical and coding abilities and your understanding of complex systems to design, code and automate how Platforms builds and releases all the system software components. This requires scripting and coding with an eye toward scalability so that big deployments can be broken down and distributed across multiple data centers. You are a excited by massively complex systems and the challenges that come from working with some of the largest computing systems in the world. You'll work with developers, QA teams, and product managers to design and develop repeatable build and release processes to ensure that Platforms delivers quality systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, document and code an automated integration/build/test and release process.
  • Manage release branches.
  • Build and sanity test release binaries.
  • Maintain the build process to support ongoing R&D.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in software engineering, release engineering and/or configuration management.
  • Hands-on and direct experience with configuration management like Perforce, Git, or Subversion.
  • Proficient coding experience in languages like Python or Perl.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with build management tools (for example: make, scons, ant).
  • Experience building C, C++ and Java applications.
  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux system administration.

You will change the way people use Google and the Internet by enabling state of the art systems to be deployed quickly and reliably throughout our global fleet. jobs.title: Platforms Test Engineer - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Platforms Test Engineer - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Platforms Test Engineer

Platforms Test Engineers are experienced server systems engineers who are excited about taking a lead role in our world-class test team to define and execute component and system level tests and debug and root-cause issues with Google's proprietary server hardware and software infrastructure.

You will change the way people use Google and the Internet by enabling state of the art systems to be deployed quickly and reliably throughout our global fleet. You will need to have hands-on experience with component or system level testing. A positive attitude and a penchant for delivering top quality, technically complex products in a fast-paced environment is required.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop test strategies and test plans for new components and servers.
  • Write specifications for tests, test reporting automation and data analysis.
  • Execute tests and help root-cause issues working with hardware and software development teams.
  • Work with server development teams to improve test processes.
  • Gather feedback for and implement continuous test improvement.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of experience executing tests and automating test cases.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years of experience executing tests and automating test cases.
  • Deep knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases, and debugging.
  • Substantial knowledge of UNIX/Linux server architectures and networked system environments.
  • Strong distributed systems and architecture knowledge.
  • Knowledge of servers and network technologies.

jobs.title: Software Architect, Platform, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Software Architect, Platform, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: Software Architect, Platform, Google Fiber

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies which have changed how millions interact, making accessible and useful the world's information. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search To handle information at the the scale of the web requires ideas from every areas of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and always eager to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.

As software architect of the Advanced Technology Group in Google Fiber, you will join our world-class development team and work on feature and system design of next generation broadband network equipment and applications. You will help change the way people think about Google and the Internet. You will define the software to operate, configure and manage brand new IP and photonic networking equipment and consumer broadband technologies throughout this job.

Responsibilities:

  • Interface with lead system engineers, product management and network engineering group.
  • Define embedded and management software architecture for a scalable high-density communication platform.
  • Create detailed design specifications and APIs for internal and external developers.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or related engineering field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS or PhD in Computer Science.
  • Experience with optical network equipment software development.
  • Experience with OAM&P and FCAPS.
  • Knowledge of high availability software design.
  • Linux operating system and C/C++ programming.
Apply now

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems Test and Qualification - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Software Engineer, Embedded Systems Test and Qualification - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems Test and Qualification

Google develops and deploys one of the world's most impressive computing infrastructures. You will support developing this infrastructure by designing, building, and supporting test platforms as part of Google's world-class server team. The tools and infrastructure you build will be used in the qualification, testing, and maintenance of new hardware platforms and components Google is using to power its increasing portfolio of services. In this role you will be expected to both build and expand a sophisticated mixed-mode test infrastructure and to author tests for specific embedded systems. You will also collaborate closely with both hardware engineers and firmware developers is very important for this position.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement tests to stress and qualify micro-controller based firmware for a variety of embedded systems.
  • Use your software engineering experience to produce infrastructure to test Google platform products, and to develop and support multiple platform-specific tools.
  • Based on product specifications, use your expertise to design and build test systems to support new and existing hardware designs.
  • Collaborate closely with hardware engineers to design appropriate tests for specific classes of embedded systems.
  • Gather and address qualification and test requirements and drive issues to closure with preventive measures.

Requirements:

  • MS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent work experience).
  • At least 3 years of experience with test infrastructure or other relevant software development (including familiarity with Linux, Web technologies, and databases).
  • Strong programming skills in Python, HTML/Web programming, and C/C++.
  • Familiarity with hardware/software interaction facets of embedded systems.
  • Strong interest and excellent track record of test development for embedded systems.
  • Demonstrated skill and facility in the use of test equipment (including oscilloscopes, multimeters, power analyzers, etc.)
  • Experience with power delivery systems and interest to learn more is a plus.

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering, Platforms

Google's global deployment of custom-designed machines has created one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in existence: cutting-edge innovation on a huge scale. The Platforms team designs and builds the software, hardware, computing platform and networking technologies that power all of Google's services.

The role: Software Engineer, Performance Analysis and Tools

You are an engineer with an interest in performance analysis, benchmarking, and tool development. You will also be driving performance and reliability from the kernel level to system infrastructure at a massive scale. You will join our efforts towards building the world's most effective computing platform. We are particularly interested in individuals with a combination of interests in the areas of high performance software design and computer architecture.

Responsibilities:

  • Improve the performance of our code base by tackling performance debugging (at the single machine or data-center levels)

  • Expertise or strong interest in the following areas: performance debugging and optimization of complex workloads, design of performance tools, compiler design and code optimization, high-performance software development techniques, concurrent programming, and/or multi-core computer architectures.

jobs.title: System Verification Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View
jobs.content:
System Verification Engineer, Google Fiber - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Engineering and Operations

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

The role: System Verification Engineer, Google Fiber

Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Networking Test Engineer you make sure that our massive and growing network is operating at its peak potential. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.

As system verification engineer of the Advanced Technology Group in Google Fiber, you will join our world-class development team and work on feature and system level testing of next generation broadband network equipment and applications. You will help change the way people think about the Internet. You will have hands-on experience with networking equipment, and understanding of networking protocols, experience in testing, a background in IP network design, operations, or management, and a penchant for delivering top quality products. You will experience brand new broadband IP networking and consumer broadband technologies throughout this job and help to shape new broadband Internet content experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and execute test plans for networking features, equipment, and systems.
  • Work with developing test automation tools.
  • Certify software releases for general use.
  • Work with development teams to develop software and hardware systems.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or related engineering field. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience with standard L2/L3 protocols such as IGP, LACP, STP, RSTP, VRRP, UDLD, 802.1x, 802.1ad, PIM / IGMP, QoS, TCP/IP, Ethernet, and IPv6, etc.
  • Experience with IP video delivery system and test methodologies.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MS in Computer Science.
  • Experience in supporting, implementing and/or designing networks.
  • Experience in Linux.
  • C/C++ and scripting skills.

jobs.title: Technical Advisor, Patents and Patent Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Advisor, Patents and Patent Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for tackling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you tackle unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

The role: Technical Advisor, Patents and Patent Strategy

Our Patent team is an invigorating, inspiring team of innovators and attorneys who are passionate about future technologies and excited about resolving their ensuing legal challenges. As a member of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to develop and implement Google's strategy to protect, defend and capture the value of its patents. You dive into varied and interesting tasks that include patent-related protection, licensing, dispute resolution (pre-litigation and litigation), acquisition, deals and policy work. You will work with engineers, product developers, executives and other legal team members, and will be responsible for managing outside counsel.

Responsibilities:

  • Draft claim charts and conduct technical product analysis
  • Research emerging product technologies
  • Evaluate patent portfolios for strategic relevance
  • Identify patenting opportunities
  • Advise on patent strategy and policy development

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 5 years experience working as a scientist or engineer in a company or research organization focusing on software or other information technologies
  • Experience in technical analysis for one or more of the following areas of patent practice: litigation, licensing, acquisitions, due diligence, portfolio development
  • Significant computer programming experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's Degree or higher in Engineering or related field
  • 5 years experience working on application integration or system integration solutions
  • 3 years experience designing and implementing Web, cloud or similar high scale computing solutions
  • Expertise in designing distributed computing systems.
  • Experience in claim chart development.
