jobs.content:
Finance Operations Project and Process Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance Operations

With the end goal of providing the highest levels of service and efficiency at the lowest attainable cost, the FinOps team designs and executes Google's core finance transaction processes. These include order-to-cash, payroll, procure-to-pay and travel.

The role: Finance Operations Project and Process Analyst

As a project and process analyst within one of several teams within Finance Operations, you will analyze large data sets to identify new opportunities and execute projects for increasing revenue, helping obtain better value from suppliers and partners, or paying our employees as we continue to grow and expand around the world.

You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders (e.g., sales, product management, engineering, customers and vendors) to deliver best-in-class automated invoicing, payment, and disbursement processes for our global customer, supplier, and employee base.

You will play a key role in improving Google’s cash flow and profitability by seeking scalable, cost- efficient solutions and by minimizing the impact of operational issues. You will be implementing effective performance monitoring, escalation and resolution management, and driving continuous process improvement.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with key stakeholders, engineering and vendors to improve complex financial processes, perform effective escalation management and provide “quick fix” solutions.
  • Provide customer feedback analysis, operational monitoring, troubleshooting and error resolution to prevent inaccuracies, reduce process latency and drive process excellence.
  • Provide performance reporting and analysis to senior management.
  • Manage outsourced operational activity, including Service Level Agreements, performed by third party vendors.
  • Ensure tax, Sarbanes Oxley and local entity compliance; ensure readiness on supporting new and existing functionality.

Requirements:

  • BS/BA preferred in Business, Accounting or Operations with a strong academic record. Masters degree a plus.
  • At least 4 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with enterprise applications and strong Excel skills
  • Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment, and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives
  • Superior analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with seasoned management
  • Collaborative working style and ability to work with vendors and international teams

With the end goal of providing the highest levels of service and efficiency at the lowest attainable cost, the FinOps team designs and executes Google's core finance transaction processes. These include order-to-cash, payroll, procure-to-pay and travel.

The role: Supplier Payment Operations Process and Project Analyst

At Google we spend billions of dollars with suppliers every year. We buy hardware, software, professional services, manage facilities around the world, use various technology services, and provide benefits for our staff. Our team strives to design operational tools and processes to support these payments with the end goal of providing the highest level of service and efficiency at the lowest attainable cost.

In this role, you will analyze current procure-to-pay processes and tools and meet with critical stakeholders to identify and execute key projects to improve our operations. You will help set the overall strategy, vision, and priorities for the team in conjunction with the Manager of Global Supplier Payment Operations balancing quality of service, efficiency of operations, compliance with corporate polices, and other Finance objectives. You will work directly with our talented software engineers as well as other key teams (Accounting, Purchasing, Treasury, Mergers & Acquisitions) to continuously enhance our processes and tools. You will also work with key internal stakeholders to understand and adapt our processes and tools to their ever changing needs.

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Supplier Sourcing Specialist

The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.

Responsibilities:

  • Get smart about Google’s key purchasing requirements, including how our sourcing strategy aligns with broader business strategies.
  • Collaborate with the wider supplier sourcing team to produce, implement, and support sourcing strategies that ensure best value.
  • Conduct solicitations for and execute against high-dollar, high-risk, complex procurements, corporate wide. Identify opportunities for increased competitive bidding, smarter supplier relationships and more efficient finance processes.
  • Pro-actively conduct market analysis / benchmarking, track market trends and emerging technologies, and develop metrics to manage supplier performance. Conduct competitive bidding using a multi step sourcing process and utilization of e-auctions. 
  • Develop and manage supplier portfolios and undertake supplier negotiations through relationship-building to maximize business benefits. Serve as a thought leader to Finance and the rest of the organization for the strategic sourcing of the categories for which they are responsible.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 8 years relevant work experience, including experience in procurement/supplier management at a global public company.
  • Demonstrated skills in rigorous, fact-based analyses that drive creative problem solving, proposal preparation, and negotiation.
  • Strong leadership qualities including effective interpersonal, team building and project management skills.
  • Persuasive written and verbal communication skills coupled with strong multi-tasking and organizational capabilities, with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Commitment to continuous improvement, motivated 'can-do' attitude, and results-oriented.
  • Team player with a positive attitude who can work with international teams.

jobs.content:
Finance Manager, Global Sales Analytics - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Finance Manager, Global Sales Analytics

Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

You are both a manager and a mentor, providing financial leadership and analytical support to partners of the core Finance team as well as giving your own team the support they need to become financial gurus. You'll keep senior management informed on key financial metrics and work to improve financial operation practices throughout your region.

In this role, you will develop a deep understanding of Global Sales at Google and will act as a business partner to Google sales executives. You will be responsible for understanding the operational structure of various businesses across regions, products and channels, and your team will be the key point of contact with sales leaders on issues relating to budgeting, resource allocation, market investment strategies and revenue growth. You are a well-rounded top performer who will be a key contributor in a high-energy, high-growth environment and have a strong foundation in Finance. You have excellent data analysis skills and experience managing analytical teams. You should be able to perform deep dives into the underlying assumptions and quantitative details of all analyses, and perhaps most importantly, you are able to communicate your team’s findings to senior management in a clear and concise manner.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide decision support to sales management through creation of decision tools, models, and ad hoc analysis.
  • Lead cross-functional projects partnering with finance, business operations, and global sales operations.
  • Run the central annual planning process, creating an integrated business plan across the organization.
  • Assist in creation of reporting and dashboards on business health for executive review.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree or relevant degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics, economics or finance.
  • MBA.
  • Strong experience writing SQL queries and pulling data from relational databases is a good to have.
  • Strong excel and power-point skills

jobs.content:
Financial Analyst, Data Center Hosting Business - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance, Technical Infrastructure, Data Centers

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. We're diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers working on a daily basis to develop data centers that are changing the face of contemporary computing facilities.

The role: Financial Analyst, Data Center Hosting Business

You will provide business operations and decision support analysis for our data center hosting business leaders. This includes (but is not limited to): “buy vs build” analysis; competitive intelligence and external benchmarking programs; establishment of the appropriate key performance indicators and respective targets. In summary, you will provide leadership to realize continuous improvement on the application of analytical methodologies to leverage efficiencies and economies of scale and drive the organization to achieve lowest overall opex costs in the industry.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic, analytical support for all business intelligence activities for Google’s Data Centers / Hosting business.
  • Use your business acumen and industry knowledge to develop and deliver Competitive Intelligence and Business Analytics.
  • Own and manage multiple benchmarking initiatives and drive programs both regularly and an ad-hoc basis to help achieve world-class hosting operating expenses.
  • Work with engineering and operations colleagues to help shape and drive the tactical and strategic development of Google’s data center hosting business analytics and decision support models.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent with emphasis in a quantitative discipline such as finance, economics, statistics, or engineering. M.B.A. or other postgraduate degree a plus.
  • At least 5 years of analytical work experience in high data volume environments, preferably in software, internet, media or telecoms industries.
  • Demonstrated experience and strong track record in developing and delivering reporting and analysis in a demanding business environment.
  • Demonstrated superior performance in prior roles with increasing levels of responsibility and independence; demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and to lead and drive complex operational and strategic initiatives.
  • Exemplary oral and writing communication skills with a demonstrated track record of effectively partnering with technical, business, and operations colleagues.

As a Financial Analyst, you are responsible for coordinating financial planning and month-end closes for Corporate Engineering, Research, and Infrastructure teams at Google. This is a diverse area which includes Google’s IT organization, infrastructure that supports Google’s products, and our growing Cloud Platforms offering. You will analyze financial and operational information, develop insights based on this analysis, and communicate these insights to senior decision makers. Your analyses will provide transparency into business activities, helping to improve forecasting accuracy and drive efficiencies and consistency throughout these Engineering organizations. A successful candidate is expected to drive attention to detail while understanding the larger picture, and make recommendations based upon ambiguous or incomplete data.

  • Act as liaison between the core Finance team and the Research and Systems Infrastructure teams, assisting with issues related to forecasting, planning, resource prioritization and operational efficiencies
  • Build robust analyses and models to drive cost efficiencies, identify and monitor value metrics, and influence purchasing processes to ensure financial stability and predictability
  • Produce weekly, monthly and quarterly expense and headcount management reports, highlighting key insights and levers for the leadership team

Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. Also, you will have the opportunity to bring innovation and creativity to solve new challenges such as how we think about solution selling and cross product optimization. Our ideal candidate is a well-rounded top performer who can be a key contributor in a high-energy growth environment and is interested in building a career in Finance. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

jobs.title: Financial Analyst, Network Strategic Planning - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Financial Analyst, Network Strategic Planning - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Operations and IT, Global Infrastructure

When we're not planning and designing our next secret data center, we focus on selecting, negotiating for and acquiring the space, power and networks to expand Google's global reach. Our team works closely with strategic vendors worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.

The role: Financial Analyst, Network Strategic Planning

You will drive cross-functional projects, optimizing of one of the world's most impressive network infrastructures. You will develop fundamental models for network scaling and resource planning strategies. You will collaborate with all organizational levels to optimize planning, forecast, and manage the growth of Google's network capacity around the globe. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google as a bandwidth and networking business, and absorb and process insane amounts of technical background and data while guiding the build on one of the most impressive network infrastructures in the world. You will be expected to be equally comfortable proposing financial strategies to the CFO or discussing the technical and financial trade-offs involved in network design and deployment strategies. You will develop an innate understanding of the Google network and underlying economic fundamentals enabling you to quantify and guide the team between reducing operating costs and enabling agility for the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Develop infrastructure management and operational strategies to optimize use of network resources – create work plans, gather and synthesize.
  • Perform operational forecasting and capacity planning.
  • Identify delivery metrics and drive initiatives to improve the efficiency, quality and cost of inventory management to scale with the growth of Google.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent with emphasis in a quantitative discipline such as finance, economics, statistics, or engineering. M.B.A. or other postgraduate degree a plus.
  • Prior supply chain or network/data center operations analytics experience is highly valued.
  • Proven capability in effectively managing the product-life-cycle and its financial impacts.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills. Clear focus under pressure.
  • Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Apply now

jobs.title: Financial Analyst, People Operations - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Financial Analyst, People Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance, Financial Planning and Analysis

In addition to assisting business leaders throughout the company with all finance-related matters, the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) organization is also consistently looked upon to provide analytical perspectives to important strategic decisions. Our mandate is to design, implement and manage the processes that support business needs. This includes developing financial forecasts and analyses, generating internal management reports, monitoring key performance indicators and driving the scaling and automation of financial processes. We also provide decision support and conduct financial reviews of a wide range of business issues from deal analysis to data center rollouts.

The role: Financial Analyst, People Operations

In this role, you will be part of a team responsible for providing global Finance support to Google’s People Operations executives. You will assist in managing a significant amount of operating expenses across organizations like Staffing, Benefits, and Learning & Development. You will work in close partnership with senior management to provide decision making support related to investments and resource allocation, and deliver in-depth reporting and analysis. In doing this you will learn core budgeting, forecasting and financial review processes and will gain invaluable experience in this role which offers the opportunity to become a trusted strategic advisor to People Operations executives, who manage and direct much of what we do to make Google a “Googley” place to work. You must be an organized self-starter with an innate entrepreneurial bend and client-service orientation.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as primary business partner to Directors responsible for multiple teams
  • Lead budgeting, planning, and financial management activities for clients
  • Spearhead the effort to reduce results variability, analyzing root causes and driving forecasting improvements
  • Analyze research data and synthesize raw information into insights and recommendations
  • Assist in developing value-add analysis to inform the best possible business decisions on major investment areas; work with business leadership to define and track key metrics

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 6 years of relevant work experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • People management experience
  • Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured environment
  • Excellent analytical, communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to persuade others through disciplined use of data
  • Exceptional dexterity with presentation and spreadsheet tools
Apply now

jobs.content:
Capital Markets Analyst, Foreign Exchange - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Capital Markets Analyst, Foreign Exchange

Google’s Foreign Exchange team is a world-class finance organization tasked with developing innovative solutions to manage Google’s worldwide currency risk. As a Capital Markets Analyst, you will work with cross-functional teams to support Google’s growing hedge programs and have a significant impact on the company’s financial performance. As a key contributor in a dynamic work environment you will have significant responsibility as well as considerable opportunity to add innovative ideas to an evolving Finance organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform analyses to identify, evaluate, and forecast global foreign exchange exposures
  • Develop effective hedging solutions based on business and market conditions Implement hedge strategies by trading foreign currency derivatives across multiple execution platforms
  • Monitor derivatives portfolios and performance against benchmarks
  • Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams and external counterparties to formulate, execute, and assess effectiveness of hedge strategies

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • 1 year of relevant work experience from a leading investment bank, corporate finance or consulting team

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Finance, Math or related quantitative field
  • Exceptionally organized and detail oriented with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced dynamic environment
  • Superior analytical and problem solving skills with a penchant for creative and innovative solutions
  • Highly effective interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Financial Analyst, Corporate Finance

Google's Treasury team is on a mission to optimize the return on Google's financial assets. As a member of this team, you're always looking for innovative ways to help Google invest for the future while limiting volatility and material surprises. In addition to risk busting and asset management, you work collaboratively to administer business insurance programs and stock programs, and provide financial analysis support to our internal teams. You make creative yet calculated decisions that are backed by both experience and your extensive knowledge of the economy and financial industry.

- Google Treasury is building a world-class corporate finance organization to provide creative solutions to complex financial issues. The ideal candidate is one who has been a top academic performer with a proven track record and who has the desire to learn and excel in everything they do. Your work history should demonstrate job stability with increasing levels of responsibility. Analyst will report to the Assistant Treasurer responsible for Corporate Finance.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide and execute analysis on valuation and structures in support of Google merger, acquisition and investment activities
  • Work collaboratively across Google to develop and advance sophisticated, quantitative analyses that translates internal and external data into actionable insights
  • Develop financing strategies for new initiatives as required. Model and execute synthetic cash transactions related to acquisitions
  • Partner with internal teams to prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual forecast of corporate cash performance
  • Support Google Capital Markets and Alternative Investment activities Support Google Alternative Investment activities

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably engineering, computer science, mathematics, economics, or finance. (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience)
  • 2 years of experience in investment banking or corporate treasury

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA
  • Team player with a positive attitude
  • Detail oriented, versatile, innovative and creative
  • Superior knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Understanding of VBA and Macros, Data Modeling and Statistical analysis
  • Strong organizational and time management skills

jobs.title: Financial Auditor, Treasury - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Financial Auditor, Treasury - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Financial Auditor, Treasury

Internal Auditors ensure that Google's financial reports are as accurate and precise as our algorithms. As part of the Audit team, you'll develop and manage internal financial audits, working to identify any issues and solve problems at the root cause. You'll help Google managers understand how the audit function supports our overall business objectives, and train them to plan for and scope internal audits and risk assessments through an established process. You'll be on top of deadlines and will create scalable reporting systems to communicate results of audits to both internal audiences and regulatory compliance agencies. You have a hands-on, tactical approach for resolving issues, and an eye for detail ensures that everything is balanced at the end of the day.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute financial and operating audit programs primarily in the treasury and equity processes, including SOX audits, operational process reviews, fraud review, and review of system implementations and other IT related risk areas.
  • Interpret the significance of audit findings, conclude on findings and make practical recommendations.
  • Prepare audit reports to document audit scope, procedures, findings and recommendations and manage work requirements and budget to meet assigned initiatives.
  • Follow-up on audit recommendations, including consulting on process improvements, system implementations and follow-up audits.
  • Communicate with and educate process owners, including non-finance individuals, on the importance of controls, an effective control environment, and the role of Corporate Audit.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting or related field. In lieu of degree, 6 years of relevant work experience.
  • CPA/CA and 6 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working for financial service institutions and familiar with treasury related processes and technical accounting standards.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with a wide variety of departments.
  • Ability to multi-task, plan, execute and deliver on projects in a timely manner.
  • Leadership skills (ability to take charge, confidence to interact with all levels, set objectives, drive results, and a team player).
  • Ability to work in a fast paved environment and the ability to tolerate ambiguity.

jobs.title: Lead Treasury Risk Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Lead Treasury Risk Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance, Tax and Treasury

Google's Tax and Treasury teams consist of strong, creative performers with deep expertise in their respective fields. We contribute to our company's growing global success by dealing with challenging issues and concepts and then applying them to rapidly evolving business models. In Treasury, we provide funding, risk management and mitigation support as well as investment oversight. The Tax group is responsible for global tax planning and compliance, defending the company in tax audits, and ensuring that the company accurately reports its tax matters in public filings.

The role: Lead Treasury Risk Analyst

As the Treasury Risk Analyst, you will synthesize financial theory, quantitative techniques, and systems expertise to help the Treasury team define, measure, and ultimately manage its daily financial risk-taking. In addition to performing deep, thoughtful analysis and transforming the results into mission critical systems, you will be challenged to distill and communicate the essence of your technical work to audiences of all levels and formulate robust, actionable recommendations. As your scope will span multiple markets and wide-ranging instruments, you will be exposed to many different aspects of the financial risk management process.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for all ongoing foreign exchange (FX) risk-related reporting (both regular and ad hoc).
  • Oversee ongoing monitoring, tracking, and analysis of all applicable FX risk systems and metrics.
  • Drive modeling support to FX team.
  • Responsible for research and development of proprietary FX analytics.
  • Develop risk budgeting framework for various hedging programs (e.g., balance sheet and income statement)

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 2 years experience in capital markets and statistical analysis.
  • Familiarity in VBA, database programming, Bloomberg and/or Reuters.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4 years of experience.
  • Affinity for developing innovative financial solutions.
Apply now

jobs.title: Sales, Use and Property Tax Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Sales, Use and Property Tax Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Finance

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team. Whether designing processes to support our global businesses, providing forward-thinking analysis or managing our day-to-day balance sheets, our seasoned accounting and finance pros create innovative solutions to a googol of challenges and keep our business on track.

The role: Sales, Use and Property Tax Manager

Google's in-house tax team knows all things corporate tax. Made up of smart, perceptive Googlers with a flair for domestic, international and sales & use tax, the knowledge and expertise of this team runs deep. You have years of experience in this field and a knowledge of those tax issues most relevant to internet companies. While we don't give our Googlers individual tax advice, you make it easy for Googlers to get what they need to make good tax decisions. You find ways to work smarter by streamlining and automating our tax processes and systems, and find ways to be both innovative and compliant.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage sales and use tax and personal property tax audits; work with sales tax analyst and outside consultants on providing timely responses to auditor’s information requests; proactively evaluate potential tax exposure, develop and implement audit strategies and maintain successful auditor relationships; provide timely communication of audit results to management; develop and support sales and use tax positions.
  • Partner with merger and acquisition team on review of due diligence work for sales, use and property tax matters; work with various business units on the integration of acquired companies; provide technical advice to business units on sales and use taxation matters.
  • Manage the personal property tax return preparation process by working with the internal fixed asset team and outside property tax consultants; identify and implement improvements in the personal property tax process; conduct tax research on sales tax matters and identify potential areas of tax risk.
  • Recommend changes to internal procedures and guidelines to ensure compliance, enhance efficiency and minimize tax expense; assist in the development of internal tax policies, procedures and manual.
  • Participate in the evaluation of reporting components of tax and accounting systems, software and compliance tools and recommend and implement improvements to systems and procedures; determination of tax treatments arising from sales of new products and new business initiatives.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance. (In lieu of degree, 8 years relevant experience in sales, use and property tax.)
  • 6 years advanced relevant work experience in sales, use and property tax working in a public accounting firm, law firm or a corporate tax department.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • CPA.
  • Knowledge of Vertex sales tax systems or similar sales tax software.
  • Detail oriented, superior analytical skills.
  • Ambitious, self-motivated with a strong interest in indirect taxes.
  • Must be adaptable, demonstrate flexibility to changing task priorities and work situations.
  • Excellent research, verbal and written communication skills; customer service oriented and a team player.

jobs.content:
Access Field Development Principal - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google.org

Google.org uses Google's strengths in information and technology to address global challenges and make a lasting impact. We seek innovative solutions and entrepreneurial approaches to issues such as crisis response, education, and access to technology.

The role: Access Field Development Principal

The Google.org Access Development team's objective is to bring broadband to emerging markets in a financially sustainable and scalable way to impact hundreds of millions of people. The group focuses on developing business models, regulation and technology to support these goals. There is a strong emphasis on bringing new technologies or new ways to use technologies to solve the access challenges in these markets. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for defining and implementing access projects in emerging markets, as well as identifying and incubating promising technological solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive project execution of access projects in the developing world
  • Set up and launch projects including doing deals and managing vendors and logistics. This includes living in developing world locations for more that 6 months at a time
  • Perform other startup activities including putting in place management teams, working with regulators to get licenses and approvals
  • Establish and maintain relationships with customers, vendors and regulators
  • Act as a bridge between the project in the field and Google offices

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Engineering or Computer Science (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)

jobs.content:
Acquisition Integration Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Corporate Development

In Corporate Development, we focus on Google's worldwide growth by determining appropriate acquisitions and investments -- and then executing and integrating them. Our teams consist of experienced merger-and-acquisition leaders and deal integrators dedicated to identifying, acquiring and integrating Google's products of tomorrow.

The role: Acquisition Integration Manager

The Acquisition Integration Manager in Corporate Development is an experienced professional who will be responsible for the integration of acquisitions worldwide, coordinating with each of our functional teams to ensure that short-term and long-term strategic objectives for our acquisitions are achieved. You are able to motivate and inspire large and diverse teams, manage multiple projects on a real-time basis, and identify and resolve operational and integration challenges.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with Engineering, Product and Corporate Development teams in early deal stages to develop comprehensive integration plan.
  • Lead cross-functional teams to execute integration plans.
  • Work with Corporate Development team in continuing efforts to develop process.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 5 years pre-merger and post-merger integration, operational, consulting or corporate development experience in the technology industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or other advanced degree.
  • 10 years relevant work experience.
  • Experience in software, internet or media industries.

jobs.title: Corporate Development Manager - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Corporate Development Manager - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA

The area: Corporate Development

The Corporate Development team guarantees Google's worldwide growth by identifying the appropriate acquisitions and investments -- and then working to make them happen. Consisting of experienced merger-and-acquisition leaders and integration experts, we're dedicated to identifying the business opportunities of tomorrow. We find and evaluate acquisition opportunities across existing and future markets, drive management team decisions, lead deal negotiations, and help manage post-acquisition integration and performance evaluation.

The role: Corporate Development Manager

The Corporate Development team holds the reigns to much of our worldwide growth. As a member of the Corporate Development team, you work collaboratively across functions (including Legal, Finance and People Operations) to identify and evaluate both acquisition and investment opportunities. You provide the management team with the needed insight to drive intelligent, sound decision-making. You understand the industry landscape and harness it to manage our deals and integration. With an air of humility, you bring strong quantitative skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment, along with the ability to think about what is -- and what could be.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and evaluate acquisition opportunities.
  • Drive management team decisions.
  • Support deal execution.
  • Manage post-acquisition integration.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years relevant work experience in corporate development, venture capital, private equity or investment banking experience in the technology industry.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or other advanced degree.
  • 10 years relevant work experience.
  • Internet, communications or e-commerce experience.
  • Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.

jobs.title: Head of Global Commerce Sales Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Head of Global Commerce Sales Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: New Business Development

At Google, we set ourselves goals we know we can't reach yet. Our New Business Development team works on game-changing ideas, from technological experiments to the expansion of existing businesses into new territories. We're a team of technologists, entrepreneurs and leaders with an eye for what's next, working across Google to develop products and ideas that revolutionize the way people connect with information.

The role: Head of Global Commerce Sales Strategy

As the leader of the Commerce Sales Strategy and Operations team, you will provide project leadership, business judgment, analytic guidance and business experience in leading sales strategy projects and tactical initiatives for Commerce globally. You will build strong relationships with sales, product, marketing and finance to create a strategy and business plan to commercialize commerce and local product offerings. You have demonstrated top deciles performance in a blue chip consulting or similar environment and have graduated with outstanding academic performance. You are a self-starter with a can-do attitude who isn’t afraid to roll your sleeves up. You can work in a rapidly changing industry, tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight. This role has a lot of exposure to senior sales and product leadership and would be great for any person who has a desire to gain a solid understanding of all aspects of the nexus between sales and product.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a small team that completes high impact projects, which span our global sales commerce organization and are sponsored by the Director, Commerce & Local Product Sales Solutions
  • Analyze and design sales related business elements for potential/experimental businesses while working jointly with product and engineering teams.
  • Develop product commercialization strategies and build out business plans for sales execution of new products across commerce sales.
  • Perform sales specific work related to M&A such as Sales organization design and post acquisition integration.
  • Lead sales transformational projects that typically span across sales regions, channels or front-line business functions (for example customer segmentation, performance improvement efforts, new opportunity identification, pilots/incubation, etc). Manage short, bespoke ‘analysis & design’ strategy projects.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 8 years of relevant experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience managing high-performing teams and a demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives, with experience interacting with senior-level executives.
  • Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills and impeccable business judgment.
  • Deep understanding of the SMB sales segment and high volume sales environments
  • Demonstrated ability to work cross functionally with product, sales, marketing and finance by bringing a deep understanding towards high-tech products development and value creation
  • Strong creativity and innovation in discovering actionable results and strategies and ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment.

jobs.title: Legal Operations Analyst - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Legal Operations Analyst - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for tackling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you tackle unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

The role: Legal Operations Analyst

Our Legal team needs more than attorneys to keep things moving. Our Legal Operations team is charged with improving and maintaining the Legal team's internal processes, systems and tools. Responsible for tracking objectives, coordinating financial planning and solving technology challenges, you are entrepreneurial, proactive and highly organized. You keep costs down, engage third-party vendors and make the Legal team's services better, faster and more efficient.

Google has an immediate need for a Legal Operations Analyst who can help establish and maintain a comprehensive metrics program for the Legal Team, with a strong focus on outside counsel management, financial oversight, sourcing, operational efficiency and compliance. The operations analyst is a key member of the operations team supporting data management, client reporting, and problem resolution. This person will work closely with our corporate engineering (IT) team and the other members of the operations team to ensure integrity of the data systems. This position requires strong computer skills, attention to detail, positive professional attitude, and ability to work in a team environment. Entrepreneurial, proactive and highly organized, the ideal candidate has a unique combination of business savvy and prior experience in the legal field, with a good understanding of how corporate legal departments or law firms work.

Responsibilities:

  • Support legal management team in monitoring their global spending, including: leveraging best practices across legal functions and collaborating closely with senior Legal Operation managers and Finance to develop and produce regular reporting that drives increased financial visibility/ accountability and operational efficiency.
  • Respond to ad hoc reporting requests.
  • Development of financial and operational analyses that help determine resource allocation in terms of both dollars and headcount.
  • Support management of all aspects of legal vendor relationships, including: engagement, budget approval and management, benchmarking/reporting, and performance reviews.
  • Perform regular reconciliation and/or cleanup of systems and data.  Identifying workflow/system improvements and working with the operations and corporate engineering teams to enact changes.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • B.A. or B.S. degree. In lieu of education, 4 years of relevant experiences.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Good basic understanding of financial management principles, preferably in the context of a law firm or corporate legal department.
  • Proactive, entrepreneurial approach to recognizing needs, solving problems, anticipating issues, and developing solutions; excellent business judgment and strategic thinking.
  • Significant experience working with and designing relational databases, importing and exporting data, and producing easy to read reports.
  • Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage several projects simultaneously, manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines.
  • Expert Excel and PowerPoint skills; experience with Business Objects a plus.
Apply now

jobs.title: Access Development Associate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Access Development Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google.org

Google.org uses Google’s strengths in information and technology to address global challenges and make a lasting impact. We seek innovative solutions and entrepreneurial approaches to issues such as crisis response, education, and access to technology.

The role: Access Development Associate

The Google.org Access Development team's objective is to bring broadband to emerging markets in a financially sustainable and scalable way to impact hundreds of millions of people. The group focuses on developing business models, regulation and technology to support these goals. There is a strong emphasis on bringing new technologies or new ways to use technologies to solve the access challenges in these markets. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for defining and implementing access projects in emerging markets, as well as identifying and incubating promising technological solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify/evaluate opportunities. Develop insightful recommendations on how Google.org can help bring access to the developing world..
  • Perform analysis and research, of technical and business issues associated with potential project ideas.
  • Build compelling case for projects that will motivate executives. Advocate/champion projects with executives.
  • Incubate projects: Find creative ways to structure and launch projects. Identify and marshal internal and external resources to get project traction.
  • Drive project execution: Ensure mature projects are well organized, staffed and delivering on desired goals.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Engineering (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years work experience related to wireless or wireline communication as vendor, operator, or strategic consultant in the field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or Master's in Technology.
  • 2 years of experience at a management consulting firm
  • Strong analytical skills and experience. Current on wireless/wireline telecommunications technology and industry/public policy. Ability to structure ambiguous problems, work independently and focus on the end product/results. Proven track record of entrepreneurial activity in creating and scaling projects.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Access Strategy Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Access Strategy Team

The Access Strategy Team drives the access strategy for Google, seeking the creation of more and faster broadband pipes, preserving the openness of the wired Internet and bringing the open ethos of the wired Internet to the wireless world. In partnership with teams across the company, the team develops products, makes strategic investments and influences public policy to achieve these goals.

The role: Access Strategy Associate

As a member of the Access Strategy team you will be responsible for defining and implementing projects that foster Google's broader goals of open, low-cost, fast and ubiquitous wired and wireless access to the Internet. The role involves both selection, coordination, and execution of access related initiatives based on a deep understanding of the access industry eco-system, access technologies, and Google's business needs. You will leverage strong technical and analytical skills to develop strategic insights, evaluate new opportunities, and develop actionable plans. You will work cross functionally within Google, coordinating with policy, product and other groups to drive execution of access initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify/evaluate opportunities. Develop insightful recommendations on strategic direction and specific project opportunities that can move the needle in the access industry.
  • Perform analysis and research, of technical and business issues associated with potential product ideas or strategic investments.

  • Build compelling case for projects that will motivate executives. Advocate/ champion projects with executives.

jobs.title: Associate Business Analyst, Commerce Merchant Solutions - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Associate Business Analyst, Commerce Merchant Solutions - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: New Products, Media and Platforms

The New Products, Media and Platforms (NPMP) group is the link between Product and Sales at Google. NPMP helps take product innovations and turns them into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of their spend with Google. NPMP team members ensure we have the right commercial strategy for our products and bring product expertise to Sales, enabling front-line Sales partners to sell effectively and quickly. We are passionate about all things digital and want to shape the ever-changing world of online advertising and commerce.

The role: Associate Business Analyst, Commerce Merchant Solutions

The role of Business Analyst will be responsible for ensuring optimal performance for both Google’s partners and Google. You will perform market level analysis on the portfolio of partners to ensure optimization of revenue, based on factors including schedules, pricing, traffic, categorical volume mix etc. This role reports to the Market Manager who manages a portfolio of markets. You will also work closely with other business functions including Sales, Operations, Account Management, Marketing and Product.

Responsibilities:

  • Optimize revenue for a local region by analyzing factors such as schedules, pricing, traffic, categorical volume mix etc
  • Maintain high deal quality in the assigned region through rigorous deal vetting process
  • Perform revenue forecasting, calendar planning, and recommend strategies to scale growth in the local market
  • Partner with the commerce operations team to drive efficiency in business operations through process/ system improvements

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience.
  • 1 year work experience in management consulting, banking, brand management or the high tech

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced level of proficiency in MS Excel and Powerpoint
  • Highly analytical, with a demonstrated track record of strong problem solving and quantitative skills, capable of translating analytical insights into business strategies and actions
  • Strong creativity and innovation in discovering actionable results and strategies and ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment

jobs.title: Associate, Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Associate, Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Business and Operations Strategy

The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational, and organizational improvements across the company. Founded in 2003, BizOps is a high-profile, high-impact team working with Google's businesses across the globe. BizOps works on a range of critical projects and issues -- from growth strategies for exciting products like YouTube, Chrome, and Mobile; to engineering prioritization and global sales force alignment; to partner development and strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India. As a member of the BizOps team, you are at the forefront in helping Google clarify fast-moving strategic priorities, tackle operational challenges, and enable innovation.

The role: Associate, Business Operations and Strategy

Google’s leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

As an Associate in Business Operations and Strategy, you are the ultimate data expert and thrive on solving highly analytical problems, conducting interviews and synthesizing ideas. You will work with a small team on projects commissioned by Google’s executive team, managing your own workstream(s) as you go.

Responsibilities:

  • Structure complex, ambiguous, and potentially charged business issues for Google's executive team
  • Gather and analyze massive amounts of information expeditiously
  • Develop compelling, insightful recommendations
  • Build consensus among cross-functional teams and influence decision making within senior-level audiences
  • Lead execution against recommendations quickly and with flawless accuracy

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
  • 2 years of post-graduate level experience at a management consulting firm, corporate strategy organization, or investment bank

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Early stage company experience
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment; professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills; ability to be personable yet persistent
  • Superior modeling and presentation skills
  • Penchant for technology

jobs.title: Associate, Google Renewable Energy Investments - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Associate, Google Renewable Energy Investments - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google.org

The Energy and Sustainability Team strives to make Google a global leader in sustainability and clean energy. The team ensures that Google's operations are as sustainable as possible through innovative technologies and business practices. In addition, the team seeks ways to have a broader impact beyond our operations by catalyzing change externally.

The role: Associate, Google Renewable Energy Investments

As a member of the team, you'll be responsible for sourcing and assessing attractive renewable energy asset investments with a focus on emerging markets and technologies, and then helping lead project diligence and managing the deal process. You have electric power and renewable energy expertise, project finance deal experience, excellent judgment, and analytical, financial modeling and problem solving skills. You are comfortable working independently and leading / managing cross functional diligence teams. Sample projects include: assessing an emerging market for attractiveness, sourcing attractive investment opportunities within that market, and taking the right deal through diligence and closing; assessing emerging technologies with the potential to dramatically accelerate the pace of renewable energy growth and sourcing deals to help support that growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Assess priority markets and technologies for attractiveness and fit with Google’s renewable energy investment goals
  • Identify compelling investment opportunities within attractive markets and assess risks and returns of those projects
  • Coordinate with other teams at Google to complete a comprehensive due diligence process
  • Help ensure the success of Google’s renewable energy investments by monitoring and managing the performance of each project
  • Be a renewable energy expert, monitoring energy and renewable energy technology, policy, and investment trends while demonstrating deep expertise in specific technologies

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (in lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years combined experience in renewable energy consulting, management consulting with a renewable energy focus, and deal-focused roles in investment banking or private equity, ideally with renewable energy content
  • Demonstration of excellent performance through increasing levels of responsibility

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or graduate degree preferred in a management, technical, science, or engineering field.
  • 5 years experience in renewable energy investing particularly in cross-border deals
  • Demonstrated current knowledge of energy and renewable energy markets and technologies, important trends, and implications for Google.
  • Ability to juggle many priorities while structuring ambiguous problems and working independently with a focus on delivering high quality end product /results.
  • Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively and persuasively with highly technical management team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills and attention to detail with ability to be personable yet persistent.

jobs.content:
Associate, Google Sustainability - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Energy and Sustainability

The Energy and Sustainability Team strives to make Google a global leader in sustainability and clean energy. The team ensures that Google's operations are as sustainable as possible through innovative technologies and business practices. In addition, the team seeks ways to have a broader impact beyond our operations by catalyzing change externally.

The role: Associate, Google Sustainability

As a member of the team, you'll be responsible for defining, evaluating, advocating, and implementing the most impactful environmental strategies for Google, our users, and the world. Working cross-functionally, you can find yourself investing in large scale renewable energy projects or developing smart sustainable business solutions that scale beyond Google. You have extensive technical expertise, and analytical and problem solving skills. Sample projects include: building the strategic framework for clean energy procurement at Google’s offices, identifying innovative clean or efficient technologies we can deploy in our own operations, developing supply chain programs to ensure sustainability of our products and vendors, investing in innovative renewable energy projects, developing and implementing green benefit programs for employees, and devising ways to use Google's products to help our users be more sustainable.

jobs.content:
Business Analyst, Commerce Merchant Solutions - Mountain View

The area: New Products, Media and Platforms

The New Products, Media and Platforms (NPMP) group is the link between Product and Sales at Google. NPMP helps take product innovations and turns them into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of their spend with Google. NPMP team members ensure we have the right commercial strategy for our products and bring product expertise to Sales, enabling front-line Sales partners to sell effectively and quickly. We are passionate about all things digital and want to shape the ever-changing world of online advertising and commerce.

The role: Business Analyst, Commerce Merchant Solutions

The role of Business Analyst for the Commerce team is an integral part of Google's scaling effort. The candidate will provide mission critical analysis to support the business decisions and strategy, thus heavily influencing our business growth trajectory.

You will be responsible for analyzing financial terms to ensure optimal performance for both the partner and Google. You will perform market level analysis on the portfolio of partners to ensure optimization of revenue, based on factors including schedules, pricing, traffic, categorical volume mix etc. Further, you will conduct analysis on program performance, including segmentation approach. You will generate performance reports for both internal use and external consumption of our partners. Lastly, you will be responsible for forecasting, and assist in business planning process.

This role reports to the Local Market Category Manager role who manages a portfolio of markets. You will also work closely with other business functions including Sales Finance, and planning team.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for performing holistic analysis on specific partnership programs as well as quarterly and annual strategic planning and working closely with Sales Finance and planning team
  • Optimize revenue by analyzing factors including all aspect of program details, pricing, and traffic volume
  • Analyze program performances and generate reports for both internal and external use
  • Analyze user segmentations to advance our value proposition and further optimize our product offerings
  • Perform market level forecasting, planning, and recommend strategies to scale growth

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of work experience in sales-related planning and operations in the high tech field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 3 years of relevant work experience.
  • Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills - with experience interacting with senior-level executives.
  • Highly analytical, and demonstrated track record of strong problem solver and quantitative mind, capable of translating analytical insights into business strategies and actions.
  • Strong creativity and innovation in discovering actionable results and strategies and ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Business Strategist, Strategic Operations - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Business Strategist, Strategic Operations - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Business Strategist, Strategic Operations

Your job will be to spearhead these analyses and drive impactful change in the organization through a combination of opportunity identification, project management, data analysis, and executive-level presentation. You’ll be an individual contributor that will serve as an analytics and operations expert supporting one or more of the functional PQO teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in the data available in disparate sources and use this information to conduct business analyses and recommend improvements to our reporting infrastructure
  • Conduct complex data analysis and make recommendations (cost-benefit, risk-coverage-quality, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis) that significantly impact the organization
  • Use statistical techniques to model complex relationships between multiple sets of variables to develop new abuse detections signals, measure team impact, and prioritize abuse fighting methods
  • Create quantitative models including forecast, operational, and financial models of business dynamics; deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders; and understand Google’s product policy enforcement and risk strategy in order to effectively tailor data analysis and recommendations
  • Manage projects with multiple stakeholders both within and outside the organization, and identify and recommend opportunities to increase efficiency, quality, and impact to PQO leadership

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience
  • 4 years relevant work experience
  • SQL coding, Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, VBA macros etc.), ability to handle large data sets, and experience setting requirements for or developing performance dashboards.

Preferred Qualifications

  • BA or MS in statistics, or substantial experience implementing statistical models (including linear/logistic regressions and hypothesis testing)
  • 5 years of operational work experience in a global environment
  • Proficiency in R or another statistical programming language (Stata, Matlab, etc.); familiarity with programming languages (Python, Shell scripting, VBA, Java, PHP, JavaScript, C, etc.)
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize information to see big picture while effectively managing detail
  • Distinctive problem solving skills with a high degree of analytical rigor; proven experience identifying opportunities for business improvement, and defining and measuring the success of those initiatives
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills, including excellent presentation development with strong written and verbal communication skills
Apply now

jobs.title: Director of Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Director of Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Business Operations and Strategy

The Business Operations and Strategy team thinks strategically and globally about entire industries and helps Google define operational initiatives that contribute to the company's growth. Our team of highly creative visionaries thrives in deconstructing and re-creating businesses to meet changing strategic and operational needs, enable innovation, establish more efficient practices and help the company continue to achieve its vast potential. Our work includes such projects as developing and implementing next-generation advertising products, defining strategies to optimize operations, and establishing initiatives in emerging markets. We measure our effectiveness by monitoring the concrete impact we have on revenue, cost and operational efficiency.

The role: Director of Business Operations and Strategy

As a Director in Business Operations and Strategy, you'll provide the leadership, decision-making frameworks, analytic guidance and business judgment to drive two to three parallel projects that are generally aligned with one functional area. Your responsibilities may include developing the strategy for and leading the implementation of a next-generation advertising product, defining the strategy for the development of engineering data centers and designing the business system processes that will improve the management of Google’s increasing scale of operations. You'll also contribute thought leadership to project analyses, key presentations and white papers as well as drive best-practices sharing and continuous learning throughout the team. Successful performance in this job requires excellent problem-solving, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage high-performing teams and multiple projects at once.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with Google senior leadership to define and solve major strategic questions
  • Lead multiple cross-functional, global teams
  • Clearly communicate recommendations to senior management and drive recommendations through to implementation
  • Help manage the operations and direction of the Business Operations group
  • Provide ongoing mentorship and guidance to Business Operations staff (Associates and Principals)

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years management experience at a strategy consulting firm.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Graduate degree or equivalent technical degree in Computer Science or an Engineering program.
  • Operational experience (especially in P&L management roles) post-consulting career in the software, Internet, and/or media industries.
  • Strategic thinker with experience presenting solutions to senior-level audiences.
  • Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with highly technical management team.
  • Hands-on experience managing high-performing teams and a demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives.
  • Excellent and creative written and oral communication skills, with outstanding presentation skills.

jobs.title: Google.org Energy Associate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Google.org Energy Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google.org

Google.org uses Google’s strengths in information and technology to address global challenges and make a lasting impact. We seek innovative solutions and entrepreneurial approaches to issues such as crisis response, education, and access to technology.

The role: Google.org Energy Associate

Google.org's Energy team strives to increase global access to clean, reliable, affordable energy. The team aims to enable greater access through potential product development, strategic investments, policy actions or communications, and piloting new technologies or business models. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for defining, evaluating, advocating, and implementing energy strategies where Google can have the greatest impact on the world. Sample projects include: developing Google's strategy for accelerating advanced grid technologies, managing deployments of innovative energy technologies, and identifying and prioritizing potential investments in this area.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify/evaluate opportunities. Develop insightful recommendations on strategic direction and specific project opportunities that can accelerate progress towards the intelligent energy system of the future.
  • Perform analysis and research of technical and business issues associated with potential product ideas, technology deployments, and strategic investments. Act as thought-partner and power-sector expert within broader team.
  • Incubate projects. Find creative ways to structure and launch projects and leverage resources most effectively to have substantial impact.
  • Build compelling cases for projects that will build consensus among cross-functional teams and motivate executives. Advocate/champion projects with executives.
  • Lead project execution, delivering results quickly and effectively, and ensuring mature projects are well organized, staffed and delivering on desired goals.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a technical field (in lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 3 years experience in energy markets, smart grid, efficient building systems, or cleantech.
  • Demonstrated current knowledge of electric power sector technologies, markets, and policies, in the US and internationally, coupling in-depth, quantitative knowledge of specific technologies with broad understanding spanning everything from home energy control to high voltage transmission.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Electrical engineering or power systems engineering background with Master’s or PhD.
  • 3 years consulting experience or equivalent demonstration of ability to turn energy knowledge into compelling business recommendations.
  • Ability to structure ambiguous problems and work independently with a focus on delivering end product/results.
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with highly technical management team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills, ability to be personable yet persistent.

Google.org uses Google’s strengths in information and technology to address global challenges and make a lasting impact. We seek innovative solutions and entrepreneurial approaches to issues such as crisis response, education, and access to technology.

jobs.title: Pricing Strategy Associate - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Pricing Strategy Associate - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Business Operations and Strategy

The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational, and organizational improvements across the company. Founded in 2003, BizOps is a high-profile, high-impact team working with Google's businesses across the globe. BizOps works on a range of critical projects and issues -- from growth strategies for exciting products like YouTube, Chrome, and Mobile; to engineering prioritization and global sales force alignment; to partner development and strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India. As a member of the BizOps team, you are at the forefront in helping Google clarify fast-moving strategic priorities, tackle operational challenges, and enable innovation.

The role: Pricing Strategy Associate

As part of the Business Operations and Strategy Pricing team, you will drive initiatives with cross-functional teams, supporting the senior leadership at Google to craft innovative pricing strategies for new and established products. In this role you will bring analytical rigor, strategic insights and business judgment to pricing discussions. In addition, you will immerse yourself in data to draw out key insights and to persuasively communicate recommendations to senior-level executives and help drive key product and sales operational decisions.

As an Associate in Business Operations and Strategy, you are the ultimate data expert and thrive on solving highly analytical problems, conducting interviews and synthesizing ideas. You will work with a small team on initiatives commissioned by Google’s executive team, managing your own workstream(s) as you go.

Responsibilities:

  • Structure complex, ambiguous, and potentially charged business issues for Google's executive team.
  • Gather and analyze massive amounts of information expeditiously.
  • Build analytical models to inform and influence pricing discussions.
  • Develop compelling, insightful recommendations.
  • Build consensus among cross-functional teams and influence decision making within senior-level audiences.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years of experience at a management consulting firm, corporate strategy organization, or investment bank.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 6 years of relevant experience, with a technology focus.
  • Experience conducting Pricing analysis.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment, with professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation.
  • Strong modeling and presentation skills, experience and comfort with statistical modeling packages, and comfort with large datasets.
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to be personable yet persistent.
Apply now
