The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational, and organizational improvements across the company. Founded in 2003, BizOps is a high-profile, high-impact team working with Google's businesses across the globe. BizOps works on a range of critical projects and issues -- from growth strategies for exciting products like YouTube, Chrome, and Mobile; to engineering prioritization and global sales force alignment; to partner development and strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India. As a member of the BizOps team, you are at the forefront in helping Google clarify fast-moving strategic priorities, tackle operational challenges, and enable innovation

jobs.title: Principal, Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Principal, Business Operations and Strategy - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Business Operations and Strategy

The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational, and organizational improvements across the company. Founded in 2003, BizOps is a high-profile, high-impact team working with Google's businesses across the globe. BizOps works on a range of critical projects and issues -- from growth strategies for exciting products like YouTube, Chrome, and Mobile; to engineering prioritization and global sales force alignment; to partner development and strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India. As a member of the BizOps team, you are at the forefront in helping Google clarify fast-moving strategic priorities, tackle operational challenges, and enable innovation.

The role: Principal, Business Operations and Strategy

As part of the Business Operations and Strategy team, you are at the forefront of shaping Google from the inside out. Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges to solve and you'll work in small groups to find solutions. In the past, this team has built the strategic framework to guide Google's future investment strategy, identified opportunities for growth in new channels and markets and helped Google become even greener. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis and then zoom out to create big-picture recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives and drive implementation and project management.

As a Principal in Business Operations and Strategy, you will manage projects commissioned by Google’s executive team and lead a team of Associates by leveraging your sound business judgment and management, problem-solving, communication and analytical skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the company's senior executive leadership to define, launch, and drive strategic and operational initiatives
  • Structure and execute operational and strategic initiatives by developing work plans, gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses and developing final recommendations
  • Lead cross-functional, global teams to get work done
  • Communicate findings from initiatives to senior management and to the broader organization
  • Drive recommendations through to implementation and results

jobs.title: Principal, Google Sustainability - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Principal, Google Sustainability - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Energy and Sustainability Team

The Energy and Sustainability Team strives to make Google a global leader in sustainability and clean energy. The team ensures that Google's operations are as sustainable as possible through innovative technologies and business practices. In addition, the team seeks ways to have a broader impact beyond our operations by catalyzing change externally.

The role: Principal, Google Sustainability

As a member of the team, you'll be responsible for defining, evaluating, advocating, and implementing the most impactful environmental strategies for Google, our users, and the world. Working cross-functionally, you can find yourself investing in large scale renewable energy projects or developing smart sustainable business solutions that scale beyond Google. You have extensive technical expertise, and analytical and problem solving skills. Sample projects include: building the strategic framework for clean energy procurement at Google's offices, identifying innovative clean or efficient technologies we can deploy in our own operations, developing supply chain programs to ensure sustainability of our products and vendors, investing in innovative renewable energy projects, developing and implementing green benefit programs for employees, and devising ways to use Google's products to help our users be more sustainable.

Responsibilities:

  • Be the technical and implementation expert in several areas of sustainability, becoming the go-to resource within the company. Be a recognized thought leader in the space, keeping abreast of latest sustainability trends, especially those most relevant to Google’s operations and products.
  • Research and analyze technical and business issues as well as current best practices related to sustainability to build compelling cases for projects that will create excitement and consensus among cross-functional teams and motivate executives. Advocate/champion projects with executives.
  • Lead project planning, execution, and communication, delivering results quickly and effectively, and ensuring mature projects are well organized, staffed and delivering on desired goals.
  • Partner and/or lead cross-functional teams (Marketing, Policy, Real Estate, Product, and Engineering teams) to support strategies, engagement and approvals.
  • Be a leader on the team. Plan and manage multiple work streams and deliverables, while also providing insights and input on other team initiatives.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a technical field (in lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years experience in sustainability, cleantech, or management consulting with a focus on sustainability or energy.
  • Demonstration of excellent performance through increasing levels of responsibility.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or graduate degree in a management, technical, science, or engineering field.
  • 8 years experience at postgraduate level in sustainability, energy markets, infrastructure, efficient building systems, or cleantech.
  • Demonstrated current knowledge of sustainability issues facing technology firms and innovative approaches to address resource use (energy, water, fuels, materials), renewable energy, waste management, and operational and supply chain sustainability, with experience implementing some innovative projects in this area.
  • Ability to quickly structure ambiguous problems and work independently with a focus on delivering high quality end product/results.
  • Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively and persuasively with highly technical management team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills and attention to detail with ability to be personable yet persistent.

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager, Google TV - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Technical Account Manager, Google TV - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: YouTube and Video

The first video posted on YouTube was a 19-second clip called "Me at the Zoo." Today, more than 48 hours of video are uploaded every minute. The YouTube and Video team helps budding filmmakers and musicians build careers, creates products like Google TV and YouTube Live and runs collaborative projects like Life in a Day and the YouTube Symphony Orchestra. We are leading a change in how we entertain, inform and share with one another, whether through cat videos or footage of a revolution in progress.

The role: Technical Account Manager, Google TV

Inspire companies to "go Google." The Enterprise team at Google brings the power of cloud computing to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between your clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs, helping to increase revenue and drive new business opportunities. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.

Our relationships with external partners should run like well-oiled machines, and Google TV's Partner Solutions Organization (PSO) makes that happen. GTV's Technical Account Managers are technology consultants and liaisons between our external OEM, SOC and Content partners and Google's Engineering, Product and Partnerships teams. In this role, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations, application launches and integrations of a variety of our product lines (like Wallet, Shopping/Offers). As the resident technical expert, you also work closely with the Partnerships team to monitor our products' performance for our partners, you develop tools that address partners' technological and business needs and you identify opportunities that scale and grow Google's partnerships business.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for technical execution of strategic partner relationships within Google TV and end-to-end launches of Android applications targeting Google TV for top tier content partners.
  • Create and document new internal processes, and identify new and available tools that would be useful to help scale the internal operations of the platform.
  • Perform implementation reviews, evangelize new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
  • Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management and Engineering.
  • Troubleshoot the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS Degree (In lieu of degree, 7 years of relevant work experience).
  • 7 years of experience in a product management, engineering and technology strategy role.
  • 7 years hands-on experience with consumer electronics products and technologies.
  • Knowledge of, or experience in C/C++, Java, Python, and/or Android/Linux.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • Experience working with partners, systems integrators and third party developers to deliver successful solutions.
  • Excellent project management skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to speak to business stakeholders.
Apply now

jobs.title: Lead Associate, Global Alliance Development - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Lead Associate, Global Alliance Development - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Partnerships

There's always more information out there, and our Partnerships team works to get it. We develop relationships with a range of organizations, from content providers to publishers, and find ways for them to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. We find great content for our products, and we also work with partner sites to syndicate our own Google products. From negotiating agreements to solving technical problems for partners, we're in pursuit of gathering the world's information.

The role: Lead Associate, Global Alliance Development

Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for striking and negotiating deals with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line, building pipeline, negotiating deals and helping partners build sales and account management functions. You also manage revenue creation and growth with our partners as part of our next generation of product launches. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players help shape great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.

Responsibilities:

  • Structure complex, ambiguous, and potentially charged business development issues for Google's executive team.
  • Gather and analyze massive amounts of information on Google’s top partners expeditiously, working with all business development teams across Google.
  • Develop compelling, insightful recommendations to senior-level audiences to influence overall top partner strategies.
  • Lead execution against recommendations quickly and with flawless accuracy.
  • Additional Preferred Qualification: 3 years of related partner or project management experience in an Internet or search company.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years relevant work experience.

jobs.title: Manager, Partner Programs, Digital Content - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Manager, Partner Programs, Digital Content - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Mobile

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Our open-source Android operating system has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering hundreds of devices from smartphones to tablets. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.

The role: Manager, Partner Programs, Digital Content

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The Android team is looking for a creative and talented professional to drive partner programs that are focused on customer acquisition and revenue generation for Android’s digital content products and services. The Manager, Partner Programs, Digital Content will work with internal product teams and third party partnerships to develop and execute on partner programs, which may include affiliate partnerships, physical retail channel partnership, co-marketing partnerships, and other customized marketing/distribution partnerships. You will be creative but also data-driven, with a track record of developing and executing successful partner relationships for a consumer-facing digital media business.

Responsibilities:

  • Create and manage partner marketing and distribution programs for Android’s digital content offering; work closely with product teams to align partner requirements with product capabilities.
  • Coordinate implementation and ongoing execution of partnerships; develop automated approach for scaling programs.
  • Develop and operationalize key metrics to measure effectiveness of partner activities; continually optimize programs for conversion, upsell, profitability, and partner retention.
  • Use primary and secondary research as well as internal data to develop and maintain deep understanding of Android consumer base, particularly with respect to media purchasing and consumption patterns.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS/BA or in lieu of degree, 5 years of relevant experience.
  • Extensive experience in partnership engagement and management, with a track record of successful execution with a wide range of partner marketing and distribution programs.
  • Experience growing a user base and/or revenue via partner channels.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze research or performance data and iterate to optimize program targeting and execution.
  • Proven ability to manage cross-functional and cross-company teams and lead multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Apply now

jobs.title: Payments Specialist, Online Partnerships Group - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Payments Specialist, Online Partnerships Group - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: SMB Sales and Operations

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! As small business experts, we help get local entrepreneurs on the map, and deliver a beautifully simple, intuitive experience that enables customers to grow their businesses with us. By spotting and analyzing customer needs and trends, our innovative teams of strategists, account developers and customer support specialists work together on scalable solutions for each business, no matter its age or size.

The role: Payments Specialist, Online Partnerships Group

The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) grows Google's business with online publishers by helping them utilize tools from products such as AdSense and DoubleClick. Our team is made up of high-achieving specialists who work with partners in online advertising and e-commerce. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. On this team you proactively identify, develop, support and maximize revenue opportunities from existing and new partners. In OPG, we strive to exceed partner expectations through building, supporting and maintaining long-term win-win relationships.

As a Payments Specialist, you will help facilitate our complex payments disbursement process for AdSense as well as a host of smaller partner products. We are looking for a top performer to execute a wide range of payment process-oriented tasks and other core responsibilities, including data analysis, project management, issue resolution, etc. You will be joining a small, highly-leveraged global team that values innovation, problem-solving skills and teamwork. This position also entails working closely with other areas of the company, including Product, Finance, Treasury, and Engineering as well as various payment vendors. You will be expected to proactively contribute suggestions and implement process efficiencies to make the team as productive as possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Execute wide range of processes to ensure successful monthly payment disbursements
  • Exhibit strong competency in customer service and outgoing communications
  • Resolve specific customer issues on the back-end by working with engineers or solving via internal tools
  • Educate other parties within Google on the robust payments system, suggest improvements and how other teams/products may be able to benefit
  • Improve constantly the payments experience by expanding options, keeping competitor parity and extending options to more regions

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience using MS Excel and Powerpoint
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail, problem solving and organizational skills
  • Comfort working cross-functionally with Product, Finance, Treasury, and Engineering
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment
  • Customer service, analytical, and/or finance background
Apply now

jobs.title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Content Partnerships - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Strategic Partner Development Manager, Content Partnerships - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Partnerships

The Content Partnerships organization negotiates and manages the third-party relationships that help make Google’s product experiences magical. Whether Google’s billion-plus users are checking sports scores on google.com, or flying around the world on Google Earth, important elements of their beautiful and intuitive experiences are enabled by Google’s commercial relationships with third parties.

Googlers in Partnerships work side-by-side with colleagues in Product and Engineering to define Google’s product plans and then develop and execute the partnerships strategies that help enable Google’s products and services. With teams in 20 Google offices around the world, we contribute on a global scale to most Google products and services including: Search, Commerce (e.g. Shopping), Local (e.g. Maps), Digital Content (e.g. eBooks), and Social (e.g. Google+ games).

The role: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Content Partnerships

The Strategic Partner Development Manager’s (SPD) primary role is to negotiate content partnerships (e.g. data-licensing agreements) and other product-enabling commercial relationships for products our team supports - Commerce, Local, Google+ and Search properties. In this role you will apply your partnerships / business development skills, industry knowledge and product understanding to contribute to the launch and success of Google products and services worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Jointly develop product plans with technical stakeholders, taking into consideration how Google can best collaborate with relevant partner ecosystems.
  • Define partnership strategies, and go-to-market plans (e.g. value-exchange, goals, resources, pipelines).
  • Structure and negotiate partnerships agreements; lead cross-functional “deal-teams”.
  • Manage internal approvals processes; interact with senior internal executives from relevant functions (e.g. Product, Engineering, Legal, Operations, Finance).
  • Represent Google at partner and industry events. Provide feedback from partners, and market intelligence, to Google’s product teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (or, in lieu of degree: 4 years of relevant work experience)
  • 6 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • Relevant work experience at a start-up or an established company in any of the following roles: business development, product management, corporate strategy, consulting or investment banking.
  • Strategic thinker; able to solve complex problems and develop creative solutions.
  • Proven experience negotiating complex deals, ideally in the media or internet industries.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence all levels of management, cross-functionally and externally.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid and collaborative environment.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Strategic Partner Manager, Distribution - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Partnerships

There's always more information out there, and our Partnerships team works to get it. We develop relationships with a range of organizations, from content providers to publishers, and find ways for them to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. We find great content for our products, and we also work with partner sites to syndicate our own Google products. From negotiating agreements to solving technical problems for partners, we're in pursuit of gathering the world's information.

The role: Strategic Partner Manager, Distribution

Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You renew existing partnerships, optimize deals and upscale potential opportunities. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.

  • 6 years relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Relevant work experience at a start-up or an established company in any of the following roles: business development, relationship management, product management, corporate strategy, consulting or investment banking.

jobs.title: Communications Associate, Search - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Communications Associate, Search - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Communications

It's our job to help inform and educate users, advertisers, partners and opinion leaders about the benefits of Google's products, our distinctive company culture/values, and our approach to the big public policy issues of the day. We are looking for quick-witted, entrepreneurial and intellectually curious people to join the team. To succeed here, you'll need to be able to combine creativity with the organizational skills to manage numerous different projects to tight deadlines simultaneously, as well as enjoy pitching to all kinds of journalists, bloggers and commentators (we find it hard too!). Things happen quickly at Google, and to get stuff done here you need to be an enthusiastic team player - a self-starter who can work cross-functionally and isn't frightened to take risks or try out new ways of doing things.

The role: Communications Associate, Search

As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with all communications activities for specific areas of Search.
  • Collaborate with Google engineering, product, sales and marketing teams to create compelling communications strategies that illustrate the functionality and key benefits of our consumer applications.
  • Develop close, productive relationships with journalists, bloggers, product reviewers and our key partners in the consumer technology industry.
  • Develop written materials, including story pitches, messaging guidelines, press releases, Q&As, presentations and speeches.
  • Train and provide advice to company officials for press conferences, media interviews and trade presentations.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 2 years experience in business, media or non-profit environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment while maintaining good judgment.
  • A proven track record of producing consistent, concrete results supporting the team’s objectives.
  • Ability to work with colleagues in different countries and understand cultural differences.
  • Relationships with consumer press and/or deep familiarity with consumer technology.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Global Communications and Public Affairs Manager, Google.org - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Google.org

Google.org uses Google’s strengths in information and technology to address global challenges and make a lasting impact. We seek innovative solutions and entrepreneurial approaches to issues such as crisis response, education, and access to technology.

The role: Global Communications and Public Affairs Manager, Google.org

As our communications manager based in Mountain View, you will lead communications and public affairs outreach for Google.org and Google’s Charitable Giving. You will work across the communications and Google.org teams to develop and lead our public affairs strategy. Your outreach will include efforts to inform thought leaders and partners about Google’s philanthropic work, as well as proactive campaigns to advance our public policy goals among journalists, commentators, academics, other companies and third parties. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well-written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead communications for Google.org and Google’s broader philanthropic initiatives. Explain the goals, outcomes and opportunities for partnership for all of Google’s philanthropic efforts to external and internal audiences.
  • Direct messaging, media relations, rapid response and reputation management for all philanthropic efforts at Google, including Google.org, charitable grants, in-kind donations, and approximately $180M in charitable and academic support across the company.
  • Work with Marketing to develop websites, presentations and reports. Create and maintain a new website and an annual report on Google’s giving programs and outcomes.
  • Manage Google’s relationships and partnerships with academics, non-profit organizations, advocates, and colleagues in other companies.
  • Lead strategic communications for Google.org, including advocacy campaigns with partners to promote innovative solutions in areas such as education and development. Organize outreach for Google.org initiatives such as Crisis Response in the U.S. and globally.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree. In lieu of degree, 7 years of relevant experience
  • 5 years professional experience in a fast-paced business, media, or non-profit environment (or graduate degree plus 3 years work experience)
  • Experience managing crisis communications and serving as an on-the-record spokesperson on complex issues, particularly on public policy or legal matters
  • Demonstrated track record of creating public affairs campaigns and partnerships to achieve specific policy goals

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Masters in public policy or other relevant field
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal and written
  • Ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects simultaneously in an organized fashion

jobs.title: Communication Strategist - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Communication Strategist - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Communication Strategist

As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.

You are a fully rounded marketing leader, shaping the future of Google marketing. Across consumer products (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or business products (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you will be part of the core weaving each product's marketing story. Across all and any touch-point, too audiences big or small, you will help shape the narrative and voice of the product to help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development and marketing, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy. Communication Strategy is the art and science of distributing ideas across paid, earned, and owned media - all super-charged by technology. Communication Strategists holistically orchestrate how Google’s marketing ideas live, engage, and get passed on. You will devise strategies, manage the crafting of plans, their execution and evaluate performance across all touch-points. Communication Strategists understand how consumers think and feel. You conduct extensive market research and use quantitative analysis to better understand and meet our users' needs and to measure the effectiveness of our own marketing efforts. You will ask questions, uncover insights and tell stories from data and research.

Responsibilities:

  • Be part of the team that drives and executes a comprehensive marketing strategy.
  • Understand the mechanics of what is possible within media, but never limited by them.
  • Bring fresh eyes and solutions to all Google’s media challenges.
  • Work closely with outside agencies to lead and develop communication plans.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5 years work experience in marketing, preferably with exposure to cutting edge CE products, along with a solid understanding of the mechanics of the media buying/planning business.
  • A creative mindset; you can tell stories around consumers and imagine possibilities for big ideas that no one else has considered.
  • Interest in technology and online products, understanding of Google's strategic and competitive position.
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills and strong organizational skills.

jobs.title: Director, Brand Identity - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Director, Brand Identity - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Director, Brand Identity

You are a progressive, tech savvy, rules-breaking and big thinking Director, Brand Identity to help steward and extend the Google brand. In this role, you're expected to conceive and execute breakthrough ideas that will have as much impact in the history of creativity as Google's products have in technology. You are a seasoned creative leader who's not interested in managing a big group of people but who's driven to make great work. A creative with a killer reel, but also a healthy skepticism with traditional marketing mores. Someone who's looking to the future, and can communicate technology in a way everyone can understand. In addition, you will be expected to be a doer as well as a thinker, who does not settle for the expected and conventional, but works to push ideas beyond the norm.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with chief creative, product and business partners to come up with and execute BIG, never-been-done-before ideas with lasting impact to the Google brand.
  • Define marketing communications' creative direction across all platforms and innovating in the digital frontier
  • Work with advertising and media agencies, product managers, and internal marketing staff to strengthen the creative marketing output
  • Oversee all video production developed by Google’s in-house video production team
  • Foster outside agency relationships to develop a creative ecosystem globally

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA in English or Journalism. In lieu of degree, 12 years of relevant experience.
  • 12 years of experience in a world class creative agency leading creative for iconic global brands.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MA in English or Journalism.
  • Portfolio of original and breakthrough work.
  • Ability to thrive in a rapid paced environment on multiple projects in a scrappy, start-up atmosphere.
  • Great at rallying creatives to do the best work of their career.
  • Self-driven, fearless interest and curiosity in gadgets, inventions and world-changing leaps in technology, along with a healthy disrespect for the impossible.

The role: Head of Enterprise Product Marketing, Google

As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.

As the Product Marketing Lead for Google Enterprise, you’ll be at the nerve center of the organization, shaping product messaging, product capabilities, go-to-market plans, Sales enablement and internal business communications. You will work hand-in-hand with Product Managers, Engineering, Sales, Support, PR and other functions to maximize market awareness and improve the market’s understanding of our solutions in the context of competitive offerings. In this role, you will manage a team of product marketers across enterprise products (including Google Apps, Google Maps and Earth for Enterprise, Google Enterprise Search, Google Chromebooks, and Google Cloud Platform), a size-able budget for product launches and customer acquisition, and a diverse set of cross-functional stakeholders. This role requires excellent critical and creative thinking, strong written and verbal communication skills, a deep understanding of the business business technology landscape and an entrepreneurial bias to action.

Responsibilities:

  • Overall responsibility for Enterprise product messaging, branding and narrative development, in partnership with Product Management and PR. Budget and project management, with the ability to run multiple projects simultaneously and efficiently.
  • Development of all external product communications, including launch narratives, website content, product collateral, social content and press briefing materials. Development of product content for Sales enablement materials, tools and marketing assets.
  • Management of the Enterprise product launch calendar, around which many marketing and PR activities are arranged. Collection and synthesis of customer and market feedback to shape product development efforts.
  • Awareness and acquisition campaigns to generate sales pipeline and qualified leads for emerging products.
  • Team management, recruiting, performance reviews and career development.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 10 years work experience in product marketing, direct marketing, marketing program management or consulting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent analytical and quantitative reasoning skills.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
  • Experience planning and executing multiple, complex marketing programs including budget management.
  • Strong project management skills and experience, including managing external creative agencies, events vendors, and international projects.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager, Search Ads - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Marketing Manager, Search Ads - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Marketing Manager, Search Ads

This role offers the opportunity to work at the forefront of our search advertising business. Your job is to know our advertisers (and agencies), know the products, and connect them. Feature launches and adoption Our ads engineering and product teams are constantly working to develop better features, formats and algorithms that are useful to end users and valuable to advertisers -- large and small. You’ll work across sales, product management, engineering, PR, legal, webmasters, and other Google marketing teams to manage launch communications and drive good adoption of major features. You will be expected to prioritize launches according to business risk and impact. For major features, you’ll be responsible for naming, positioning, and messaging. When needed, you’ll gather research, data and insights to help make good decisions. You’ll push to understand use cases and how well we’re solving a customer’s problem. You’ll create and edit internal documents like positioning and naming briefs and external assets like blog posts and social media, web copy, sales collateral, case studies, demo scripts, videos, and help center content. You’ll think about potential objections and hard questions from critics and help develop the best responses. You’ll think about ways to create interest and demand. In some cases, you’ll plan and lead additional marketing tactics to launch features or drive adoption like direct marketing, online marketing, and event marketing. Above all, you’ll seek out the big gaps in the path to customer adoption and find creative ways to fill them.

You’re good at breaking complex things down and making them simpler. You love finding and sharing good stories. You love a perfect expression. You love analogies. Because it’s not always easy to communicate in ways that are simple, easy to understand, compelling, humble, human, and -- when possible -- interesting and fun. But that’s what we should sound like whenever we can. So you’ll push hard for these ideals in every communication. Making this role a bit more challenging and interesting, our sales and marketing teams are working hard to develop a more integrated approach across our various products, platforms and services with one common aim -- help our customers grow their business. So the strongest candidates will have some awareness of what’s happening in other areas of online marketing like display, video, analytics, social and mobile. You’ll be able to understand and articulate how search advertising and search features help customers achieve their direct response or brand building goals. This role reports to the Head of Search Ads Marketing who is based in Mountain View.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead global launches to drive internal and external readiness and successful adoption of search ads and new formats.
  • Create greater value for our advertisers by developing marketing materials and programs that help them learn about and execute more effectively and profitably.
  • Develop thought-leadership materials designed to accelerate our advertisers' (and the industry's) sophistication and profits.
  • Represent the voice of the customer. Fill gaps where we lack good understanding of what customers need or want.
  • Evangelize our best practices to our customers and our industry peers via events, webinars and other external communications channels.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 4 years experience in product marketing, marketing communications, or business-to-business sales.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of online advertising industry.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Ability to make the complex simpler without losing key ideas and messages.
  • Strong sense of personal initiative.
  • Creative flair to bring fresh ideas into product positioning and marketing campaigns.
  • High levels of comfort with ambiguity.
  • Strong project and budget management skills, preferably in a cross-functional capacity.
Apply now

jobs.content:
Product Marketing Manager, Enterprise Content Specialist - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Product Marketing Manager, Enterprise Content Specialist

As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.

In this role, you will be a senior creative marketing and product communications leader central to defining and shaping the way Google educates and engages high level decision makers about Google’s Enterprise solutions. You will find innovative ways to drive fresh thinking in the industry by engaging audiences with compelling messaging and assets through our web properties and marketing campaigns. You will find new ways to craft compelling and meaningful messaging and assets that connect our customers’ needs with our product capabilities. You will establish and maintain an ongoing conversation with customers, partners and a broad range of people across Google to appropriately represent our brand while capturing the imagination of our customers. You will manage a wide range of agencies to deliver a wide range of assets in various formats - including HTML5 and video - that are closely aligned with our global campaigns and initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and build innovative marketing strategies and plans to drive education, engagement and adoption of our Enterprise solutions.
  • Establish a deep understanding of our customers, our brand and our products to build compelling and meaningful messaging and assets.
  • Work extensively with external creative agencies and internal creative teams across Google to deliver new content for our website and marketing campaigns.
  • Develop thought-leadership materials, including client and executive presentations, case studies and other content designed to accelerate our business momentum and better engage Google's customers.
  • Lead development of our value propositions, working closely with sales, PR and our market insights team.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of education, 10 years work experience in product marketing, direct marketing, marketing program management or consulting.
  • Experience in creative services, product marketing, marketing communications and/or PR.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • Experience in business technology market with familiarity of IT systems; including SaaS, enterprise search and geospatial products.
  • Outstanding presentation and communication skills, with creative flair to bring fresh ideas into product positioning and marketing campaigns.
  • Strong project management skills and experience, including managing external creative agencies across a wide range of assets and formats
  • A self starter who is willing to operate at a highly strategic level, as well as being open to collaborating internally and externally
Apply now

jobs.title: Consumer Product Lead, Google Offers - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Consumer Product Lead, Google Offers - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Commerce and Local

There's always more information out there, and often, the information that matters most is what's nearest to you. The Commerce and Local team is made up of our geography and e-commerce experts. When we're not mapping the Amazon rainforest, we're helping you buy a bike, recommending the best slice of pizza within pedaling distance, providing directions on how to get there, and letting you pay for it via your phone. From Google Maps and Google Places to Google Offers and Google Wallet, the Commerce and Local team helps our users navigate the world around them.

The role: Consumer Product Lead, Google Offers

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable revenue streams. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers and then zoom out to lead matrix teams such as Sales, Marketing and Finance, to name a few. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you can be part of shaping Google's next game-changer.

The Consumer Product Lead will be a flexible, results-oriented, and experienced senior Product Leader who will drive numerous initiatives to deliver top consumer experiences. You will have visionary product insight, technical expertise and leadership and business skills. You will the vision, development and management of all Google offers products that are consumer facing-- yes, it's a big job! This is an opportunity to make current products even better, and blaze a trail to develop new offers-related products. The successful candidate will have the technical aptitude to work with a world class engineering team combined with the business sense to drive product goals and strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Define product vision and strategy for Google Offers consumer-facing products – including website and mobile apps.
  • Test and optimize products and features to drive engagement and conversion.
  • Establish partnerships with other Google teams to drive the growth of Offers through integration with Google properties.
  • Engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule.
  • Lead and mentor a team of Product Managers

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).
  • 7 years of experience in a product management, engineering and technology strategy role.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA or advanced technical degree.
  • Excellent communication skills and experience working effectively with senior leaders, peers, and direct reports.
  • A deep understanding of the Comparison Shopping arena.
  • Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements and convert them into a winning product vision.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.
  • Strong product management experience with a track record of creating innovative and winning Internet or software solutions.
Apply now

Product Marketing Manager, Cloud Platform Lead - Mountain View

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. The role: Product Marketing Manager, Cloud Platform Lead

Shape the future of how technology is used in the workplace and be part of an entrepreneurial team in a rapidly growing business. As an enterprise developer product marketing manager, you will craft and execute campaigns to increase awareness and adoption of Google’s application platform offerings, such as Google App Engine for Business, Google Storage for Developers and Google Apps Marketplace. You will work closely to shape go-to-market messaging and strategy for new developer offerings, create materials to help businesses learn about the capabilities for developers, test and optimize new marketing programs, and work with companies that offer add-on functionality for Google Apps customers through the Apps Marketplace. This is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to be a leader in B2B technology marketing.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide marketing support for Google Apps and Developer launches, including development of messaging, creative assets and training for sales representatives
  • Drive awareness and sales growth of Google Apps platform and developer products, including Google Apps Marketplace, Google App Engine for Business, Google Developer Storage and Google APIs
  • Partner with sales to develop lead generation programs appropriate for products
  • Work with Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies, to market integrated software offerings to business customers. Work with System Integration partners to develop solutions around Google’s platform
  • Analyze data and provide visibility of trends for product marketing and sales leadership

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree. In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience.
  • 3 years marketing experience with software, infrastructure or platform-as-a-service technologies.
  • Experience in the business technology market and in working closely with an inside sales organization to drive demand.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager, Consumer Electronics, Android - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Product Marketing Manager, Consumer Electronics, Android - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Marketing

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--breaking the rules, redefining the medium, making the user the hero, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The role: Product Marketing Manager, Consumer Electronics, Android

As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.

The Product Marketing team partners with Engineering, Product Management, and Sales to encourage usage and create satisfied consumers of Google products. We conduct extensive market research and use quantitative analysis to better understand and meet our users' needs and to measure the effectiveness of our own marketing efforts. Product Marketing also works with our Ads product teams to communicate to advertisers and users the value they gain from using Google products. As new advertising technologies are introduced to prospective customers, we develop messaging, collateral, events, and sales strategies to ensure their success. Android has taken the mobile world by storm, and continues to be an area of strategic importance to Google. As Product Marketing Manager, Consumer Electronics, Android, you will work with internal teams to market to consumers the latest products being created by Android engineers.

Responsibilities:

  • Be part of the team that drives and executes a comprehensive marketing strategy for Android.
  • Serve as a true product and consumer electronics industry expert internally and vis-a-vis our co-marketing partners.
  • Develop marketing and advertising campaigns for Android products. Develop retail channel marketing strategies for Android products. Drive execution of those strategies working cross-functionally within Google and with retail partners.
  • Work closely with outside agencies to develop campaign creative.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 7 years of work experience in consumer electronics marketing, at least some of which with a leading provider of innovative, cutting-edge CE products.
  • Demonstrable understanding of the mobile industry and Google/Android’s position in it.
  • Strong organizational, leadership, and analytical skills as well as outstanding written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong knowledge of digital and retail marketing.
  • Strong aptitude for determining the optimal way to position products in the market.
Apply now

jobs.title: Commercial Counsel, Enterprise - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Commercial Counsel, Enterprise - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for tackling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you tackle unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

The role: Commercial Counsel, Enterprise

As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

As the emerging leader in cloud computing, Google's Enterprise division delivers cloud services and other IT products to small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies. Google’s Mountain View based Enterprise Legal team works on a broad range of issues, projects and deals related to Google’s Enterprise business. The team provides support for these businesses by negotiating agreements with small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies, drafting and improving forms and providing ongoing legal, business and operational advice and counseling to the Sales organization as well as other internal groups (e.g., Compliance, Finance, Operations, Product, Policy, Public Relations).

Responsibilities:

  • Review, draft and negotiate licenses, intellectual property agreements, services agreements and/or sales contracts on a daily basis.
  • Respond promptly to legal requests from Licensing, Business Development, Advertising Sales, Marketing and other clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts for successful business application.
  • Support development and sales of software products designed for use by government and enterprise customers.
  • Support the continuous improvement of standard form agreements and legal processes.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • JD degree.  In lieu of degree, 3 years of relevant experiences.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Extensive background in drafting and negotiating services agreements, sales contracts, licenses and intellectual property agreements.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience in a law firm or in-house legal department.
  • Demonstrated experience drafting and negotiating outbound licenses, intellectual property agreements, services agreements and/or sales contracts.
  • Demonstrated experience advising clients in structuring complex commercial transactions, including sales or licenses of products designed for enterprise or government clients.
Apply now

With a company growing at such fast speeds, every day another deal is made to keep Google running. As a member of the Legal Contracts team, you are the face of Google when it comes to negotiating contracts. You review, negotiate and revise contracts -- often juggling several contracts at a time. You develop practical and innovative ways to meet Google's needs and keep the company thriving, with the ability to affect Google's long-term goals. You work with both internal clients and external customers with the goal of finalizing contracts that keep Google on its feet.

  • Manage internal training related to improvement processes.

  • BA degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

Preferred Qualifications:

jobs.title: Corporate Counsel, Commercial - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Corporate Counsel, Commercial - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

Google Legal is a close-knit team of lawyers and legal professionals who operate on a truly global stage. We take pride in working for a company with a clear mission ("to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful") and a real soul ("don't be evil"). Google's innovative services raise challenging legal questions that demand creative and practical answers. We work at the crossroads of new technologies and existing laws to provide those answers, helping Google build innovative and important products for our users around the world. If this sounds like your kind of place, it probably is.

The role: Corporate Counsel, Commercial

You are an experienced attorney who will focus on commercial transactions – negotiating, drafting and analyzing a wide variety of licensing, sales, strategic alliance and development agreements. The breadth of your client base means that you'll be exposed to practically every department throughout Google – and you'll also be closely involved in the development and launch of new products. You'll advise our clients on the various legal risks, business strategies and other issues related to commercial deals, and you'll also assist with the continuous development of the commercial team and its processes. Diligent and proactive, you bring excellent business judgment and strategic thinking, along with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a collegial, fast-paced team environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Review, draft and negotiate licenses and intellectual property agreements, advertising services agreements and sales contracts on a daily basis.
  • Negotiate agreements that comply with company policies and risk tolerance.
  • Respond promptly to legal requests from Licensing, Business Development, Advertising Sales, Marketing and other clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts that business people can use.
  • Advise business clients, as well as Finance and other company colleagues, on the legal issues and risks, complex deal structures, approval processes, company policies and procedures, IP and negotiation strategy.
  • Support the continuous improvement of standard form agreements and legal processes.

Requirements:

  • JD degree or equivalent with excellent academic credentials preferred.
  • In-depth experience in business development, intellectual property matters and contract law.
  • Demonstrated experience advising clients in structuring complex commercial transactions, including new media content agreements.
  • Background in drafting and negotiating licenses and intellectual property agreements, services agreements and sales contracts.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage several simultaneous projects under deadline pressure.
  • Superior English communication skills, both verbally and in writing.

jobs.title: Corporate Counsel, Mergers and Acquisitions - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Corporate Counsel, Mergers and Acquisitions - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

Google Legal is a close-knit team of lawyers and legal professionals who operate on a truly global stage. We take pride in working for a company with a clear mission ("to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful") and a real soul ("don't be evil"). Google's innovative services raise challenging legal questions that demand creative and practical answers. We work at the crossroads of new technologies and existing laws to provide those answers, helping Google build innovative and important products for our users around the world. If this sounds like your kind of place, it probably is.

The role: Corporate Counsel, Mergers and Acquisitions

As a Corporate M&A Attorney you will focus on all aspects of mergers and acquisitions as well as investments. You are a talented attorney who can work independently but collaboratively on a collegial team within a fast-paced legal department. You will be expected to manage a variety of M&A and investment transactions, have the presence and ability to advise senior management, and have the entrepreneurial spirit to contribute to the management and direction of a constantly evolving business.

Responsibilities:

  • Work extensively with Google’s management, corporate development and business development groups to structure and negotiation acquisitions and investments. Advise on legal matters affecting acquisition transactions, including corporate, tax (including the treatment of employee equity), intellectual property, 280G and 409A matters.
  • Develop legal strategy on specific M&A transactions as well as across multiple transactions and complex legal and regulatory issues.
  • Provide legal support for special project, including joint ventures, equity investments, earn-outs and milestone arrangements.
  • Provide legal support for the Board of Directors and its subcommittees.
  • Provide education and advice on corporate and M&A matters across various departments within Google, including finance, legal, product management and engineering.

Requirements:

  • J.D. degree preferred with strong academic record. Admitted to the California Bar a plus.
  • At least 6 years corporate, M&A, securities, investment, and other transactional experience with a nationally recognized law firm.
  • Broad experience advising business personnel and senior management on strategic M&A, investments, and corporate finance activities globally, including acquisitions, divestitures, corporate reorganizations, JVs, equity investments, and financings.
  • Extensive hands-on public and private M&A experience, including structuring, negotiating, and drafting principle agreements and leading cross-functional teams.
  • Conversant in a broad range of legal issues impacting M&A transactions in the technology space, including tax, intellectual property and employment issues. Ability to distill and prioritize complex and urgent legal issues.
  • Sound business judgment, clear communication and strategic thinking. Flexibility, initiative and willingness to work on a broad variety of legal matters.
  • Hard-working, problem-solving and able to manage numerous projects and teams simultaneously under deadline pressure. Excellent interpersonal skills, sense of humor and team-oriented.
Apply now

jobs.title: Ethics and Compliance Counsel, Data Security and Privacy Compliance - Mountain View
jobs.content:
Ethics and Compliance Counsel, Data Security and Privacy Compliance - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for tackling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you tackle unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

The role: Ethics and Compliance Counsel, Data Security and Privacy Compliance

As Ethics and Compliance Counsel (Data Security and Privacy Compliance), you'll play a key role in Google's compliance with security and privacy requirements regarding all forms of regulated data, including personal information. These would include compliance requirements regarding the collection, processing, storage, disclosure, and disposal of user data, employee data, and other types of data. You'll be expected to work closely with legal subject matter experts, and also cross-functionally with business and other stakeholders, to support an effective program. As a member of the Ethics and Compliance team, you'll also participate in Google's code of conduct and other company - wide ethics and compliance activities. Among your many attributes, you communicate clearly and display excellent ethical judgment. You'll also have excellent people skills, and be self-motivated and a self-starter.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in establishing and maintaining data compliance programs.
  • Provide legal advice in connection with data protection requirements.
  • Provide advice with regard to data incidence.
  • Work with regional offices, counsel, and security staff to implement training and awareness regarding internal security and privacy requirements.
  • Participate in Google's code of conduct and other company-wide ethics and compliance activities, training, and answering ethics and compliance related queries, and investigating allegations of ethics and compliance related employee misconduct.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctorate (JD) degree.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 3 years of in-depth, related experience.
  • Experience and familiarity with regulatory and privacy sector data compliance requirements, including PCI, GLBA, FISMA, EU data protection requirements, and state privacy / security laws.
  • Experience and familiarity with requirements regarding handling employee data.
  • Experience in designing and implementing compliance programs; demonstrated project management skills.
  • First-rate written and verbal communication skills.
  • In-house compliance experience.
Apply now

The area: Legal

The role: Legal Analyst, Trust and Safety Investigator

Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. The Trust & Safety team investigates significant fraud, abuse, and other malicious activity across Google’s products and services worldwide. You will be responsible for building and managing a pipeline of investigations and collaborating with the Risk, Abuse, Engineering, Operations and Security teams to drive cases to resolution. Trust & Safety investigations often lead to reports to law enforcement, civil remedies, and recommendations for improvements in systems and/or operational processes.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct investigations into product-related fraud, criminal activity and other malicious behavior on Google services.
  • Generate leads from a variety of internal and external sources and drive cases to appropriate resolution.
  • Document and communicate results of investigations to a variety of audiences, including legal team members, management, product teams and law enforcement.
  • Prioritize and manage multiple investigations simultaneously.
  • Collaborate and build relationships with industry, academia, non-profits and other entities.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA degree (In lieu of degree, 6 years of work experience).
  • 4 years relevant work experience in investigating or researching Internet based fraud or abuse.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 4-6 years of relevant work experience in investigating or researching Internet-based fraud or abuse.
  • Experience collecting, managing and synthesizing large data sets and information from disparate sources.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, communication and leadership skills.
  • Ability to work independently and handle a large workload.
  • Ability to build effective relationships with stakeholders both inside and outside the company.

jobs.content:
Legal Assistant, Products and Agreements - Mountain View  

Apply now

This position is based in Mountain View, CA.

The area: Legal

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for tackling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you tackle unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

The role: Legal Assistant, Products and Agreements

Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.

Legal Assistants for Google’s Products and Agreements group will be called on to perform a wide variety of critical support and administrative tasks. This position requires self-confident, detail-oriented and patient individuals capable of processing large workloads. This position is ideal to gain experience in a legal environment prior to going to law school. You should have some knowledge about Google products and services. Required tasks include routing contracts for signature, processing non-disclosure agreements, and responding to requests for contracts. In addition, you will be asked to perform many one-off tasks including due diligence, processing other standard agreements, and integrity checking.

Responsibilities:

  • Route contracts for signature. This includes tracking the contracts and following up to ensure that they come back, as well as scanning, data entry, and filing.
  • Process standard non-disclosure agreements.
  • Review and respond to requests for contracts. Most requests are not straightforward, so this requires thinking outside the box and diligence.
  • Perform a full range of administrative tasks and correspondence.
  • Facilitate communication of process and policy to internal and external customers.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience)
